{"code":1,"isDone":false,"toInsertArticleList":[{"createdTime":"2020-09-05 14:45:18","updatedTime":"2020-09-05 14:45:18","title":"20+ Creative Resume CV Design Tips (With Template Examples for 2020)","link":"https://business.tutsplus.com/articles/11-creative-resume-designcv-tips-with-template-examples-for-2019--cms-25478","description":"<p>Are you hunting for that dream role at a creative company? You'll need to dust off your old creative resume or CV and give it a modern refresh. </p><p>But how can you make sure that—out of all the applicants—it’s <i>your</i> resume that catches your future employer’s eye? </p><figure class=\"post_image\"><a href=\"https://elements.envato.com/cv-resume-MTCCD5Z\" rel=\"external\" target=\"_blank\"><img alt=\"Creative Resume Format\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/1223/posts/34658/image/Creative%20Resume.jpeg\"></a><figcaption><a href=\"https://elements.envato.com/cv-resume-MTCCD5Z\" rel=\"external\" target=\"_blank\">Creative Resume Format</a> from Envato Elements.</figcaption></figure><p>Today <strong>we look at eleven creative resume design tips</strong> for overhauling the format, layout, and structure of your resume. We also share creative resume examples and templates throughout the post, visually demonstrating these resume design tips in action<strong> so you can readily put them to work for you</strong>.<br></p><p>When you're ready to create your own resume, check out <a href=\"https://design.tutsplus.com/tutorials/design-a-creative-resume--cms-25522\" rel=\"external\" target=\"_blank\">this tutorial on designing a creative resume</a> in Adobe InDesign. You can also browse the full selection of <a href=\"https://elements.envato.com/graphic-templates/resume\" target=\"_self\">creative CV examples</a> at Envato Elements and <a href=\"https://graphicriver.net/graphics-with-creative-in-print-templates/stationery/resumes\" rel=\"external\" target=\"_blank\">creative resume templates</a> at GraphicRiver to get even more inspiration.<strong> </strong><br></p><ul class=\"roundup-block__contents posts--half-width roundup-block--list\"><li class=\"roundup-block__content\"><a class=\"roundup-block__content-link\" href=\"https://business.tutsplus.com/articles/25-creative-resume-templates-to-land-a-new-job-in-style--cms-26395\"><img class=\"roundup-block__preview-image\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/988/posts/26395/preview_image/creative-resume-templates%20(Preview).jpg\"><div class=\"roundup-block__primary-category topic-business\">Resumes</div>\n<div class=\"roundup-block__content-title\">35 Creative (Dynamic) Resume CV Templates: For Professional Jobs in 2020\n</div>\n<div class=\"roundup-block__author\">Sean Hodge</div></a></li></ul><h2>Tip 1. Use Columns to Maximize on Space</h2><p>One thing that's an absolute nightmare for employers tasked with trawling through resumes by the bucketload is encountering resumes that are more than one page long. <br></p><p>Sure, you might want to go into detail about that part-time training course you took seven years ago. But, frankly, all your future employer wants to know is how that qualification is relevant to the job you’re applying for. </p><p>The best advice for how to design a resume/CV? <em>Keep it short and sweet.</em> Edit out qualifications and details that are irrelevant to the role. You’ll find that editing your text down to fill just one page is tricky, but it’s well worth it. You’ll appear concise, organized and you’ll also be highlighting only the most important, and best, information about yourself. This is going to make your resume easy-to-digest and a doddle to print (<em>you’re welcome, environment</em>). </p><p>But how can you even begin to fit all your wonderful achievements on just one sheet of paper?</p><p>There are some creative CV/resume design techniques you can use to maximize the space on your one page, without forcing the layout to feel overcrowded. One tip is to try splitting your resume layout into two sections, with a narrow column running down the left- or right-side of the page, as shown below</p><figure class=\"post_image\"><a href=\"https://elements.envato.com/pro-resume-3-D8XNFE\" rel=\"external\" target=\"_blank\"><img alt=\"Creative Resume Format\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/988/posts/32447/image/Creative%20Resume%20Format2.jpg\"></a><figcaption><a href=\"https://elements.envato.com/pro-resume-3-D8XNFE\" rel=\"external\" target=\"_blank\">Creative Resume Format  example</a> with functional columns and organized layout format.</figcaption></figure><p>Place shorter sections of information, like a brief bio, skills, software competencies, languages and contact details in the column, along with a photo in the same column. Switch up the background color of the column to keep it visually distinctive.<br></p><p>Placing more detailed chunks of information, such as your job experience, education and qualifications, in the other wider column will help maximize the limited space available in your creative resume layout.</p>\n<h2>Tip 2. Resume Layout Structure Is All-Important</h2><p>Though it may be dull, organization is the key to a successfully designed resume. You want the design of your creative resume format to be well planned and organized.<br></p>\n<p>Once you've edited down your content to one-page’s worth, visually separate that information into digestible chunks. Imagine you’ve been sitting at your desk looking at resumes all day. You sure aren't going to linger long over someone’s essay-long summary of the internship they did last summer. </p><p>Don’t lump all your information together. Use a grid structure for your layout, with columns and rows, visual dividers and white space to section out all the data you’re presenting to the reader. This will also make it much easier for them to refer to individual items of information in conversation with a colleague or during an interview. </p><p>Make your creative resume a pleasure to read, not a chore. Keeping your information visually organized is going to help you achieve this. </p><p>Take a look at this <a href=\"https://graphicriver.net/item/ultra-clean-resume/7326572\" rel=\"external\" target=\"_blank\">simple-yet-striking resume</a> template, and particularly at how the information is sectioned up.</p><figure class=\"post_image\"><a href=\"https://graphicriver.net/item/ultra-clean-resume/7326572\" target=\"_self\"><img alt=\"simple structured resume\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/114/posts/25478/image/Structure.png\"></a><figcaption><a href=\"https://graphicriver.net/item/ultra-clean-resume/7326572\" rel=\"external\" target=\"_blank\">Clean, well-formatted Creative Resume Template</a>.</figcaption></figure><p>This creative resume layout is based on a simple grid structure with two columns, and plenty of white space. The different sections are clearly marked out and divided from each other with subheadings and lines.</p><figure class=\"post_image\"><a href=\"https://graphicriver.net/item/ultra-clean-resume/7326572\" target=\"_self\"><img alt=\"resume with grid\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/114/posts/25478/image/Structure_grid.png\"></a><figcaption><a href=\"https://graphicriver.net/item/ultra-clean-resume/7326572\" rel=\"external\" target=\"_blank\">Creative Resume Template</a> with underlying grid formatting shown.</figcaption></figure><p>It may seem a “well, duh!” sort of tip, but you’d be amazed at how many people crowd their resumes with waffle. Be brave and clinical. Create a resume that’s as well-organized as the company’s filing system. It'll say something about your personality to your potential employer—your organizational skills and efficiency being immediately clear.</p><h2><b>Tip 3. Put the Impressive Stuff Above the Fold</b></h2><p>The term above the fold comes from the world of newspapers and refers to the top half of a folded newspaper, the area that people see first before. This top half is prime real estate and so the most important news items are placed there. </p><p>The same principle applies when approaching how to design a CV/resume as well. The top half is the area your potential employer will see and focus on first. So, don't waste space with huge headers for your name and contact details across the top of the page. </p><figure class=\"post_image\"><a href=\"https://elements.envato.com/resume-abby-S6MYZM\" rel=\"external\" target=\"_blank\"><img alt=\"creative resume format \" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/988/posts/32447/image/Creative%20Resume%20Format3.jpg\"></a><figcaption>This <a href=\"https://elements.envato.com/resume-abby-S6MYZM\" rel=\"external\" target=\"_blank\">creative resume template</a> make good use of the space above the fold.</figcaption></figure><p>This <a href=\"https://elements.envato.com/resume-abby-S6MYZM\" target=\"_self\">creative resume format</a> uses a personalized header but consigned it to the left column, so that the summary and work experience fit above the fold. <br></p><h2>Tip 4. Include Direct Links To Your Social Media Profiles</h2><p>Consider including direct links to your social media profiles or your website. More than likely, the recruiters will search your name online to get a sense of your past work or experiences. Don’t leave it to chance and instead make it easy for them to find you online.</p><figure class=\"post_image\"><a href=\"https://elements.envato.com/cv-resume-5YFK5FK\" target=\"_self\"><img alt=\"This creative resume template makes it easy to add social links\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/1223/posts/35566/image/CV%20Resume%20With%20Social%20Links.jpeg\"></a><figcaption>This <a href=\"https://elements.envato.com/cv-resume-5YFK5FK\" rel=\"external\" target=\"_blank\">creative resume template</a> makes it easy to add social links.</figcaption></figure><h2>Tip 5. Combine Different Fonts</h2><p>Using only one font throughout your resume would result in a pretty boring resume design. There are thousands of beautiful and free or low cost fonts available online. So, there’s no excuse to stick to the same old boring fonts everyone else is using.</p><p>Consider using one font for creative resume headings and one font for your body text. You can also experiment with different font weights.</p><figure class=\"post_image\"><a href=\"https://elements.envato.com/cv-resume-2EKMRTC\" target=\"_self\"><img alt=\"Combine Different Fonts\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/1223/posts/35566/image/CV%20resume.jpeg\"></a><figcaption>Combining two different fonts together will help you establish a nice hierarchy and make your resume easier to read like in this <a href=\"https://elements.envato.com/cv-resume-2EKMRTC\" rel=\"external\" target=\"_blank\">creative resume example</a>. </figcaption></figure><h2>Tip 6. Catch the Eye With Resume Infographics</h2><p>Infographic design details are a great way of introducing a more unique look to your resume, while looking data-driven and professional.<br></p><p>How to achieve the infographic look? First, divide your resume layout up into a grid with two columns and four or five rows. Focus on placing one section of ‘data’ into each square of the grid, whether that’s your list of awards and certificates, or your educational history.</p><figure class=\"post_image\"><a href=\"https://graphicriver.net/item/infographic-style-resume-template/6254346\" rel=\"external\" target=\"_blank\"><img alt=\"infographic resume\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/988/posts/32447/image/Infographic-resume%20(1).jpg\"></a><figcaption><a href=\"https://graphicriver.net/item/infographic-style-resume-template/6254346\" rel=\"external\" target=\"_blank\">Infographic-Style Resume Template</a> to catch the eye.</figcaption></figure><p>Transform each section of data into its own individual infographic. <br></p><figure class=\"post_image\"><a href=\"https://graphicriver.net/item/infographic-style-resume-template/6254346\" target=\"_self\"><img alt=\"infographic sample\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/114/posts/25478/image/Infographic-2.png\"></a><figcaption>Example of transforming data from this <a href=\"https://graphicriver.net/item/infographic-style-resume-template/6254346\" target=\"_self\">Infographic-Style Resume Template</a>.</figcaption></figure><p>Try transforming your list of past jobs into an experience timeline, ordered chronologically. Use graphic icons to represent different skills or hobbies. (Take a look at the huge range of free icons available at <a href=\"https://www.flaticon.com/\" rel=\"external\" target=\"_blank\">flaticon.com</a> if you don’t fancy creating your own from scratch.) </p><p>Use the shape tools in your design software of choice to create simple charts and graphs to represent your language skills or software experience.</p><figure class=\"post_image\"><a href=\"https://graphicriver.net/item/infographic-style-resume-template/6254346\" target=\"_self\"><img alt=\"infographic for skills\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/114/posts/25478/image/Infographic-3.png\"></a><figcaption>Example of editing skills data from this <a href=\"https://graphicriver.net/item/infographic-style-resume-template/6254346\" target=\"_self\">Infographic-Style Resume Template</a>.</figcaption></figure><p>Check out <a href=\"https://design.tutsplus.com/tutorials/create-a-super-simple-infographic-template-in-adobe-indesign--cms-22083\" rel=\"external\" target=\"_blank\">this simple tutorial</a> on creating your own infographic elements in Adobe InDesign. Use them to embellish your resume layout.</p><p>One final tip for infographic styles—keep your colors pared-back, neutral and minimal. With all those graphic elements going on, you’ll want to keep the design looking ultra-professional. </p><h2>Tip 7. Make a Nod to Your Profession</h2><p>Odds are, you're looking for a role that'll make good use of your skillset. If this is the case, fine-tune the design of your resume to make a nod to your chosen profession.<br></p><p>For example, if you’re a publishing designer, make your resume look a little bookish. Use classic typefaces like Caslon and Baskerville. Structure the layout to mimic a beautifully typeset book page.</p><p>If you’re a web designer, take inspiration from this <a href=\"https://elements.envato.com/cv-resume-5PE2B2H\" rel=\"external\" target=\"_blank\">digital-inspired resume template</a> and give your layout a digital-inspired design with neon pops of color, data-like icons and bars, and a precise, clean-cut layout. Just like a beautifully designed web page, right?</p><figure class=\"post_image\"><a href=\"https://elements.envato.com/cv-resume-5PE2B2H\" rel=\"external\" target=\"_blank\"><img alt=\"Creative CV Resume Template\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/1223/posts/34658/image/5.%20CV%20Resume.jpeg\"></a><figcaption><a href=\"https://elements.envato.com/cv-resume-5PE2B2H\" rel=\"external\" target=\"_blank\">Creative CV Resume Template</a> with a digital-inspired design.</figcaption></figure><p>Use your creative resume as an opportunity to show off your design skills in practice. This will make the look of your resume a great talking point at the interview stage and will showcase your enthusiasm for your career of choice. </p><h2>Tip 8. Know When to Keep It Simple</h2><p>So, I’ve encouraged you so far to get creative with grids, infographics and colors on your resume. But there's also a time and a place for minimal, simple design. </p><p>Perhaps the role you’re applying for is more administrative, even if it’s within a creative company, or the company isn't so much a youthful start-up but more an established, formal enterprise. Applying for a role at an architecture firm or marketing company? Perhaps a more stripped-back resume design would be more fitting.</p><p>This means no photos (<em>or at the very least, no colorful cropped images from Facebook...but I’m trusting you wouldn’t subject any future employer to those anyway</em>), no graphics, and no colors that'll give a CEO a headache.</p><p>Take a lesson from this wonderfully <a href=\"https://graphicriver.net/item/resumica-resume-set/242552\" rel=\"external\" target=\"_blank\">minimal resume template</a>:</p><figure class=\"post_image\"><a href=\"https://elements.envato.com/the-resume-C7DZ8G\" rel=\"external\" target=\"_blank\"><img alt=\"Minimal Resume Template\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/1223/posts/34658/image/6.%20The%20Resume.jpeg\"></a><figcaption><a href=\"https://elements.envato.com/the-resume-C7DZ8G\" rel=\"external\" target=\"_blank\">Minimal Resume Template</a> example from Envato Elements. The photo can easily be removed.</figcaption></figure><p>Choose a classic sans serif typeface and keep the structure of your minimal resume conventional. Flush type to align left, to keep your text traditional in style. Allow for white space to make the whole design appear serene and professional. Use simple, thin lines (look to the Stroke Tools in Adobe software) to divide sections of content into manageable chunks. Use color sparingly—as a little pop of blue to mark out subheadings catches the eye without being overbearing.</p><h2>Tip 9. Create a Personal Brand</h2><p>If you’re sending a portfolio, resume, and cover letter to apply for your dream creative role, think about how you can make all the elements of your application look more unified and professional. Treating your job application as an exercise in branding is a great way to both elevate your application to the next level and prove to your future employer that you can be creative while working within a set of brand rules.<br></p><p>Before you begin creating your portfolio, resume, and cover letter, lay down some simple rules for your personal brand. </p><p>First, consider creating your own personal logo, like in this <a href=\"https://graphicriver.net/item/creative-resume-with-cover-letter/8678775\" rel=\"external\" target=\"_blank\">slick resume example</a>. Try designing a simple icon using your initials and a simple shape or border. Apply the logo to the cover page of all your application documents.</p><figure class=\"post_image\"><img alt=\"logo or icon\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/114/posts/25478/image/Brand.png\"><figcaption>Simple personal branding element example.</figcaption></figure><p>Secondly, you need to think about being consistent with your choice of typeface and how you format your text. </p><p>Choose a simple, legible sans serif for jobs in digital-related fields (take <a href=\"http://www.fontsquirrel.com/fonts/Aller\" rel=\"external\" target=\"_blank\"><strong>Aller</strong></a> for a spin). Or go for a serif (you can’t go wrong with <strong>Caslon</strong> or <strong>Garamond</strong>) if the role is more traditional. </p><p>Set rules for how you format headers, sub-headings and body text. Apply consistent text sizing and alignment throughout all your documents.</p><p>Finally, a brand is really pulled together by a consistent use of color. Take a look at this <a href=\"https://graphicriver.net/item/portfolio-resume-creative-pack/716751\" target=\"_self\">colorful resume and portfolio template</a>, which features a bold, four-color palette that's applied consistently across all the pages, with geometric shapes used to tie together the elements and create unusual grid sections for placing text and images. </p><figure class=\"post_image\"><a href=\"https://graphicriver.net/item/portfolio-resume-creative-pack/716751\" target=\"_self\"><img alt=\"branded resume\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/114/posts/25478/image/Brand.jpg\"></a><figcaption><a href=\"https://graphicriver.net/item/portfolio-resume-creative-pack/716751\" target=\"_self\">Portfolio &amp; Resume Creative Template Pack</a> with color branding.</figcaption></figure><p>Create a complementary color palette in your software of choice and stick to it! (In <strong>Adobe</strong> programs, expand the <strong>Swatches</strong> panel and create new CMYK swatches, before saving them as a <strong>Swatch Library.</strong>)</p><p>To take your branding exercise to the next level, design your portfolio website to match your brand look, so that the impressive unified effect isn’t lost when the employer checks you out online.</p><h2>Tip 10. Match the Company's Colors</h2><p>Another strategy, and one that's the complete opposite to Tip 9 above, is to have your resume match the brand of the company you're applying to. This may seem counter-intuitive but by applying the company's fonts, colors, style, etc. to your own resume. It shows you did your research and are passionate about the company and about working for it. This is how to design a resume that stands apart from the competition. It's the kind of creative, out of the box thinking that'll get you noticed. </p><figure class=\"post_image\"><a href=\"https://elements.envato.com/creative-resume-cv-template-CG2PQ9\" target=\"_self\"><img alt=\"Creative resume format\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/1631/posts/32447/image/Creative%20Resume%20Format2.jpg\"></a><figcaption><a href=\"https://elements.envato.com/creative-resume-cv-template-CG2PQ9\" target=\"_self\">Creative Resume &amp; CV Template</a> is an example of how to design a CV/resume that stands out</figcaption></figure><h2>Tip 11. Make It Personal</h2><p>It’s one challenge to make your resume look presentable, but how are you going to make it <i>memorable</i>?<br></p><p>What’s going to give the reader a lasting impression of your personality without you being physically present? After all, you won’t even get to the interview stage if your resume is instantly forgettable.</p><p>To make it unforgettable, think of ways to inject personality into your resume. This can partly be content-based. Try sharing your hobbies and interests outside of work, or presenting a short bio in a punchy, informal way.</p><p>In terms of design, there’s two ultra-simple ways to personalize your resume and make it more reflective of who you are. </p><p>The first is to add your personal signature to the design. </p><p>Signing your name is personal and intimate and makes a nice nod to tradition in this overwhelmingly digital age. If your signature’s illegible or downright messy, use a handwritten typeface to set your name instead. Try out <strong><a href=\"http://www.fontsquirrel.com/fonts/HarabaraHand\" rel=\"external\" target=\"_blank\">Harabara Hand</a></strong> or <strong><a href=\"https://graphicriver.net/item/jimmy-font-duo-5-fonts/13309956\" rel=\"external\" target=\"_blank\">Jimmy Script</a></strong>.</p><figure class=\"post_image\"><a href=\"https://graphicriver.net/item/clean-resume/6252584\" target=\"_self\"><img alt=\"resume with signature\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/114/posts/25478/image/Personal-2.png\"></a><figcaption>Example of a handwritten font applied to a <a href=\"https://graphicriver.net/item/clean-resume/6252584\" target=\"_self\">Personalized Resume Template</a>.</figcaption></figure><p>Guaranteed this will make your name more memorable than if it's set in plain ol’ Helvetica.</p><p>The other thing you can do to personalize your resume is to include a photo. </p><p>A word of caution—<em>don’t just pop in any old photo and hope that'll cut the mustard</em>. </p><p>Your photo should ideally be professionally taken and present you in a professional yet approachable light. A warm smile is great but avoid manic laughter. Equally, a stony-faced, serious photo could be off-putting to an employer looking for a team-player. A professional photographer will put you at ease and produce photos that look natural. </p><p>Adjusting color photos to black-and-white (apply a <strong>Black &amp; White Adjustment Layer</strong> to your color photo in <strong>Adobe Photoshop</strong>), like in this <a href=\"https://graphicriver.net/item/clean-resume/6252584\" rel=\"external\" target=\"_blank\">clean resume template</a>, also adds an extra-professional touch.</p><figure class=\"post_image\"><a href=\"https://graphicriver.net/item/clean-resume/6252584\" target=\"_self\"><img alt=\"resume with black and white photo\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/114/posts/25478/image/Personal.png\"></a><figcaption>Example of a personalized, <a href=\"https://graphicriver.net/item/clean-resume/6252584\" target=\"_self\">Creative Resume Template</a>. </figcaption></figure><h2>Tip 12. Want to Be Really Creative? Go Digital!</h2><p>Print resumes have an old-fashioned charm and many companies will take it as a given that your application will be in a printable format. Sometimes you need to push the boundaries.<br></p><p>If you’ve been eyeing up a designer role at that ultra-creative start-up, you’re going to need to show your employer that you can think outside of the box. Most start-ups have a tech-forward ethos. This creates the perfect opportunity for you to show off your web design skills. Hey, even if you’re lacking in coding prowess there are still loads of simple ways to customize <a href=\"https://themeforest.net/category/site-templates/personal\" target=\"_self\">personal website templates</a> to make them your own. </p><p>Moving your resume onto a digital platform allows you to get creative with your presentation. </p><p>You can now integrate interactive content into your resume, such as animation and video. They also happen to be incredibly convenient for your employer to access. No fiddly email attachments or postal application, just click and go. Make sure your site is mobile-responsive in case they decide to check you out on their morning commute.</p><p>This uber-professional <a href=\"https://themeforest.net/item/shiftcv-blog-resume-portfolio/5925341\" rel=\"external\" target=\"_blank\">resume portfolio theme</a> is a fantastic example of integrating a resume, cover letter and portfolio into one slick web page:</p><figure class=\"post_image\"><a href=\"https://themeforest.net/item/shiftcv-blog-resume-portfolio/5925341\" target=\"_self\"><img alt=\"website resume\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/114/posts/25478/image/Digital-2.jpg\"></a><figcaption><a href=\"https://themeforest.net/item/shiftcv-blog-resume-portfolio/5925341\" rel=\"external\" target=\"_blank\">Resume Website Theme</a> - example profile and resume layout.</figcaption></figure><figure class=\"post_image\"><a href=\"https://themeforest.net/item/shiftcv-blog-resume-portfolio/5925341\" target=\"_self\"><img alt=\"website portfolio\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/114/posts/25478/image/Digital.jpg\"></a><figcaption><a href=\"https://themeforest.net/item/shiftcv-blog-resume-portfolio/5925341\" rel=\"external\" target=\"_blank\">Resume Website Theme</a> - example of featured portfolio elements.</figcaption></figure><p>The dark background and minimal design keep the page from looking overly gimmicky or geeky. (We’re looking at you, <a href=\"http://www.rleonardi.com/interactive-resume/\" rel=\"external\" target=\"_blank\">Robby Leonardi</a>. Who am I kidding, his <a href=\"http://www.rleonardi.com/interactive-resume/\" rel=\"external\" target=\"_blank\">video game-inspired resume</a> is awesome!)</p><figure class=\"post_image\"><a href=\"http://www.rleonardi.com/interactive-resume/\" target=\"_self\"><img alt=\"robby leonardi resume\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/114/posts/25478/image/Digital-3.jpg\"></a><figcaption><a href=\"http://www.rleonardi.com/interactive-resume/\" rel=\"external\" target=\"_blank\">Robby Leonardi Interactive Resume</a> digital-inspired example.</figcaption></figure><p>If you’re trying to convince your future boss of your technical skills, moving your resume onto a digital platform (or even better, creating both a hard and soft copy of your application—<em>you’ll have no complaints</em>) is the perfect way of showcasing your digital skill set, before you’ve even got to the interview!</p><h2>Tip 13. Balance Creativity and Professionalism</h2><p>In this article I’ve shared with you a few tips for how you can give your resume a modern refresh, and how to make your application memorable and impressive. </p><p>A final—and arguably most important—tip is to strike a fine-tuned balance between <em>creativity</em> and <em>professionalism</em> in your resume design. </p>\n<p>Unlike other print items, like flyers or posters, a resume needs to be a bit more understated. </p><figure class=\"post_image\"><a href=\"https://graphicriver.net/item/resumica-resume-set/242552\" target=\"_self\"><img alt=\"simple resume layout\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/114/posts/25478/image/Simple.png\"></a><figcaption><a href=\"https://graphicriver.net/item/resumica-resume-set/242552\" rel=\"external\" target=\"_blank\">Minimal Resume Template</a> - example of understated creativity.</figcaption></figure><p>Before they’ve even met you in person an employer will make judgments about your personality and professional capabilities based on the look of your resume alone. So, make sure those first impressions are as positive as possible, which will improve your chances of getting to the interview stage (where you'll, of course, wow the interviewer with your sparkling personality). </p><p>Choosing an elegant, legible typeface and setting it nicely on the page will have more positive impact than a layout weighed down with gradients, eyesore colors and novelty fonts. Show off your creative side in a subtle way, by proving that you know when there’s a time and a place for being ultra-experimental...and for some jobs you may apply for a professional resume isn't the place to do it. </p><p>Move away from loading down your resume with creative effects. Focus more on how you can improve the reader’s experience of your application. </p><figure class=\"post_image\"><a href=\"https://graphicriver.net/item/infographic-style-resume-template/6254346\" target=\"_self\"><img alt=\"infographic resume\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/114/posts/25478/image/Infographic.png\"></a><figcaption><a href=\"https://graphicriver.net/item/infographic-style-resume-template/6254346\" rel=\"external\" target=\"_blank\">Infographic-Style Resume Templates</a> can improve the reader's experience.</figcaption></figure><p>Structuring the content of your resume, developing a personal brand, or moving your resume onto a digital platform will prove to potential employers that you can problem-solve, and present information in a memorable, skillful way. </p><p>Balance creative presentation ideas with a professional design and you can’t go wrong!</p><h2>Tip 14. Don’t Ignore the Cover Letter</h2><p>Taking the time to perfect your resume is normal if you want to get it right. But, don’t ignore the cover letter and make it an afterthought. It’s important to dedicate the same amount of time to the cover letter to make sure you’re tailoring it to the position and the company you’re applying to. </p><p>Fonts and colors should be consistent with those used on your resume. The tone of voice should be professional. Although you’ll want to make sure not to sound like you’re copying and pasting the same information over and over. </p><p>Keep the cover letter short and to the point — around three paragraphs is usually a good rule of thumb to follow. </p><p>If you’re wondering how to design an engaging cover letter, you’re in luck. Many resume templates on Envato Elements and GraphicRiver come with a matching cover letter. So, you don’t have to waste time trying to mimic the design of your resume. </p><figure class=\"post_image\"><a href=\"https://elements.envato.com/robert-web-resume-designer-BW4TKDZ\" rel=\"external\" target=\"_blank\"><img alt=\"Web Designer Resume Template With Matching Cover Letter\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/1223/posts/34658/image/12.%20Web%20Designer%20Resume.jpeg\"></a><figcaption><a href=\"https://elements.envato.com/robert-web-resume-designer-BW4TKDZ\" rel=\"external\" target=\"_blank\">Web Designer Resume Template With Matching Cover Letter</a></figcaption></figure><h2>Tip 15. Emphasize Your Contact Information</h2><p>According to <a href=\"http://templatelab.com/eye-tracking-study/\" rel=\"external\" target=\"_blank\">one study</a> from The Ladders, recruiters won’t spend more than six seconds on any given resume. That’s why your contact information needs to visually stand out from the rest of your resume.</p><p>You could use a background color to emphasize it or you could include your photo. Or, include a logo if you've got one. </p><p>Another tip to make this section visually stand out more is to use icons for your social media profiles, email address, and phone number. </p><figure class=\"post_image\"><a href=\"https://elements.envato.com/black-glasses-cv-resume-6MKLPKW\" rel=\"external\" target=\"_blank\"><img alt=\"Black Glasses Resume Template\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/1223/posts/34658/image/13.%20Black%20Glasses%20Resume.jpeg\"></a><figcaption><a href=\"https://elements.envato.com/black-glasses-cv-resume-6MKLPKW\" rel=\"external\" target=\"_blank\">Black Glasses Resume Template</a> uses a prominent photo to stand out.</figcaption></figure><h2>Tip 16. Make the Content Easy to Scan</h2><p>Tied to the tip above, make sure the content of your resume is easy to scan. This is where brevity and proper formatting come into play. Use short sentences and bullet points to make the information easy to skim through. That way, recruiters can easily tell if you've got the necessary skills and education for the job you’re applying for. </p><p>Using lines or section dividers as well as creative resume headings and icons are also great ways to make your resume more scannable. Consider <a href=\"https://elements.envato.com/resume-cv-template-03-FB56U9C\" rel=\"external\" target=\"_blank\">this template</a> that not only uses headings, lines, and bullet points but also plenty of white space to make the content easy to scan and digest.</p><figure class=\"post_image\"><a href=\"https://elements.envato.com/resume-cv-template-03-FB56U9C\" rel=\"external\" target=\"_blank\"><img alt=\"ResumeCV template\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/1223/posts/34658/image/14.%20Resume%20Template.jpeg\"></a><figcaption><a href=\"https://elements.envato.com/resume-cv-template-03-FB56U9C\" rel=\"external\" target=\"_blank\">Resume/CV Template</a> with a scannable design.</figcaption></figure><h2>Tip 17. Use a Different Layout</h2><p>If you’re applying for a job in a creative industry, consider using a horizontal layout instead of a vertical one. This isn't common practice. So, it’s a great way to stand out and immediately catch the attention of the recruiters. </p><p>On top of that, you might be able to include more information on your resume without worrying about going over the one-page limit rule. Take a look at how <a href=\"https://elements.envato.com/resume-cv-template-8PMHRR\" rel=\"external\" target=\"_blank\">this template</a> experiments with a horizontal layout for an effective resume.</p><figure class=\"post_image\"><a href=\"https://elements.envato.com/resume-cv-template-8PMHRR\" rel=\"external\" target=\"_blank\"><img alt=\"Creative Resume Design Thats a Bit Different\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/988/posts/34658/image/creative-resume-design-different.jpg\"></a><figcaption>If you're looking for a <a href=\"https://elements.envato.com/resume-cv-template-8PMHRR\" rel=\"external\" target=\"_blank\">creative resume design</a> that's different, try this one.</figcaption></figure><h2>Tip 18. Get Creative With Photos</h2><p>If you’re applying for a job in a creative industry or if you need to showcase your photography skills, using a photo background on your resume is a great way to make your resume more unique. Few applicants will think of this. So, you’re sure to capture the attention of recruiting officers and share your talent and skills in an original way.</p><figure class=\"post_image\"><a href=\"https://elements.envato.com/cv-resume-W2VV7PF\" target=\"_self\"><img alt=\"Stand out with a photo background like in this creative resume template example\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/1223/posts/35566/image/CV%20Resume%20With%20Photo%20Background.jpeg\"></a><figcaption>Stand out with a photo background like in this<a href=\"https://elements.envato.com/cv-resume-W2VV7PF\" rel=\"external\" target=\"_blank\"> creative resume template example</a>.</figcaption></figure><h2>Tip 19. Go Black and White</h2><p>Consider a traditional and classic look with a black and white template. Turn your photo to black and white for a more dramatic effect. You can also use a grey background to draw attention to areas of your resume that cover your skills or your contact details. This effect is a great choice if you’re applying for a corporate position or for a position in a high-end, luxury industry.</p><figure class=\"post_image\"><a href=\"https://elements.envato.com/wonder-resume-cv-resume-97MEBLG\" target=\"_self\"><img alt=\"Black and white creative resume design\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/1223/posts/35566/image/Wonder%20Resume%20Black%20and%20White.jpeg\"></a><figcaption>Black and white <a href=\"https://elements.envato.com/wonder-resume-cv-resume-97MEBLG\" rel=\"external\" target=\"_blank\">creative resume design</a>.</figcaption></figure><h2>Tip 20. Add Color to Power Words</h2><p>Make the power words in your resume stand out by using color. Power words are keywords that recruiters will scan for so they can immediately see relevant information. They include resume sections such as skills, education, and experience. Those words can mean all the difference between your resume getting noticed or winding up in the bin. </p><p>Apply the color directly to the heading, create a colored border around the heading, or add a colored shape to act as a background for that particular heading.</p><figure class=\"post_image\"><a href=\"https://elements.envato.com/cv-resume-48RZULK\" target=\"_self\"><img alt=\"Try this creative resume design if you want to stress power words in your resume\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/1223/posts/35566/image/CV%20Resume%20With%20Colored%20Headings.jpeg\"></a><figcaption>Try this <a href=\"https://elements.envato.com/cv-resume-48RZULK\" rel=\"external\" target=\"_blank\">creative resume design</a> if you want to stress power words in your resume.</figcaption></figure><h2>Tip 21. Proofread Everything<br>\n</h2><p>Last but not least, make sure you proofread your resume at least once before sending it off. After all, the last thing you want is to spend all that time coming up with the perfect design and not checking for typos and other grammar errors. </p><p>If you’re not confident in your grammar skills, use a tool like Grammarly to check your resume for you. </p><h2>How to Quickly Design Your Resume in Photoshop</h2><p>Now that you’re armed with resume design tips, it’s time to customize a resume template so you can start applying for jobs. </p><p>For the purposes of this tutorial, I’ll be using the <a href=\"https://elements.envato.com/cv-resume-MVRCDHL\" rel=\"external\" target=\"_blank\">CV Resume Template</a> from Envato Elements. </p><figure class=\"post_image\"><a href=\"https://elements.envato.com/cv-resume-MVRCDHL\" rel=\"external\" target=\"_blank\"><img alt=\"CV Resume Template\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/988/posts/34658/image/creative-cv-design-A.jpg\"></a></figure><p>This resume has a clean and creative CV design and comes with a matching cover letter.</p><h3>1. Add Your Information</h3><p>The first step is to replace the dummy information with your own. To do this, open the resume in Photoshop and make sure that the <strong>Text</strong> tool is selected. Then, click anywhere on the text, select it with <strong>CTRL+A </strong>or <strong>CMD+A</strong>. Start typing your own information. </p><figure class=\"post_image\"><a href=\"https://elements.envato.com/cv-resume-MVRCDHL\" rel=\"external\" target=\"_blank\"><img alt=\"Replacing content\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/1223/posts/34658/image/Replacing%20Content.jpg\"></a></figure><h3>2. Customize the Fonts</h3><p>After you've replaced the content with your own, customize the fonts used in the template. To customize the font, choose the <strong>Text</strong> tool and click on any text in the resume. Then, choose a font you like from the drop-down menu at the top.</p><figure class=\"post_image\"><a href=\"https://elements.envato.com/cv-resume-MVRCDHL\" rel=\"external\" target=\"_blank\"><img alt=\"Customizing fonts\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/1223/posts/34658/image/Customizing%20Fonts.jpg\"></a></figure><h3>3. Change Colors</h3><p>Once you’ve customized the fonts, customize the colors in your chosen template. For example, I want to change the black bar at the top of the resume. This bar is in the bottom most layer. Once that layer has been selected, use the color picker tool to change it to a different color.</p><figure class=\"post_image\"><a href=\"https://elements.envato.com/cv-resume-MVRCDHL\" rel=\"external\" target=\"_blank\"><img alt=\"Changing and customizing colors\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/1223/posts/34658/image/Customizing%20Colors.jpg\"></a></figure><h3>4. Add a Profile Photo</h3><p>The next step is to add your profile photo. The CV template has a photo placeholder located on the first layer, called <strong>Clip Group</strong>. To replace the photo with your own, first, open your photo in Photoshop. Then, select it by pressing <strong>CTRL+A </strong>or <strong>CMD+A </strong>on a Mac. Copy it with <strong>CTRL+C</strong> or <strong>CMD+C</strong>. </p><p>Go back to the resume file in Photoshop and make sure the first visible layer with the Clip Group selected. Paste your photo above it by pressing <strong>CTRL+V</strong> or <strong>CMD+V</strong>. Then, right-click the layer with the photo and select <strong>Make Clipping Mask</strong>.</p><figure class=\"post_image\"><a href=\"https://elements.envato.com/cv-resume-MVRCDHL\" rel=\"external\" target=\"_blank\"><img alt=\"Adding a profile photo\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/1223/posts/34658/image/Adding%20profile%20photo.jpg\"></a></figure><h3>5. Export Your Design</h3><p>Finally, you’re ready to export your finished and customized template. To do this, click on <strong>File &gt; Save As</strong> and then select <strong>Photoshop PDF</strong>. You’re now ready to send it off to a job application.</p><figure class=\"post_image\"><a href=\"https://elements.envato.com/cv-resume-MVRCDHL\" rel=\"external\" target=\"_blank\"><img alt=\"Exporting your file\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/1223/posts/34658/image/Exporting%20the%20file.jpg\"></a></figure><h2>Top 5 Creative Resume CV Templates From Envato Elements For 2020</h2><p>Envato Elements is the best place to go when you’re looking for a creative resume template design. These templates have modern and trendy design with all the necessary sections to present your professional background. Easily customize them to your needs and start applying for your dream job. </p><p>Here's five of our top <a href=\"https://elements.envato.com/graphic-templates/resume\" target=\"_self\">creative resume CV templates</a> from Envato Elements:</p><h3>1. <a href=\"https://elements.envato.com/resume-word-JXK8DV2\" rel=\"external\" target=\"_blank\">Creative Resume Word</a>\n</h3><figure class=\"post_image\"><a href=\"https://elements.envato.com/resume-word-JXK8DV2\" target=\"_self\"><img alt=\"Creative Resume Word\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/1223/posts/35566/image/Creative%20Resume%20Word.jpg\"></a></figure><p>The first resume on this list has a colorful and trendy design. Add your profile photo or include your logo. There’s plenty of space to include your education, previous experience, and skills. The template comes with a matching cover letter template. Customize it in Photoshop, Illustrator, and Word. </p><h3>2. <a href=\"https://elements.envato.com/resume-cv-template-19-8QR7TP6\" rel=\"external\" target=\"_blank\">Resume CV Template 19</a>\n</h3><figure class=\"post_image\"><a href=\"https://elements.envato.com/resume-cv-template-19-8QR7TP6\" rel=\"external\" target=\"_blank\"><img alt=\"Resume CV Template 19\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/1223/posts/35566/image/CV%20Resume%20Template%2019.jpg\"></a></figure><p>Make an impact with this resume template. It comes with a large photo area where you can include a photo of you or a sample of your work. The template includes a matching cover letter. It can be customized in Photoshop and has well organized layers. <br></p><h3>3. <a href=\"https://elements.envato.com/cv-resume-48YVT5U\" rel=\"external\" target=\"_blank\">Colorful and Creative CV Resume</a>\n</h3><figure class=\"post_image\"><a href=\"https://elements.envato.com/cv-resume-48YVT5U\" target=\"_self\"><img alt=\"Colorful And Creative CV Resume\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/1223/posts/35566/image/Colorful%20CV%20Resume.jpg\"></a></figure><p>If you’re looking for a colorful resume template, this creative CV resume will come in handy. The template stands out with its full color background and creative color splashes in the corners. Customize it to match your style. This template comes in Photoshop, Illustrator, and Word format.<br></p><h3>4. <a href=\"https://elements.envato.com/cv-resume-8XPGH7Q\" rel=\"external\" target=\"_blank\">CV Resume Creative Template Design</a>\n</h3><figure class=\"post_image\"><a href=\"https://elements.envato.com/cv-resume-8XPGH7Q\" target=\"_self\"><img alt=\"CV Resume Creative Template Design\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/1223/posts/35566/image/CV%20Resume%20Creative.jpg\"></a></figure><p>This is another creative resume template design that would work well for artists and graphic designers or illustrators. The template can easily be customized in Photoshop, Illustrator or Word. With a few clicks, easily change the text, fonts, and colors to reflect your own style. It comes with a matching cover letter and a portfolio page. <br></p><h3>5. <a href=\"https://elements.envato.com/cv-resume-J99P5XB\">Creative Dual Color Resume Design</a>\n</h3><figure class=\"post_image\"><a href=\"https://elements.envato.com/cv-resume-J99P5XB\" target=\"_self\"><img alt=\"Creative Dual Color Resume Design\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/1223/posts/35566/image/Dual%20Tone%20Creative%20Resume%20Template.jpg\"></a></figure><p>If you’re looking for a bold and creative resume design, give this template a try. It comes with a dual color scheme that’s easy to customize. You can also change fonts and add your own photo. The template can be edited in Photoshop or Illustrator.</p><h2>More Great Resume Template Designs</h2><p>To see even more great resume template designs, check out the following roundups below. They feature modern and attractive resume designs from Envato Elements and GraphicRiver. </p><ul class=\"roundup-block__contents posts--half-width roundup-block--list\">\n<li Schenker</div></a></li>\n</ul><h2>Where to Find the Best Creative Resume Designs in 2020 (Envato Elements vs GraphicRiver)<br>\n</h2><p>As mentioned earlier, there are plenty of <a href=\"https://elements.envato.com/graphic-templates/resume\" rel=\"external\" target=\"_blank\">great resume templates</a> on marketplaces like Envato Elements and GraphicRiver. You’ll find templates for different industries as well as different styles. Most of them include matching cover letters and some of them even come with a set of matching business cards. </p><p>Most importantly, all our templates are easy to customize in Photoshop, Illustrator as well as Word. So, you can use whatever program you’re comfortable with. But, should you use GraphicRiver or Envato Elements? And, what are the key benefits of each?</p><h3>1. Key Benefits of Envato Elements </h3><p>If you want to download as many <a href=\"https://elements.envato.com/\" rel=\"external\" target=\"_blank\">resume templates</a> as possible, Envato Elements is a great choice. This is a subscription-based marketplace with a very compelling offer. <strong>For a low monthly price, download as many creative resumes designs and other design assets as you like.</strong></p><p>From resume templates to web mockups and templates, stock photos, fonts, and more, Envato Elements has it all. There are loads of quality resume templates with on-trend designs available on Envato Elements:</p><figure class=\"post_image\"><a href=\"https://elements.envato.com/graphic-templates/resume\" target=\"_self\"><img alt=\"Resume templates on Envato Elements\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/988/posts/35566/image/creative-cv-resume-designs.jpg\"></a><figcaption><a href=\"https://elements.envato.com/graphic-templates/resume\" target=\"_self\">Resume templates</a> on Envato Elements </figcaption></figure><h3>2. Key Benefits of GraphicRiver</h3><p><em>GraphicRiver is the best digital marketplace for purchasing single-use graphics and visual assets. </em>It’s part of the Envato Market suite of online marketplaces that cater to various creative needs.</p><p>When you want to buy <a href=\"https://graphicriver.net/graphics-with-creative-in-print-templates/stationery/resumes\" rel=\"external\" target=\"_blank\">individual resume templates</a>, GraphicRiver is a great choice. Here are the best resume templates that are currently trending on GraphicRiver:</p><figure class=\"post_image\"><a href=\"https://graphicriver.net/graphics-with-creative-in-print-templates/stationery/resumes\" target=\"_self\"><img alt=\"resume templates on GraphicRiver\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/988/posts/35566/image/creative-resume-format.jpg\"></a><figcaption><a href=\"https://graphicriver.net/graphics-with-creative-in-print-templates/stationery/resumes\" target=\"_self\">Resume templates</a> on GraphicRiver</figcaption></figure><p>But, if you need a single resume template or another creative design asset to download right now, then head over to GraphicRiver (or another Envato Market site) to find what you need.</p><h3>Your Choice (What’s Right for You?)</h3><figure class=\"post_image\"><a href=\"https://elements.envato.com/\" target=\"_self\"><img alt=\"Envato Elements\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/1223/posts/35566/image/Envato%20Elements%20Design%20Without%20Limits.jpg\"></a><figcaption>Get resume templates on <a href=\"https://elements.envato.com/\" rel=\"external\" target=\"_blank\">Envato Elements</a> </figcaption></figure><p>If you’re a designer working with many clients or if you’re an entrepreneur regularly launching new brands, Envato Elements is the best choice as it offers the best bang for your buck. Sign up for <a href=\"https://elements.envato.com/\">Envato Elements</a> now. </p><p>But if you just need a <a href=\"https://graphicriver.net/graphics-with-creative-in-print-templates/stationery/resumes\" target=\"_self\">single creative resume</a> and no other design assets and you aren't willing to commit to a subscription, GraphicRiver may be the best choice.</p><h2>More Tutorials: Learn How to Make a Great Resume </h2><p>Whether you want to learn how to make a resume in Photoshop or MS Word, or learn more about creative resume formats, these articles will help you <a href=\"https://business.tutsplus.com/series/how-to-create-a-great-resume-ultimate-guide--cms-1078\" rel=\"external\" target=\"_blank\">learn how to make a great resume</a> and take your creations from blah to WOW! </p><ul class=\"roundup-block__contents posts--half-width roundup-block--list\">\n<li class=\"roundup-block__content\"><a class=\"roundup-block__content-link\" href=\"https://business.tutsplus.com/tutorials/how-to-list-skills-on-a-resume--cms-28652\"><img class=\"roundup-block__preview-image\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/23/posts/28652/preview_image/how-to-list-skills-on-your-resume.jpg\"><div class=\"roundup-block__primary-category topic-business\">Resumes</div>\n<div class=\"roundup-block__content-title\">How to Effectively List Professional Skills on Your Resume</div>\n<div class=\"roundup-block__author\">Charley Mendoza</div></a></li>\n<li class=\"roundup-block__content\"><a class=\"roundup-block__content-link\" href=\"https://business.tutsplus.com/articles/resume-action-words-and-powerful-verbs--cms-28829\"><img class=\"roundup-block__preview-image\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/23/posts/28829/preview_image/best-resume-action-words-with-powerful-verbs-list.jpg\"><div class=\"roundup-block__primary-category ets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/114/posts/25478/image/Simple.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn8@2020_4/2020/09/05/06-45-41-443_7e65d80e53fa6306.webp","https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/114/posts/25478/image/Infographic.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn32@2020_1/2020/09/05/06-45-38-313_ba97a91714298878.webp","https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/1223/posts/34658/image/12.%20Web%20Designer%20Resume.jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn46@2020_5/2020/09/05/06-45-34-027_2280f6e520101639.webp","https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/1223/posts/34658/image/13.%20Black%20Glasses%20Resume.jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn93@2020_1/2020/09/05/06-45-38-788_c0718131403e6afd.webp","https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/1223/posts/34658/image/14.%20Resume%20Template.jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn60@2020_6/2020/09/05/06-45-43-963_5fd77062e5529159.webp","https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/988/posts/34658/image/creative-resume-design-different.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn17@2020_2/2020/09/05/06-45-44-087_3adfec757de1c5ce.webp","https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/1223/posts/35566/image/CV%20Resume%20With%20Photo%20Background.jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn45@2020_3/2020/09/05/06-45-43-330_7103a332ee6ae885.webp","https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/1223/posts/35566/image/Wonder%20Resume%20Black%20and%20White.jpeg":null,"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/1223/posts/35566/image/CV%20Resume%20With%20Colored%20Headings.jpeg":null,"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/988/posts/34658/image/creative-cv-design-A.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn98@2020_6/2020/09/05/06-45-34-606_4d7bb301ba7afaee.webp","https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/1223/posts/34658/image/Replacing%20Content.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn13@2020_5/2020/09/05/06-45-39-274_19a0f5b2ceab1290.webp","https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/1223/posts/34658/image/Customizing%20Fonts.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx33/cdn86@2020_1/2020/09/05/06-45-33-016_3b68ab1aa94ff1ff.webp","https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/1223/posts/34658/image/Customizing%20Colors.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn7@2020_3/2020/09/05/06-45-33-009_8079dde97bbbc56a.webp","https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/1223/posts/34658/image/Adding%20profile%20photo.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx33/cdn42@2020_5/2020/09/05/06-45-44-230_60466a5b0295cdab.webp","https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/1223/posts/34658/image/Exporting%20the%20file.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn60@2020_1/2020/09/05/06-45-40-292_3d3671089bab02b0.webp","https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/1223/posts/35566/image/Creative%20Resume%20Word.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn82@2020_5/2020/09/05/06-45-32-052_f41a6346921ab548.webp","https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/1223/posts/35566/image/CV%20Resume%20Template%2019.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn81@2020_6/2020/09/05/06-45-32-064_f40bbcdcc2e6f99b.webp","https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/1223/posts/35566/image/Colorful%20CV%20Resume.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn78@2020_3/2020/09/05/06-45-40-677_d51f5cf5ef4d3bed.webp","https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/1223/posts/35566/image/CV%20Resume%20Creative.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn59@2020_4/2020/09/05/06-45-35-148_1d4ff05bec89f138.webp","https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/1223/posts/35566/image/Dual%20Tone%20Creative%20Resume%20Template.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn53@2020_2/2020/09/05/06-45-36-550_068114ed8a49c803.webp","https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/23/posts/25710/preview_image/infographic-resume-template-preview.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn75@2020_4/2020/09/05/06-45-36-269_b6fe92e68a52b183.webp","https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/23/posts/27507/preview_image/professional-ms-word-resume-templates.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn34@2020_5/2020/09/05/06-45-44-168_8562bfca581833dc.webp","https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/988/posts/35566/image/creative-cv-resume-designs.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx18/cdn34@2020_2/2020/09/05/06-45-36-929_e2c4ec648bede4ff.webp","https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/988/posts/35566/image/creative-resume-format.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn24@2020_1/2020/09/05/06-45-33-527_ec61b61a310ef3e5.webp","https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/1223/posts/35566/image/Envato%20Elements%20Design%20Without%20Limits.jpg":null,"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/23/posts/28652/preview_image/how-to-list-skills-on-your-resume.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn64@2020_2/2020/09/05/06-45-43-974_f28eea1ea7fdd7c4.webp","https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/23/posts/28829/preview_image/best-resume-action-words-with-powerful-verbs-list.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn15@2020_1/2020/09/05/06-45-35-500_58bfb5c0c256c096.webp","https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/23/posts/29171/preview_image/bad-resume-phrases-to-cut-now.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn3@2020_5/2020/09/05/06-45-37-512_5b59e8d7f7863351.webp","http://audio.tutsplus.com.feedsportal.com/c/35227/f/668805/s/25478/sc/4/mf.gif":null,"http://da.feedsportal.com/r/186529796139/u/407/f/668805/c/35227/s/25478/a2.img":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn99@2020_5/2020/09/05/06-45-45-197_6f1d9446d62c9560.jpg","http://pi.feedsportal.com/r/186529796139/u/407/f/668805/c/35227/s/25478/a2t.img":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn34@2020_1/2020/09/05/06-45-34-595_f4c91fe1a5b8b712.jpg"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1599288318848},{"createdTime":"2020-09-05 14:45:18","updatedTime":"2020-09-05 14:45:18","title":"How to Use Font Ligatures in InDesign, Photoshop & Illustrator","link":"https://design.tutsplus.com/tutorials/how-to-use-font-ligatures-in-indesign-photoshop-illustrator--cms-35554","description":"<p>In this tutorial, we take a look at what font ligatures are and how to use them, and we profile some of the best ligature fonts. </p><p>Font ligatures are one of the most purposeful elements in graphic design, especially in long forms of text. The word ligature comes from the Latin <em>ligare,</em> meaning \"to tie\". A ligature in fonts combines two or three characters into a single character to help with kerning and for decorative purposes. </p><p>Follow along with us over on our <a href=\"https://www.youtube.com/user/TutsPremium\" target=\"_self\">Envato Tuts+ YouTube channel</a>:</p><figure data-video-embed=\"true\" data-original-url=\"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=_5FaneDYWhk\" class=\"embedded-video\">\n  <iframe src=\"//www.youtube.com/embed/_5FaneDYWhk?rel=0\" webkitallowfullscreen=\"webkitallowfullscreen\" mozallowfullscreen=\"mozallowfullscreen\" allowfullscreen=\"allowfullscreen\" frameborder=\"0\"></iframe>\n</figure><h2>What You'll Learn in This Font Ligature Tutorial</h2><ul>\n<li>What are font ligatures?</li>\n<li>How to turn on ligatures in InDesign</li>\n<li>How to turn off ligatures in InDesign</li>\n<li>How to use ligatures in Photoshop</li>\n<li>How to use ligatures in Illustrator</li>\n<li>What are the best ligature fonts?</li>\n</ul><p>Looking for the <a href=\"https://elements.envato.com/fonts/ligature+fonts\" target=\"_self\">best ligature fonts</a>? Be sure to check out <a href=\"https://elements.envato.com/\" target=\"_self\">Envato Elements</a> and <a href=\"https://graphicriver.net/\" target=\"_self\">GraphicRiver</a>. You'll find a big library that's updated daily with some of the best assets. </p><ul class=\"roundup-block__contents posts--half-width roundup-block--list\">\n<li class=\"roundup-block__content\"><a class=\"roundup-block__content-link\" href=\"https://design.tutsplus.com/articles/how-to-combine-fonts-how-not-to-and-best-font-combinations--cms-33904\"><img class=\"roundup-block__preview-image\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/2056/posts/33904/preview_image/19-10-01-ART-Dos-and-Dont's-of-Type-thumb.jpg\"><div class=\"roundup-block__primary-category topic-design\">Fonts</div>\n<div class=\"roundup-block__content-title\">How to Combine Fonts, How Not To, and the Best Font Combinations</div>\n<div class=\"roundup-block__author\">Laura Keung</div></a></li>\n<li class=\"roundup-block__content\"><a class=\"roundup-block__content-link\" href=\"https://design.tutsplus.com/articles/the-ultimate-guide-to-basic-typography--cms-33460\"><img class=\"roundup-block__preview-image\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/2056/posts/33460/preview_image/Basic%20Typography%20article%20-24.jpg\"><div class=\"roundup-block__primary-category topic-design\">Typography</div>\n<div class=\"roundup-block__content-title\">The Ultimate Guide to Basic Typography</div>\n<div class=\"roundup-block__author\">Laura Keung</div></a></li>\n</ul><h2>What You'll Need<br>\n</h2><p>For this tutorial, we’ll use two fonts from Envato Elements. <a href=\"https://elements.envato.com/elegant-karin-fashion-stylish-typeface-L356TWS\" target=\"_self\">Karin</a> has some great font ligatures we can use to show how to use ligatures in Photoshop or any other Adobe software. We’ll also use <a href=\"https://elements.envato.com/mondia-K3TC9UE\" target=\"_self\">Mondia</a> so you can check the common ligatures included with most fonts. </p><h2>What Are Font Ligatures?</h2><p>A <strong>standard ligature</strong> in fonts combines two or three characters into a single character. This type of ligature helps with the kerning when some characters take over the horizontal space of the next character. There are different ligatures depending on the language. In English, ligatures with ff, ffi, fi, and fl are common because there are many words with these combinations. Ligatures need to be used carefully as they can look very obvious if your text contains wide letter spacing. </p><figure class=\"post_image\"><img alt=\"Standard Ligatures\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/2056/posts/35554/image/FontLigatures-StandardLigatures-2.jpg\"></figure><p>The second type of ligature is <strong>discretionary ligatures</strong>, and these tend to be decorative. These ligatures also combine two or three characters into a single graceful character design. Combinations like TH, th, ck, ct, et, and st exist, as do double characters like oo, tt, and ll. Just like standard ligatures, these types of ligatures need to be used carefully. </p><p>It's important to clarify that not every font contains standard and discretionary ligatures. Every font is different, and it's ultimately the font designer's decision to include them. </p><figure class=\"post_image\"><img alt=\"Discretionary ligatures\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/2056/posts/35554/image/FontLigatures-DiscretionaryLigatures-1.jpg\"></figure><h2><b>How to Use Ligatures in InDesign</b></h2><h3>Step 1</h3><p>Open <strong>Adobe InDesign</strong> and create a new document. Head over to <strong>Window &gt; Type &gt; Glyphs</strong> to open the <strong>Glyphs</strong> panel. </p><p>To activate or deactivate ligatures, open the <strong>Character </strong>panel by going to <strong>Window &gt; Type &gt; Character</strong>. Click on the top right corner menu and select <strong>Ligatures</strong> to activate or deactivate them.</p><figure class=\"post_image\"><img alt=\"Create a new document and deactivate the ligatures option from the Character panel\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/2056/posts/35554/image/3.1-Font-Ligatures.jpg\"></figure><h3>Step 2</h3><p>Select the <strong>Text Tool (T)</strong> from the toolbar and type any text. For this tutorial, I’ll use “THE TWIN MOON INN”. Set the <strong>Font </strong>to <strong>Mondia</strong>. </p><figure class=\"post_image\"><img alt=\"add text\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/2056/posts/35554/image/3.2-Font-Ligatures.jpg\"></figure><h3>Step 3</h3><p>On the <strong>Glyphs</strong> panel, set the subset of glyphs to <strong>Standard Ligatures</strong>. </p><p>To use the ligatures on the <strong>Glyphs</strong> panel, select the pair of characters you would like to change using the <strong>Text Tool (T)</strong>. <strong>Double-click</strong> on the ligature of your choice on the <strong>Glyphs</strong> panel. Remember to activate the ligatures on the <strong>Character</strong> panel if you want them to appear automatically. </p><figure class=\"post_image\"><img alt=\"Select Standard Ligatures on the Glyphs panel and change regular characters for ligatures\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/2056/posts/35554/image/3.3-Font-Ligatures.jpg\"></figure><h2>\n<b>How to Use Ligatures in Photoshop</b><br>\n</h2><h3>Step 1</h3><p>Open <strong>Adobe Photoshop</strong> and create a new document. Head over to <strong>Window &gt; Glyphs</strong> to open the <strong>Glyphs</strong> panel. </p><p>To activate or deactivate automatic ligatures, open the <strong>Character</strong> panel by going to <strong>Window &gt; Character</strong>. On this panel, the first button activates <strong>Standard Ligatures</strong>, while the third button activates <strong>Discretionary Ligatures</strong>. I will deactivate both so we can take a further look into the <strong>Glyphs </strong>panel.<br></p><figure class=\"post_image\"><img alt=\"Create a new file and open the glyphs panel\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/2056/posts/35554/image/1.1-Font-Ligatures.jpg\"></figure><h3>Step 2<br>\n</h3><p>Select the <strong>Text Tool</strong> <strong>(T) </strong>from the toolbar and type any text. For this tutorial, I’ll use “Chanting at the Inn”. Set the <strong>Font</strong> to <strong>Karin</strong>. </p><figure class=\"post_image\"><img alt=\"Add text of your choice and choose a font that contains ligatures\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/2056/posts/35554/image/1.2-Font-Ligatures.jpg\"></figure><h3>Step 3<br>\n</h3><p>On the <strong>Glyphs</strong> panel, set the subset of glyphs to <strong>Discretionary Ligatures</strong> to access the ligatures included in the font. Not all fonts contain both discretionary and standard ligatures, so it's useful to check both. </p><p>To use the ligatures on the <strong>Glyphs</strong> panel, select the pair of characters you would like to change using the <strong>Text Tool (T).</strong> Double-click on the ligature of your choice on the <strong>Glyphs</strong> panel.</p><figure class=\"post_image\"><img alt=\"double click on the glyphs panel ligature option to change ligatures\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/2056/posts/35554/image/1.4-Font-Ligatures.jpg\"></figure><h2><b>How to Use Ligatures in Illustrator</b></h2><h3>Step 1</h3><p>Open <strong>Adobe Illustrator</strong> and create a new document. Head over to <strong>Window &gt; Type &gt; Glyphs</strong> to open the <strong>Glyphs</strong> panel. </p><p>To activate or deactivate ligatures, open the <strong>OpenType</strong> panel by going to <strong>Window &gt; Type &gt; OpenType</strong>. On this panel, the first button activates <strong>Standard Ligatures</strong>, while the third button activates <strong>Discretionary Ligatures</strong>. I will deactivate both so we can take a further look into the <strong>Glyphs </strong>panel. </p><figure class=\"post_image\"><img alt=\"create a new document and deactivate the automatic ligatures\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/2056/posts/35554/image/2.1-Font-Ligatures.jpg\"></figure><h3>Step 2<br>\n</h3><p>Select the <strong>Text Tool (T)</strong> from the toolbar and type any text. For this tutorial, I’ll use “finding waffles”. Set the <strong>Font</strong> to <strong>Mondia</strong>. </p><figure class=\"post_image\"><img alt=\"add text \" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/2056/posts/35554/image/2.2-Font-Ligatures.jpg\"></figure><h3>Step 3<br>\n</h3><p>Mondia contains discretionary and standard ligatures. On the <strong>Glyphs </strong>panel, set the subset of glyphs to <strong>Standard Ligatures</strong>. </p><p>To use the ligatures on the <strong>Glyphs</strong> panel, select the pair of characters you would like to change using the <strong>Text Tool (T)</strong>. <strong>Double-click</strong> on the ligature of your choice on the <strong>Glyphs</strong> panel. Remember to activate the ligatures on the <strong>OpenType</strong> panel if you want them to appear automatically. </p><figure class=\"post_image\"><img alt=\"Select Standard Ligatures on the Glyphs panel and change regular characters for ligatures\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/2056/posts/35554/image/2.3-Font-Ligatures.jpg\"></figure><h2>Assets With Font Ligatures</h2><p>Now that you know how to turn on ligatures in InDesign and other software, it's time to have fun! Let's take a look at some awesome fonts that contain the coolest font ligatures.</p><h3><a href=\"https://elements.envato.com/kelly-bold-gorgeous-sans-serif-typeface-KLPSM3E\" target=\"_self\">Kelly Bold</a></h3><figure class=\"post_image\"><a href=\"https://elements.envato.com/kelly-bold-gorgeous-sans-serif-typeface-KLPSM3E\" target=\"_self\"><img alt=\"Font ligatures Kelly Bold\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/2056/posts/35554/image/FontLigatures-KellyBold-1.jpg\"></a><figcaption><a href=\"https://elements.envato.com/kelly-bold-gorgeous-sans-serif-typeface-KLPSM3E\" target=\"_self\">Kelly Bold</a></figcaption></figure><p>This versatile vintage font is perfect as body copy or for a display font. The beautiful ligatures are elegant. The font features ligature combinations perfect for branding, and they can make your logo look unique. </p><h3><a href=\"https://elements.envato.com/crimson-foam-chic-stylish-ULPJYZG\" target=\"_self\">Crimson Foam</a></h3><figure class=\"post_image\"><a href=\"https://elements.envato.com/crimson-foam-chic-stylish-ULPJYZG\" target=\"_self\"><img alt=\"Font ligatures Crimson Foam\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/2056/posts/35554/image/FontLigatures-CrimsonFoam-2.jpg\"></a><figcaption><a href=\"https://elements.envato.com/crimson-foam-chic-stylish-ULPJYZG\" target=\"_self\">Crimson Foam</a></figcaption></figure><p>This chic script font is so well crafted. It features beginning and ending lowercase swashes that can make for a great display font. You also get an extensive ligature library with combinations between many characters to make the font appear as realistic as possible. </p><h3><a href=\"https://elements.envato.com/hazzard-bold-script-logotype-97VVCZN\" target=\"_self\">Hazzard</a></h3><figure class=\"post_image\"><a href=\"https://elements.envato.com/hazzard-bold-script-logotype-97VVCZN\" target=\"_self\"><img alt=\"Font ligatures Hazzard\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/2056/posts/35554/image/FontLigatures-HazzardBold-3.jpg\"></a><figcaption><a href=\"https://elements.envato.com/hazzard-bold-script-logotype-97VVCZN\" target=\"_self\">Hazzard</a></figcaption></figure><p>Hazzard Script is a retro-inspired font combined with hand lettering. The curves on each character are smooth and highly crafted and perfected. This cursive font contains bonus swashes, perfect for logos and branding. The ligatures can help you use unique two-character combinations, giving your logo a very special look.</p><h3><a href=\"https://elements.envato.com/augillion-soft-bold-serif-LLHL6EG\" target=\"_self\">Augillion</a></h3><figure class=\"post_image\"><a href=\"https://elements.envato.com/augillion-soft-bold-serif-LLHL6EG\" target=\"_self\"><img alt=\"Font ligatures Augillion\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/2056/posts/35554/image/FontLigatures-AugillionSoft-4.jpg\"></a><figcaption><a href=\"https://elements.envato.com/augillion-soft-bold-serif-LLHL6EG\" target=\"_self\">Augillion</a></figcaption></figure><p>This soft serif font is modern and bold. It has a romantic vibe, and the pack includes a swashes character set and awesome ligatures. Use the latter for branding or titles and create a unique look with the character combinations. </p><h3><a href=\"https://elements.envato.com/hariette-sofirya-monoline-signature-N9CDKZV\" target=\"_self\">Hariette Sofirya</a></h3><figure class=\"post_image\"><a href=\"https://elements.envato.com/hariette-sofirya-monoline-signature-N9CDKZV\" target=\"_self\"><img alt=\"Font ligatures Hariette\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/2056/posts/35554/image/FontLigatures-HarietteSofirya-5.jpg\"></a><figcaption><a href=\"https://elements.envato.com/hariette-sofirya-monoline-signature-N9CDKZV\" target=\"_self\">Hariette</a></figcaption></figure><p>Hariette Sofirya is a script font that contains a natural line movement. This monoline signature style script is elegant, with playful swashes. High-quality handwritten style fonts are hard to find, and Hariette Sofirya is the perfect script font for any branding project. </p><h2>That's It!</h2><p>In this article, we showed you what ligatures are, how to use ligatures in Illustrator, Photoshop, and InDesign, and how to turn on and turn off ligatures in InDesign. Ligatures in InDesign are useful for stylistic purposes and to save space with kerning. We outlined some of the best ligature fonts, and now it's your turn to show us your favorites!</p><p>Looking for <a href=\"https://elements.envato.com/fonts/serif/ligatures/spacing-normal\" target=\"_self\">serif font ligatures</a>? Be sure to check out <a href=\"https://elements.envato.com/\" target=\"_self\">Envato Elements</a> and <a href=\"https://graphicriver.net/\" target=\"_self\">GraphicRiver</a> for amazing design assets.<br></p><p>If you liked this article, you might like these:</p><ul class=\"roundup-block__contents posts--half-width roundup-block--list\">\n<li class=\"roundup-block__content\"><a 695.gif":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn83@2020_4/2020/09/05/06-45-42-326_1ff1e7250d2040d4.webp","https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/2056/posts/34717/preview_image/MonospacedFonts-thumb-2-5.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn13@2020_2/2020/09/05/06-45-37-540_61e329575b1305c4.webp","https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/114/posts/30372/preview_image/Preview.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx22/cdn22@2020_6/2020/09/05/06-45-44-525_10a41dfe149d7566.webp","https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/2056/posts/35110/preview_image/0-SVGFontExample-ColorPaperColorFonts-SVGFont-thumbnail.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn18@2020_3/2020/09/05/06-45-38-878_2666830ed3d21c84.webp","https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/2056/posts/33346/preview_image/Screenshot-2019-06-22-at-08.57.05.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn84@2020_1/2020/09/05/06-45-44-401_0cbba48f0bda76e0.webp","http://audio.tutsplus.com.feedsportal.com/c/35227/f/668805/s/35554/sc/4/mf.gif":null,"http://da.feedsportal.com/r/186529796139/u/407/f/668805/c/35227/s/35554/a2.img":null,"http://pi.feedsportal.com/r/186529796139/u/407/f/668805/c/35227/s/35554/a2t.img":null},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1599288318841},{"createdTime":"2020-09-05 Not only does Elements offer a great selection of photo-realistic mockups, created by talented designers around the world, but you can also download as many as you want, as often as you want, for <strong>one flat monthly fee</strong>. </p><p>What's more, that monthly fee also allows you to access thousands of other top-quality digital assets like logos, graphic templates, photos, business card templates, and much more. Here's a small selection of the awesome face mask mockups in PSD format found at Elements.</p><h3>\n<a href=\"https://elements.envato.com/face-mask-mockup-template-TQQYF4X\" rel=\"external\" target=\"_blank\">Face Mask Mockup Template</a> (PSD)</h3><figure class=\"post_image\"><a href=\"https://elements.envato.com/face-mask-mockup-template-TQQYF4X\" rel=\"external\" target=\"_blank\"><img alt=\"Face Mask Mockup Template PSD\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/2660/posts/35349/image/face-mask-mockup-template-TQQYF4X.jpg\"></a></figure><p>You can get your face mask design in a real-life setting with this mockup for Photoshop. It's fully customisable, so you can tweak and edit as much as you want. Thanks to Smart Objects, getting this face mask mockup right is easier than you'd think.</p><h3>\n<a href=\"https://elements.envato.com/face-mask-mockup-WVKCB6F\" rel=\"external\" target=\"_blank\">Face Mask Mockup</a> (PSD)<br>\n</h3><figure class=\"post_image\"><a href=\"https://elements.envato.com/face-mask-mockup-WVKCB6F\" rel=\"external\" target=\"_blank\"><img alt=\"Face Mask Mockup\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/2660/posts/35349/image/face-mask-mockup-WVKCB6F.jpg\"></a></figure><p>This face mask mockup is like having a blank canvas. It's fully customisable and has a transparent background.
