Just add your design and export it to a video or GIF file. </p><h3>\n<a href=\"https://graphicriver.net/item/face-mask-mockup/26427969\" rel=\"external\" target=\"_blank\">Face Mask Mock-up</a> (PSD) </h3><figure class=\"post_image\"><a href=\"https://graphicriver.net/item/face-mask-mockup/26427969\" rel=\"external\" target=\"_blank\"><img alt=\"Photoshop Face Mask Mockup\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/2660/posts/35349/image/graphicriver-hejWTQOl-face-mask-mockup-inline-image-preview-source.jpg\"></a></figure><p>This face mask mockup uses a real photo instead of a render for photo-realistic results. The Photoshop file loads your designs quickly, so you can see the final product. With the help of Smart Objects, you can edit all parts of the face mask, including the inside design. </p><h3>\n<a href=\"https://graphicriver.net/item/face-mask-mockup/26493589\" rel=\"external\" target=\"_blank\">Face Mask Mockup</a> (PSD)</h3><figure class=\"post_image\"><a href=\"https://graphicriver.net/item/face-mask-mockup/26493589\" target=\"_self\"><img alt=\"Face Mask Mockup\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/48/posts/35061/image/Face-Mask.jpg\"></a></figure><p>When you need to wear a face mask day in and out, you want a design that shows your individuality or even your concerns. Use this high-quality face mask mockup in PSD file format to add your own twist to your masks. The template offers three views—front, half-turn, and side—and what's more, it allows for a high degree of customisation using smart objects. <br></p><h3>\n<a href=\"https://graphicriver.net/item/face-mask-with-valve-mockup/26444776\" rel=\"external\" target=\"_blank\">Medical Face Mask Mockup</a> (PSD)</h3><figure class=\"post_image\"><a href=\"https://graphicriver.net/item/face-mask-with-valve-mockup/26444776\" target=\"_self\"><img alt=\"Medical Face Mask Mockup\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/48/posts/35061/image/Medical-Face-Mask.jpg\"></a></figure><p>Looking for a surgical mask mockup with value included? This is the template for you. Easy to use and fully customisable, the template includes three PSD files offering a front, half-turn, and side view.  Use the smart object for fast and easy editing.</p><h3>\n<a href=\"https://graphicriver.net/item/face-mask-mockup-v3/26569340\" rel=\"external\" target=\"_blank\">Mouth Mask Mockup</a> (PSD)</h3><figure class=\"post_image\"><a href=\"https://graphicriver.net/item/face-mask-mockup-v3/26569340\" target=\"_self\"><img alt=\"Mouth Mask Mockup\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/48/posts/35061/image/Mouth-Mask.jpg\"></a></figure><p>Display your stunning designs and messages with this mouth mask mockup from GraphicRiver. The template contains seven PSD files that you can customise extensively using smart objects. A PDF help file is included. </p><h3>\n<a href=\"https://graphicriver.net/item/face-mask-mockup/26376915\" rel=\"external\" target=\"_blank\">Fabric Mask Mockup</a> (PSD)</h3><figure class=\"post_image\"><a href=\"https://graphicriver.net/item/face-mask-mockup/26376915\" target=\"_self\"><img alt=\"Fabric Mask Mockup PSD\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/48/posts/35061/image/Fabric-Mask.jpg\"></a></figure><p>Add your special design to this fabric mask mockup and create a mask that stands out. This PSD file is organised in layers for easy editing. You can change the text, edit the colours, move items, turn off/on layers, etc., to create different looks.</p><h3>\n<a href=\"https://graphicriver.net/item/face-mask-mockups-pack/26423124\" rel=\"external\" target=\"_blank\">Surgical Mask Mockup</a> (PSD)</h3><figure class=\"post_image\"><a href=\"https://graphicriver.net/item/face-mask-mockups-pack/26423124\" target=\"_self\"><img alt=\"Surgical Mask Mockup\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/48/posts/35061/image/Surgical-Mask.jpg\"></a></figure><p>This surgical mask mockup template offers four different styles of masks and 11 layered and well-organised PSD files. The high-quality files make it very easy for users to change the design using smart layers.</p><h2><b>Choose Your Favourite Face Mask Mockup Today </b></h2><p>Envato Elements is an excellent resource for gorgeous <a href=\"https://elements.envato.com/graphic-templates/face+masks+mockups\" target=\"_self\">face mask mockups in PSD</a> file format. If you also regularly need fonts, icons, and other design resources, Elements offers unlimited downloads for one low monthly fee. </p><p>Alternatively, if you just want to buy a single <a href=\"https://graphicriver.net/face+mask+mockups-in-graphics\" target=\"_self\">face mask mockup in PSD</a>, GraphicRiver is an excellent source for high-quality mockups. </p><p>If you don't use Photoshop or are looking for an easier option for customising face mask mockups, then Placeit is the perfect choice for you. Its <a href=\"https://placeit.net/?search=face%20mask%20mockup\" rel=\"external\" target=\"_blank\">online face mask mockup generator</a> is easy to use and will allow you to customise your own mockup in a matter of minutes. </p><p>Finally, if you want more information on other terrific mockups, check out these really helpful resources below: </p><ul class=\"roundup-block__contents reatedDate":1599288318843},{"createdTime":"2020-09-05 14:45:18","updatedTime":"2020-09-05 14:45:18","title":"How to Create a Photo Caricature in Adobe Photoshop","link":"https://design.tutsplus.com/tutorials/how-to-create-a-photo-caricature-in-adobe-photoshop--cms-22866","description":"<figure class=\"final-product final-product--image\"><img src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/33/posts/22866/final_image/digital-caricature-tutorial-photoshop-final.jpg\" alt=\"Final product image\"><!--googleoff: index--><figcaption>What You'll Be Creating</figcaption><!--googleon: index--></figure><p>Caricatures are a fun alternative to traditional portraits. The idea is to comically exaggerate particular features to create a humorous representation of that person. In this tutorial, I'll show you how to turn a photo into a caricature using Photoshop. </p><h2>What You'll Learn in This Tutorial on How to Create a Photo Caricature in Adobe Photoshop:</h2><ul>\n<li>\nHow to create a caricature from a photo in Photoshop</li>\n<li>How to convert a photo to a caricature</li>\n<li>How to warp photos in Photoshop</li>\n<li>How to change the size of facial features in Photoshop</li>\n<li>How to create a caricature Photoshop effect</li>\n</ul><p>Follow along with us over on our <a href=\"https://www.youtube.com/user/TutsPremium\" target=\"_self\" title=\"Link: https://www.youtube.com/user/TutsPremium\">Envato Tuts+ YouTube channel</a>:</p><figure data-video-embed=\"true\" data-original-url=\"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=WWjbelncNPc\" class=\"embedded-video\">\n  <iframe src=\"//www.youtube.com/embed/WWjbelncNPc?rel=0\" webkitallowfullscreen=\"webkitallowfullscreen\" mozallowfullscreen=\"mozallowfullscreen\" allowfullscreen=\"allowfullscreen\" frameborder=\"0\"></iframe>\n</figure><h2>An Optional Shortcut</h2><p>If you're looking for a shortcut, you can create some great effects using the <a href=\"https://elements.envato.com/add-ons/actions-and-presets/compatible-with-adobe-photoshop\" target=\"_self\">Photoshop actions</a> on Envato Elements.</p><figure class=\"post_image\"><img alt=\"Photoshop actions on Envato Elements\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/108/posts/35328/image/digital-caricature-tutorial-photoshop-promo-intro3.jpg\" title=\"Image: https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/108/posts/35328/image/digital-caricature-tutorial-photoshop-promo-intro3.jpg\"></figure><p>Or for something more personal and customized, you can find a wide range of <a href=\"https://studio.envato.com/explore/caricatures-cartoon-design\" target=\"_self\">caricaturists</a> on Envato Studio. They'll draw a unique caricature based on the photo and instructions you provide.</p><figure class=\"post_image\"><img alt=\"caricaturists on Envato Studio\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/108/posts/35328/image/digital-caricature-tutorial-photoshop-promo-intro4..jpg\" title=\"Image: https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/108/posts/35328/image/digital-caricature-tutorial-photoshop-promo-intro4..jpg\"></figure><p>If you'd rather do it yourself, however, read on for the full manual process.</p><h2>Tutorial Assets</h2><p>This caricature tutorial requires two files. The files you will need are:<br></p><ul>\n<li>A portrait photo. Feel free to use one of your own, or <a href=\"https://elements.envato.com/health-care-eyesight-and-vision-concept-handsome-m-C97GF67\" rel=\"external\" target=\"_blank\">use the same one I used</a>.</li>\n<li>A textured background. I created this one using the Adobe Texture Paper Pro extension (available to download as the <a text=\"attachment\" href=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/254/posts/22866/attachment/PhotoCaricatureFiles.zip\" target=\"_self\">attachment</a>)<br>\n</li>\n</ul><figure class=\"post_image\"><img alt=\"Textured background\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/108/posts/35328/image/digital-caricature-tutorial-photoshop-0.jpg\" title=\"Image: https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/108/posts/35328/image/digital-caricature-tutorial-photoshop-0.jpg\"></figure><h2>\n<span class=\"sectionnum\">1.</span> Prepare the Photograph to Caricature<br>\n</h2><p>The essential technique for creating a caricature is to find elements that are already naturally pronounced, and exaggerate them to a comical degree. In our starter photo here, the man's jawline is rather large, and his smile is very prominent. The horn-rimmed glasses are noticeable, and the hairline is beginning to recede. These are all aspects of his portrait we can have fun with.</p><figure class=\"post_image\"><img alt=\"The Beginning Portrait\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/108/posts/35328/image/digital-caricature-tutorial-photoshop-1-1.jpg\" title=\"Image: https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/108/posts/35328/image/digital-caricature-tutorial-photoshop-1-1.jpg\"></figure><h3>Step 1</h3><p>Now I'll show you how to make a caricature in Adobe Photoshop. In Photoshop, it’s easy to extract the figure from the background. Just pick the <strong>Magic Wand Tool (I),</strong> click <strong>Select Subject</strong>, and then press <strong>Control-J</strong> to create a cutout layer of the man.</p><figure class=\"post_image\"><img alt=\"select subject tool\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/108/posts/35328/image/digital-caricature-tutorial-photoshop-1-2.jpg\"></figure><figure class=\"post_image\"><img alt=\"Extract the figure from the background\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/108/posts/35328/image/digital-caricature-tutorial-photoshop-1-3.jpg\" title=\"Image: https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/108/posts/35328/image/digital-caricature-tutorial-photoshop-1-3.jpg\"></figure><h3>Step 2</h3><p>It's much easier to work with particular features if they are isolated. Use the<strong> Curvature Pen Tool (P) </strong>to outline the individual elements, and press <strong>Control-Enter</strong> to turn the outline into a selection. The body and clothing layer should follow the neckline of his shirt.</p><figure class=\"post_image\"><img alt=\"Cutout the bodyclothes\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/108/posts/35328/image/digital-caricature-tutorial-photoshop-1-4.jpg\" title=\"Image: https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/108/posts/35328/image/digital-caricature-tutorial-photoshop-1-4.jpg\"></figure><figure class=\"post_image\"><img alt=\"\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/108/posts/35328/image/digital-caricature-tutorial-photoshop-1-6.jpg\"></figure><p>Keep the selection large and rough when creating the chin layer—we will make it blend in nicely later.</p><figure class=\"post_image\"><img alt=\"Create a Chin Layer\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/108/posts/35328/image/digital-caricature-tutorial-photoshop-1-7.jpg\" title=\"Image: https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/108/posts/35328/image/digital-caricature-tutorial-photoshop-1-7.jpg\"></figure><p>Keep the mouth layer selection outside the lip area so there's room to blend it in later.</p><figure class=\"post_image\"><img alt=\"Create a Mouth Layer\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/108/posts/35328/image/digital-caricature-tutorial-photoshop-1-8.jpg\" title=\"Image: https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/108/posts/35328/image/digital-caricature-tutorial-photoshop-1-8.jpg\"></figure><p>Likewise, keep the selection around the nose rough, with plenty of room to spare.</p><figure class=\"post_image\"><img alt=\"Create a nose layer\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/108/posts/35328/image/digital-caricature-tutorial-photoshop-1-9.jpg\" title=\"Image: https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/108/posts/35328/image/digital-caricature-tutorial-photoshop-1-9.jpg\"></figure><p>Keep the selection around the glasses nice and tight, and include the eyes.</p><figure class=\"post_image\"><img alt=\"Create a selection for the glasses layer\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/108/posts/35328/image/digital-caricature-tutorial-photoshop-1-10.jpg\" title=\"Image: https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/108/posts/35328/image/digital-caricature-tutorial-photoshop-1-10.jpg\"></figure><p>Keep the selection tight around the outside contour of the ear, but give yourself room to work with on the inner side.</p><figure class=\"post_image\"><img alt=\"Create the ear layer\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/108/posts/35328/image/digital-caricature-tutorial-photoshop-1-11.jpg\" title=\"Image: https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/108/posts/35328/image/digital-caricature-tutorial-photoshop-1-11.jpg\"></figure><h3>Step 3</h3><p>Just to keep things as flexible as possible, let's transform each layer into a Smart Object. Grab each layer individually and <strong>right click &gt; Convert to Smart Object</strong>.</p><figure class=\"post_image\"><img alt=\"\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/108/posts/35328/image/digital-caricature-tutorial-photoshop-1-13.jpg\" title=\"Image: https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/108/posts/35328/image/digital-caricature-tutorial-photoshop-1-13.jpg\"></figure><h2>\n<span class=\"sectionnum\">2.</span> Change the Size of the Facial Features<br>\n</h2><p>Now that the different features are all on their own layer, we can begin transforming them into an exaggerated caricature. Use the flexibility of the Smart Objects to work with different size combinations to get a humorous effect.<br></p><h3>Step 1</h3><p>A common caricature technique is to make the head extremely large in proportion to the body. To accomplish this, shrink the body layer down significantly with <strong>Edit &gt; Free Transform </strong>(or use the shortcut <strong>Control-T</strong>).</p><figure class=\"post_image\"><img alt=\"\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/108/posts/35328/image/digital-caricature-tutorial-photoshop-2-1.jpg\"></figure><h3>Step 2<br>\n</h3><p>Use <strong>Edit &gt; Transform &gt; Warp</strong> to begin shaping the head layer. Fit the neck into the neckline of the shirt and inflate the top of the head. The goal of this step is just to establish the basic shape of the head, and that serves as a foundation for the other layers to build on.</p><figure class=\"post_image\"><img alt=\"Warp the head layer\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/108/posts/35328/image/digital-caricature-tutorial-photoshop-2-2.jpg\" title=\"Image: https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/108/posts/35328/image/digital-caricature-tutorial-photoshop-2-2.jpg\"></figure><h3>Step 3<br>\n</h3><p>Distort the chin layer to elongate it and sharpen it slightly. Try to keep the top aligned so the seams are not overly visible. Hold <strong>Control</strong> to drag the corners separately.</p><figure class=\"post_image\"><img alt=\"Distort the chin\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/108/posts/35328/image/digital-caricature-tutorial-photoshop-2-3.jpg\" title=\"Image: https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/108/posts/35328/image/digital-caricature-tutorial-photoshop-2-3.jpg\"></figure><h3>Step 4<br>\n</h3><p>Make that big grin even larger by stretching out the mouth layer. <br></p><figure class=\"post_image\"><img alt=\"Stretch the mouth into a larger grin\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/108/posts/35328/image/digital-caricature-tutorial-photoshop-2-4.jpg\" title=\"Image: https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/108/posts/35328/image/digital-caricature-tutorial-photoshop-2-4.jpg\"></figure><h3>Step 5<br>\n</h3><p>Caricatures frequently make noses extremely large and exaggerated. Expand the nose layer to comical proportions—even if it overlaps the mouth, it's OK.</p><figure class=\"post_image\"><img alt=\"Increase the nose size\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/108/posts/35328/image/digital-caricature-tutorial-photoshop-2-5.jpg\" title=\"Image: https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/108/posts/35328/image/digital-caricature-tutorial-photoshop-2-5.jpg\"></figure><h3>Step 6<br>\n</h3><p>The glasses layer requires more attention than the simple scaling we used with the other features. The <strong>Edit &gt; Transform &gt; Warp</strong> tool can be used to adjust their shape to the head.</p><figure class=\"post_image\"><img alt=\"Size up the glasses and use warp to fit them to the face\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/108/posts/35328/image/digital-caricature-tutorial-photoshop-2-6.jpg\" title=\"Image: https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/108/posts/35328/image/digital-caricature-tutorial-photoshop-2-6.jpg\"></figure><h3>Step 7<br>\n</h3><p>All the distortion has nearly eliminated the ear on the base head layer. Good thing we have an ear layer to scale up so that it can support the heft of those glasses!</p><figure class=\"post_image\"><img alt=\"Increase the ear layer too\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/108/posts/35328/image/digital-caricature-tutorial-photoshop-2-7.jpg\" title=\"Image: https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/108/posts/35328/image/digital-caricature-tutorial-photoshop-2-7.jpg\"></figure><h3>Step 8<br>\n</h3><p>Now add a <strong>Layer Mask</strong> to each layer and use a soft brush with black paint to blend the individual elements into a cohesive whole. Masking the chin is the most challenging, as you have to work around the\n hairs of the beard. Just use a smaller sized brush and work carefully.</p><figure class=\"post_image\"><img alt=\"blend the elements of the face\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/108/posts/35328/image/digital-caricature-tutorial-photoshop-2-8.jpg\" title=\"Image: https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/108/posts/35328/image/digital-caricature-tutorial-photoshop-2-8.jpg\"></figure><figure class=\"post_image\"><img alt=\"add layer mask to each layer\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/108/posts/35328/image/digital-caricature-tutorial-photoshop-2-9.jpg\"></figure><h3>Step 9<br>\n</h3><p>Add a new layer above all the cutout layers and use the <strong>Spot Healing Brush (J)</strong> set to <strong>Sample All Layers</strong> to paint over any obvious seams or trouble areas that escaped the masking process.</p><figure class=\"post_image\"><img alt=\"Top layer to cover over seams\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/108/posts/35328/image/digital-caricature-tutorial-photoshop-2-10.jpg\" title=\"Image: https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/108/posts/35328/image/digital-caricature-tutorial-photoshop-2-10.jpg\"></figure><h2>\n<span class=\"sectionnum\">3.</span> Warp Facial Features<br>\n</h2><p>Next up is the true power behind the caricature process. It's the infamous Liquify feature. We've already done much of the warp work with the different transformations, but it's the Liquify feature that is really going to create a fluid, funny, exaggerated appearance. The Liquify tools are powerful and can be unpredictable, but fortunately the feature supports Smart Filtering, so there's no worries!<br></p><h3>Step 1</h3><p>Select all of the cutout layers and the seam cover layer and merge them into a single Smart Object with <strong>Layer &gt; Smart Object &gt; Convert to Smart Object.</strong></p><figure class=\"post_image\"><img alt=\"\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/108/posts/35328/image/digital-caricature-tutorial-photoshop-3-1.jpg\" title=\"Image: https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/108/posts/35328/image/digital-caricature-tutorial-photoshop-3-1.jpg\"></figure><h3>Step 2<br>\n</h3><p>Go to <strong>Filter &gt; Liquify</strong>. Use the <strong>Forward Warp Tool </strong>with a big brush to increase the size of his forehead. Gently push the skin area up towards the hairline.</p><figure class=\"post_image\"><img alt=\"Push the hairline back even further\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/108/posts/35328/image/digital-caricature-tutorial-photoshop-3-2.jpg\" title=\"Image: https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/108/posts/35328/image/digital-caricature-tutorial-photoshop-3-2.jpg\"></figure><h3>Step 3<br>\n</h3><p>Use the <strong>Bloat Tool</strong> to click a few times on the tip of his nose to make it look more bulbous.</p><figure class=\"post_image\"><img alt=\"Create a larger tip to his nose\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/108/posts/35328/image/digital-caricature-tutorial-photoshop-3-3.jpg\" title=\"Image: https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/108/posts/35328/image/digital-caricature-tutorial-photoshop-3-3.jpg\"></figure><h3>Step 4<br>\n</h3><p>Use the <strong>Freeze Mask Tool</strong> to highlight the frames of the glasses. This will prevent the frames from distorting while we work with the eyes.</p><figure class=\"post_image\"><img alt=\"Freeze Mask the glasses frames\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/108/posts/35328/image/digital-caricature-tutorial-photoshop-3-4.jpg\" title=\"Image: https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/108/posts/35328/image/digital-caricature-tutorial-photoshop-3-4.jpg\"></figure><h3>Step 5<br>\n</h3><p>Use the <strong>Bloat Tool</strong> to create a slightly larger shape to the eyes—just be sure to reduce the size of the brush to be similar in size to the eyeballs. When you've finished, click the <strong>None</strong> button in the <strong>Mask Options</strong> to unfreeze the masked area.</p><figure class=\"post_image\"><img alt=\"exaggerate the shape of the temple area\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/108/posts/35328/image/digital-caricature-tutorial-photoshop-3-5.jpg\" title=\"Image: https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/108/posts/35328/image/digital-caricature-tutorial-photoshop-3-5.jpg\"></figure><h3>Step 6<br>\n</h3><p>Extend the chin a bit more using the <strong>Forward Warp Tool</strong> and create a more rounded, bulbous end with the <strong>Bloat Tool</strong>.</p><figure class=\"post_image\"><img alt=\"Chin Extension\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/108/posts/35328/image/digital-caricature-tutorial-photoshop-3-6.jpg\"></figure><h3>Step 7<br>\n</h3><p>Finally, make his smile even bigger by using the <strong>Forward Warp Tool</strong> to push the corners of his mouth up into the folds on his cheeks. Just be careful not to warp the shape of the teeth. <br></p><figure class=\"post_image\"><img alt=\"Bigger smile\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/108/posts/35328/image/digital-caricature-tutorial-photoshop-3-7.jpg\"></figure><p>Apply the <strong>Liquify</strong> effect, and your caricature should look something like this.</p><figure class=\"post_image\"><img alt=\"Liquify effect applied\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/108/posts/35328/image/digital-caricature-tutorial-photoshop-3-8.jpg\" title=\"Image: https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/108/posts/35328/image/digital-caricature-tutorial-photoshop-3-8.jpg\"></figure><h2>\n<span class=\"sectionnum\">4.</span> Add a Background<br>\n</h2><p>Now that we've twisted up this poor man's face, let's make it look more like a painted image. We'll start by having a more artistic background.<br></p><h3>Step 1</h3><p>Add a <strong>Layer Mask</strong> to the caricature layer and use a textured brush to fade the bottom of the layer out. I chose the <strong>Sponge Brush Projection</strong> brush preset here (you can find it in the Legacy brush set). <br></p><figure class=\"post_image\"><img alt=\"texture brush\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/108/posts/35328/image/digital-caricature-tutorial-photoshop-4-1.jpg\" title=\"Image: https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/108/posts/35328/image/digital-caricature-tutorial-photoshop-4-1.jpg\"></figure><figure class=\"post_image\"><img alt=\"Mask out the bottom of the caricature layer\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/108/posts/35328/image/digital-caricature-tutorial-photoshop-4-2.jpg\" title=\"Image: https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/108/posts/35328/image/digital-caricature-tutorial-photoshop-4-2.jpg\"></figure><h3>Step 2<br>\n</h3><p>Open the <strong>BackgroundTexture.jpg</strong> file from the tutorial assets and place it as a layer underneath the caricature layer.</p><figure class=\"post_image\"><img alt=\"Add the textured background\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/108/posts/35328/image/digital-caricature-tutorial-photoshop-4-3.jpg\" title=\"Image: https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/108/posts/35328/image/digital-caricature-tutorial-photoshop-4-3.jpg\"></figure><h3>Step 3<br>\n</h3><p>Add a new layer over the textured background. <strong>Fill</strong> it with white and use the same textured brush from the mask work to add a white brushed border effect.</p><figure class=\"post_image\"><img alt=\"Brushed border\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/108/posts/35328/image/digital-caricature-tutorial-photoshop-4-4.jpg\" title=\"Image: https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/108/posts/35328/image/digital-caricature-tutorial-photoshop-4-4.jpg\"></figure><h2>\n<span class=\"sectionnum\">5.</span> Add a Painterly Effect<br>\n</h2><p>Now we are ready to transform the caricature itself into a painting. We want to retain some of the photographic qualities, but still give the impression of a hand-painted piece. This is easily done using a smudge painting technique.<br></p><h3>Step 1</h3><p>Smaller details tend to disrupt the smudge painting process, so it's best to smooth them out first. Go to<strong> Filter &gt; Blur &gt; Smart Blur</strong>. Set <strong>Quality</strong> to <strong>High</strong>, and experiment with the sliders.</p><figure class=\"post_image\"><img alt=\"add smart blur\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/108/posts/35328/image/digital-caricature-tutorial-photoshop-5-1.jpg\" title=\"Image: https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/108/posts/35328/image/digital-caricature-tutorial-photoshop-5-1.jpg\"></figure><figure class=\"post_image\"><img alt=\"Smart Blur to remove the finer details\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/108/posts/35328/image/digital-caricature-tutorial-photoshop-5-2.jpg\"></figure><h3>Step 2<br>\n</h3><p>The highlights in the photo appear a little bright. Correct this by clipping a <strong>Curves Adjustment Layer</strong> to the caricature layer and using the <strong>Curves</strong> to decrease the bright areas.</p><figure class=\"post_image\"><img alt=\"curves adjustment layer\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/108/posts/35328/image/digital-caricature-tutorial-photoshop-5-3.jpg\"></figure><figure class=\"post_image\"><img alt=\"Curves to bring down the highlights\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/108/posts/35328/image/digital-caricature-tutorial-photoshop-5-4.jpg\"></figure><h3>Step 3<br>\n</h3><p>Create a new layer at the top of the layer stack. Grab the <strong>Smudge Tool </strong>with a <strong>Brush Size</strong> around <strong>40 pixels</strong>. Set the <strong>Strength</strong> to <strong>80%</strong> and check the <strong>Sample All Layers</strong> option. Then begin smudging along the major features of the image. Follow the natural grain of the skin to keep the appearance very fluid.</p><figure class=\"post_image\"><img alt=\"smudge tool settings\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/108/posts/35328/image/digital-caricature-tutorial-photoshop-5-5.jpg\" title=\"Image: https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/108/posts/35328/image/digital-caricature-tutorial-photoshop-5-5.jpg\"></figure><figure class=\"post_image\"><img alt=\"Smudge along the major features\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/108/posts/35328/image/digital-caricature-tutorial-photoshop-5-6.jpg\"></figure><h3>Step 4<br>\n</h3><p>Reduce the brush size to about 5 pixels and begin smudging along the smaller details of the image like the eyebrows, individual strands of hair, his eyes, and his teeth.</p><figure class=\"post_image\"><img alt=\"begin smudging along the smaller details of the image\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/108/posts/35328/image/digital-caricature-tutorial-photoshop-5-7.jpg\" title=\"Image: https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/108/posts/35328/image/digital-caricature-tutorial-photoshop-5-7.jpg\"></figure><h3>Step 5<br>\n</h3><p>Create a merged layer of the smudge layer, the caricature layer, and the adjustment layer by selecting all of them and holding the<strong> Alt </strong>key while going to <strong>Layer &gt; Merge Layers (Control-E)</strong>. Then go to <strong>Filter &gt; Other High Pass</strong> set the <strong>Radius</strong> to <strong>5.0</strong> <strong>Pixels </strong>or more. Call this layer <strong>Details</strong>.</p><figure class=\"post_image\"><img alt=\"Use the High Pass Filter\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/108/posts/35328/image/digital-caricature-tutorial-photoshop-5-8.jpg\" title=\"Image: https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/108/posts/35328/image/digital-caricature-tutorial-photoshop-5-8.jpg\"></figure><figure class=\"post_image\"><img alt=\"high pass filter effect\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/108/posts/35328/image/digital-caricature-tutorial-photoshop-5-9.jpg\" title=\"Image: https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/108/posts/35328/image/digital-caricature-tutorial-photoshop-5-9.jpg\"></figure><h3>Step 6<br>\n</h3><p>Change the <strong>Details</strong> layer <strong>Blending Mode</strong> to <strong>Overlay</strong>, reduce the <strong>Opacity</strong> to <strong>78%</strong>, and then go to <strong>Layer &gt; Layer Mask &gt; Hide All</strong>. Use a soft, white brush on the mask to reveal the details in the eyes, eyebrows, nose, mouth, and beard.</p><figure class=\"post_image\"><img alt=\"layer settings\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/108/posts/35328/image/digital-caricature-tutorial-photoshop-5-10.jpg\" title=\"Image: https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/108/posts/35328/image/digital-caricature-tutorial-photoshop-5-10.jpg\"></figure><figure class=\"post_image\"><img alt=\"Reveal the details with a layer mask\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/108/posts/35328/image/digital-caricature-tutorial-photoshop-5-11.jpg\"></figure><h3>Step 7<br>\n</h3><p>Add a new layer called <strong>Dodge/Burn</strong> and fill it with <strong>50% gray</strong> through the <strong>Edit &gt; Fill </strong>feature. Set the <strong>Blending Mode</strong> to <strong>Overlay</strong> and then use a soft <strong>Black</strong> brush at <strong>30% Opacity</strong> to simulate a <strong>Burn</strong> effect. Switch to <strong>White</strong> to simulate a <strong>Dodge</strong> effect.</p><figure class=\"post_image\"><img alt=\"Simulated DodgeBurn effect\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/108/posts/35328/image/digital-caricature-tutorial-photoshop-5-12.jpg\" title=\"Image: https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/108/posts/35328/image/digital-caricature-tutorial-photoshop-5-12.jpg\"></figure><h3>Step 8<br>\n</h3><p>Add a final color effect. First, create a merged layer of all the layers by pressing <strong>Control-Alt-Shift-E</strong>. Then go to <strong>Filter &gt; Camera Raw</strong> and play with the <strong>Contrast,</strong> <strong>Clarity,</strong> and <strong>Vibrance</strong> to create a more painterly effect.</p><figure class=\"post_image\"><img alt=\"Camera Raw final color effects\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/108/posts/35328/image/digital-caricature-tutorial-photoshop-5-13.jpg\" title=\"Image: https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/108/posts/35328/image/digital-caricature-tutorial-photoshop-5-13.jpg\"></figure><h2>Done!</h2><p>And now you are finished! Behold your amazing photo caricature work. Now take these techniques and go apply them to photos of your friends and family to create some fun, unique, and personal portraits!</p><figure class=\"post_image\"><img alt=\"The Final Caricature\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/108/posts/35328/image/digital-caricature-tutorial-photoshop-final.jpg\" title=\"Image: https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/108/posts/35328/image/digital-caricature-tutorial-photoshop-final.jpg\"></figure><h2>Cartoon Photoshop Actions</h2><p>If you're interested in Photoshop cartoon photo effects, check out these great resources from <a href=\"https://elements.envato.com/\" target=\"_self\">Envato Elements</a>:<br></p><h3>\n<a href=\"https://elements.envato.com/cartoonize-photoshop-action-JBECFR8\" target=\"_self\" title=\"Link: https://elements.envato.com/cartoonize-photoshop-action-JBECFR8\">Cartoonize Photoshop Action</a> (ATN)<br>\n</h3><figure class=\"post_image\"><a href=\"https://elements.envato.com/cartoonize-photoshop-action-JBECFR8\" target=\"_self\"><img alt=\"Cartoonize Photoshop Action\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/108/posts/35328/image/digital-caricature-tutorial-photoshop-promo-1.jpg\" title=\"Image: https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/108/posts/35328/image/digital-caricature-tutorial-photoshop-promo-1.jpg\"></a></figure><p>This action will turn your photo into a cartoon picture with just a single click. So if you want to make your caricature picture more artistic, use this action to do it in one step!<br></p><h3>\n<a href=\"https://elements.envato.com/cartoon-halloween-text-styles-TMEMBJJ\" target=\"_self\" title=\"Link: https://elements.envato.com/cartoon-halloween-text-styles-TMEMBJJ\">Cartoon Halloween Text Styles</a> (ASL, PSD)<br>\n</h3><figure class=\"post_image\"><a href=\"https://elements.envato.com/cartoon-halloween-text-styles-TMEMBJJ\" target=\"_self\"><img alt=\"Cartoon Halloween Text Styles\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/108/posts/35328/image/digital-caricature-tutorial-photoshop-promo-2.jpg\" title=\"Image: https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/108/posts/35328/image/digital-caricature-tutorial-photoshop-promo-2.jpg\"></a></figure><p>This set contains seven different styles with a neat layout that's ready to use—you only need to add your own text to create a cartoon effect text! <br></p><h3>\n<a href=\"https://elements.envato.com/grandiose-3-animated-photoshop-action-8XLGJXC\" target=\"_self\">Turn Photo Into Cartoon Photoshop Action</a> (ATN)<br>\n</h3><figure class=\"post_image\"><a href=\"https://elements.envato.com/grandiose-3-animated-photoshop-action-8XLGJXC\" target=\"_self\"><img alt=\"Turn Photo Into Cartoon Photoshop Action\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/108/posts/35328/image/digital-caricature-tutorial-photoshop-promo-3.jpg\" title=\"Image: https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/108/posts/35328/image/digital-caricature-tutorial-photoshop-promo-3.jpg\"></a></figure><p>This powerful action will turn you into a cartoon character! You can choose from many backgrounds and color looks, and as a bonus, it's possible to animate the end result!</p><h3>\n<a href=\"https://elements.envato.com/zombie-grime-art-photoshop-action-F8GVMF5\" target=\"_self\">Zombie Grime Art Photoshop Action</a> (ATN, PAT)<br>\n</h3><figure class=\"post_image\"><a href=\"https://elements.envato.com/zombie-grime-art-photoshop-action-F8GVMF5\" target=\"_self\"><img alt=\"Zombie Grime Art Photoshop Action\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/108/posts/35328/image/digital-caricature-tutorial-photoshop-promo-4.jpg\" title=\"Image: https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/108/posts/35328/image/digital-caricature-tutorial-photoshop-promo-4.jpg\"></a></figure><p>Create a trendy zombie grime effect with this action. It's highly customizable—you can adjust the drip parameters to your needs. And it's animated as well!</p><h3>\n<a href=\"https://elements.envato.com/cartoon-style-text-effects-Q94UXPL\" target=\"_self\">Cartoon Style Text Effects</a> (PSD, ASL)<br>\n</h3><figure class=\"post_image\"><a href=\"https://elements.envato.com/cartoon-style-text-effects-Q94UXPL\" target=\"_self\"><img alt=\"Cartoon Style Text Effects\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/108/posts/35328/image/digital-caricature-tutorial-photoshop-promo-5.jpg\" title=\"Image: https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/108/posts/35328/image/digital-caricature-tutorial-photoshop-promo-5.jpg\"></a></figure><p>Choose from ten different styles to cartoonize your text. This set contains Smart Objects that can be edited to give you instant results.<br></p><h2>Want More?</h2><p>This tutorial is just an excerpt from a larger, more detailed set of instructions found in my Tuts+ course, <a href=\"https://design.tutsplus.com/courses/fluid-photo-manipulation-transform-warp-and-liquify\" rel=\"external\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"Link: https://design.tutsplus.com/courses/fluid-photo-manipulation-transform-warp-and-liquify\">Fluid Photo Manipulation: Transform, Warp, and Liquify</a>. et/gh/myreaderx15/cdn97@2020_6/2020/09/05/06-45-39-487_24bc0eb44ff2bf9d.webp","https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/108/posts/35328/image/digital-caricature-tutorial-photoshop-2-5.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn62@2020_3/2020/09/05/06-45-39-239_f255f301560ec331.webp","https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/108/posts/35328/image/digital-caricature-tutorial-photoshop-2-6.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn57@2020_2/2020/09/05/06-45-37-788_763d56d21458cfc4.webp","https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/108/posts/35328/image/digital-caricature-tutorial-photoshop-2-7.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn8@2020_2/2020/09/05/06-45-37-379_4e312063fd7b6427.webp","https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/108/posts/35328/image/digital-caricature-tutorial-photoshop-2-8.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn13@2020_2/2020/09/05/06-45-36-525_b618dfc454b3ca28.webp","https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/108/posts/35328/image/digital-caricature-tutorial-photoshop-2-9.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn99@2020_2/2020/09/05/06-45-35-454_1ece3aa64f0fab79.webp","https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/108/posts/35328/image/digital-caricature-tutorial-photoshop-2-10.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn63@2020_4/2020/09/05/06-45-33-356_c2b3e52f451c1f3e.webp","https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/108/posts/35328/image/digital-caricature-tutorial-photoshop-3-1.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn1@2020_4/2020/09/05/06-45-40-265_654d60950deac085.webp","https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/108/posts/35328/image/digital-caricature-tutorial-photoshop-3-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn65@2020_1/2020/09/05/06-45-38-680_dbeb790ec845fd76.webp","https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/108/posts/35328/image/digital-caricature-tutorial-photoshop-3-3.jpg":null,"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/108/posts/35328/image/digital-caricature-tutorial-photoshop-3-4.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx18/cdn14@2020_3/2020/09/05/06-45-39-667_87adcf4942e8732f.webp","https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/108/posts/35328/image/digital-caricature-tutorial-photoshop-3-5.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn38@2020_3/2020/09/05/06-45-36-498_156a0eb81531c249.webp","https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/108/posts/35328/image/digital-caricature-tutorial-photoshop-3-6.jpg":null,"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/108/posts/35328/image/digital-caricature-tutorial-photoshop-3-7.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn27@2020_4/2020/09/05/06-45-38-327_32bc6a4960137734.webp","https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/108/posts/35328/image/digital-caricature-tutorial-photoshop-3-8.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn34@2020_3/2020/09/05/06-45-37-672_94937daf0b58297b.webp","https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/108/posts/35328/image/digital-caricature-tutorial-photoshop-4-1.jpg":null,"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/108/posts/35328/image/digital-caricature-tutorial-photoshop-4-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn78@2020_4/2020/09/05/06-45-40-921_002d3d00a5eb1092.webp","https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/108/posts/35328/image/digital-caricature-tutorial-photoshop-4-3.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn12@2020_4/2020/09/05/06-45-35-501_0465c2a4ca89a585.webp","https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/108/posts/35328/image/digital-caricature-tutorial-photoshop-4-4.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn98@2020_2/2020/09/05/06-45-33-803_3068b3dc44aac660.webp","https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/108/posts/35328/image/digital-caricature-tutorial-photoshop-5-1.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn18@2020_5/2020/09/05/06-45-42-951_053b54e8f13695f2.webp","https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/108/posts/35328/image/digital-caricature-tutorial-photoshop-5-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn78@2020_5/2020/09/05/06-45-33-546_0611be6e692f3a25.webp","https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/108/posts/35328/image/digital-caricature-tutorial-photoshop-5-3.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn18@2020_3/2020/09/05/06-45-34-446_e97a95ae522944e5.webp","https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/108/posts/35328/image/digital-caricature-tutorial-photoshop-5-4.jpg":null,"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/108/posts/35328/image/digital-caricature-tutorial-photoshop-5-5.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn47@2020_3/2020/09/05/06-45-32-885_063f4229e618f122.webp","https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/108/posts/35328/image/digital-caricature-tutorial-photoshop-5-6.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn21@2020_4/2020/09/05/06-45-36-434_320802f07712eef8.webp","https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/108/posts/35328/image/digital-caricature-tutorial-photoshop-5-7.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn34@2020_6/2020/09/05/06-45-35-814_97355fa7fb366c73.webp","https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/108/posts/35328/image/digital-caricature-tutorial-photoshop-5-8.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn49@2020_6/2020/09/05/06-45-37-727_9c9ce7bead4bbc87.webp","https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/108/posts/35328/image/digital-caricature-tutorial-photoshop-5-9.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn28@2020_1/2020/09/05/06-45-36-814_e7c7d14c2654e528.webp","https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/108/posts/35328/image/digital-caricature-tutorial-photoshop-5-10.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn37@2020_6/2020/09/05/06-45-42-190_8ffc5c43d9f65862.webp","https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/108/posts/35328/image/digital-caricature-tutorial-photoshop-5-11.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn88@2020_5/2020/09/05/06-45-44-827_a2f3e6487d3a68ad.webp","https://cms-assets.t 03/posts/34403/preview_image/reflection_thumb.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn30@2020_2/2020/09/05/06-45-43-294_6e38f99a4097930c.webp","https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/1437/posts/35271/preview_image/preview.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn41@2020_5/2020/09/05/06-45-35-081_89c79c5678820881.webp","https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/1437/posts/35293/preview_image/preview.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn11@2020_3/2020/09/05/06-45-40-351_ac3ec386424f884a.webp","http://audio.tutsplus.com.feedsportal.com/c/35227/f/668805/s/22866/sc/4/mf.gif":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn20@2020_6/2020/09/05/06-45-42-309_02f6c3baa48f72f7.jpg","http://da.feedsportal.com/r/186529796139/u/407/f/668805/c/35227/s/22866/a2.img":null,"http://pi.feedsportal.com/r/186529796139/u/407/f/668805/c/35227/s/22866/a2t.img":null},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1599288318854},{"createdTime":"2020-09-05 14:45:18","updatedTime":"2020-09-05 14:45:18","title":"Affinity Publisher: Your Guide to InDesign’s New Rival","link":"https://design.tutsplus.com/articles/affinity-publisher-your-guide-to-indesigns-new-rival--cms-31787","description":"<p>Adobe InDesign has long been the market leader in publishing software. But rival layout design programs are starting to make waves in the market, with <a href=\"https://affinity.serif.com/publisher/\" rel=\"external\" target=\"_blank\">Affinity Publisher</a> being the latest to offer a competitive alternative to InDesign.</p><figure class=\"post_image\"><img alt=\"affinity publisher logo\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/114/posts/35564/image/affinity4.jpg\"></figure><p>If you’re considering trying out Affinity as an alternative to InDesign, consider this your ultimate Affinity Publisher guide. We’ll weigh up the pros and cons of each software option, look at some of Affinity Publisher’s coolest features, and give our verdict on whether the Affinity design suite offers serious competition for Adobe’s Creative Cloud. </p><p>This Affinity Publisher review is based on my experience of using the most recent version of the Affinity software (1.8). As a seasoned InDesign user (I even created a website, <a href=\"https://indesignskills.com/\" rel=\"external\" target=\"_blank\">InDesignSkills</a>, devoted to my love of the program), I was surprised by how much I enjoyed using Affinity software. Read on to discover what Affinity Publisher is, and why Affinity is an alternative to InDesign for aspiring and pro designers alike. </p><p>Discover a range of professionally-designed Affinity Publisher templates over at <a href=\"https://elements.envato.com/graphic-templates/affinity+publisher\" rel=\"external\" target=\"_blank\">Envato Elements</a>.</p><ul class=\"roundup-block__contents posts--half-width roundup-block--card\">\n<li class=\"roundup-block__content posts__post\"><article><header><a class=\"posts__post-preview\" href=\"https://design.tutsplus.com/tutorials/how-to-create-a-tri-fold-brochure-in-affinity-publisher-free-brochure-file--cms-35008\"><img class=\"posts__post-preview-image posts__post-preview-image--regular\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/114/posts/35008/preview_image/Preview.jpg\"></a><a class=\"roundup-block__content-link posts__post-title\" href=\"https://design.tutsplus.com/tutorials/how-to-create-a-tri-fold-brochure-in-affinity-publisher-free-brochure-file--cms-35008\"><h1 class=\"nolinks\">How to Create a Tri-Fold Brochure in Affinity Publisher (Free Brochure File)</h1></a></header><div class=\"posts__post-teaser\">In this tutorial, you’ll learn how to create a tri-fold brochure template in Affinity Publisher. Adaptable for a range of businesses and purposes, this...</div>\n<footer class=\"posts__post-details\"><div class=\"posts__post-teaser-overlay\"></div>\n<div class=\"posts__post-publication-meta\">\n<img sizes=\"76px\" class=\"posts__post-author_photo\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/114/profiles/18595/profileImage/Headshot-small.jpg\" alt=\"Grace Fussell\"><div class=\"posts__post-details__info\">\n<address class=\"posts__post-author\"><a class=\"posts__post-author-link\" href=\"https://tutsplus.com/authors/grace-fussell\">Grace Fussell</a></address>\n<time class=\"posts__post-publication-date\" datetime=\"2020-06-05 07:00:00 UTC\" title=\"05 Jun 2020\">05 Jun 2020</time>\n</div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"posts__post-primary-category topic-design\"><a class=\"posts__post-primary-category-link topic-design\" href=\"https://design.tutsplus.com/categories/affinity-publisher\">Affinity Publisher</a></div></footer></article></li>\n<li class=\"roundup-block__content posts__post\"><article><header><a class=\"posts__post-preview\" href=\"https://design.tutsplus.com/tutorials/how-to-create-a-newsletter-template-in-affinity-publisher-free-newsletter-template--cms-35070\"><img class=\"posts__post-preview-image posts__post-preview-image--regular\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/114/posts/35070/preview_image/Preview.jpg\"></a><a class=\"roundup-block__content-link posts__post-title\" href=\"https://design.tutsplus.com/tutorials/how-to-create-a-newsletter-template-in-affinity-publisher-free-newsletter-template--cms-35070\"><h1 class=\"nolinks\">How to Create a Newsletter Template in Affinity Publisher (Free Newsletter Template)</h1></a></header><div class=\"posts__post-teaser\">In this tutorial, you’ll learn how to create a newsletter template in Affinity Publisher. This business-friendly newsletter layout and simple newsletter...</div>\n<footer class=\"posts__post-details\"><div class=\"posts__post-teaser-overlay\"></div>\n<div class=\"posts__post-publication-meta\">\n<img sizes=\"76px\" class=\"posts__post-author_photo\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/114/profiles/18595/profileImage/Headshot-small.jpg\" alt=\"Grace Fussell\"><div class=\"posts__post-details__info\">\n<address class=\"posts__post-author\"><a class=\"posts__post-author-link\" href=\"https://tutsplus.com/authors/grace-fussell\">Grace Fussell</a></address>\n<time class=\"posts__post-publication-date\" datetime=\"2020-06-24 07:00:00 UTC\" title=\"24 Jun 2020\">24 Jun 2020</time>\n</div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"posts__post-primary-category topic-design\"><a class=\"posts__post-primary-category-link topic-design\" href=\"https://design.tutsplus.com/categories/newsletter-templates\">Newsletter Templates</a></div></footer></article></li>\n<li class=\"roundup-block__content posts__post\"><article><header><a class=\"posts__post-preview\" href=\"https://design.tutsplus.com/articles/transitioning-from-photoshop-to-affinity-photo--cms-31258\"><img class=\"posts__post-preview-image posts__post-preview-image--regular\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/1990/posts/31258/preview_image/Untitled-2.jpg\"></a><a class=\"roundup-block__content-link posts__post-title\" href=\"https://design.tutsplus.com/articles/transitioning-from-photoshop-to-affinity-photo--cms-31258\"><h1 class=\"nolinks\">Transitioning From Adobe Photoshop to Affinity Photo</h1></a></header><div class=\"posts__post-teaser\">Learn about the key differences between Photoshop and Affinity Photo to help you decide if you want to make the ultimate switch. Take a look at Affinity...</div>\n<footer class=\"posts__post-details\"><div class=\"posts__post-teaser-overlay\"></div>\n<div class=\"posts__post-publication-meta\">\n<img sizes=\"76px\" class=\"posts__post-author_photo\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/1990/profiles/20506/profileImage/Photo-Jul-27,-2-14-27-AM.jpg\" alt=\"Abbey Esparza\"><div class=\"posts__post-details__info\">\n<address class=\"posts__post-author\"><a class=\"posts__post-author-link\" href=\"https://tutsplus.com/authors/abbey-esparza\">Abbey Esparza</a></address>\n<time class=\"posts__post-publication-date\" datetime=\"2019-06-14 07:40:45 UTC\" title=\"14 Jun 2019\">14 Jun 2019</time>\n</div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"posts__post-primary-category topic-design\"><a class=\"posts__post-primary-category-link topic-design\" href=\"https://design.tutsplus.com/categories/affinity-photo\">Affinity Photo</a></div></footer></article></li>\n</ul><h2>What Is Affinity Publisher?</h2><p><a href=\"https://affinity.serif.com/publisher/\" rel=\"external\" target=\"_blank\">Affinity Publisher</a> is a publishing program for Mac and Windows that allows you to create single- and multi-page documents. Publishing programs are suitable for creating layout-based media, which combine typography, graphics, and photos, such as magazines, brochures, flyers, and books. Most publishing programs allow users to create content for both print and online, as well as EPUBs (eBooks). </p><figure class=\"post_image\"><img alt=\"affinity sample layout\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/114/posts/33481/image/Affinity1.jpg\"></figure><p>Serif released the full version of Affinity in June 2019 (it had previously only been available in beta format). Fans of <a href=\"https://affinity.serif.com/photo/\" rel=\"external\" target=\"_blank\">Affinity Photo</a> and <a href=\"https://affinity.serif.com/designer/\" rel=\"external\" target=\"_blank\">Affinity Designer</a>, decent and good-value alternatives to Adobe Photoshop and Illustrator, will find that Affinity Publisher makes a seamless and useful addition to their collection of Affinity apps. </p><p>Through technology called <a href=\"https://affinity.serif.com/en-us/live/\" rel=\"external\" target=\"_blank\">StudioLink</a>, Publisher can be integrated with the other apps in the Affinity design suite, Affinity Photo and Affinity Designer, allowing users to seamlessly create and edit images before integrating them into Affinity Publisher layouts. </p><figure class=\"post_image\"><img alt=\"affinity studiolink\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/114/posts/35564/image/Studiolink.jpg\"></figure><p>The lead developer of Publisher, Adam Whitehouse, has <a href=\"https://affinityspotlight.com/article/interview-with-adam-whitehouse-lead-affinity-publisher-developer/\" rel=\"external\" target=\"_blank\">commented</a> that Affinity Publisher for iPad is also in development, which will allow Publisher to reach a potentially broader audience than desktop users alone. </p><p>Read on to discover my Affinity Publisher review, as well as my ultimate Affinity Publisher guide, why Affinity is an InDesign alternative, and the verdict on which software to plump for.</p><h2>Should I Consider Switching From Adobe InDesign to Affinity Publisher?</h2><p>For budget-conscious creatives, the main advantage of Affinity Publisher is that it's excellent value, retailing at just <strong>$49.99</strong> for the single app download. Users aren't tied into a subscription model, unlike Adobe members. </p><p>Publisher's competitive price will make it a serious competitor on price point with Adobe, which offers InDesign CC at a subscription price only, with the single app costing users $20.99 a month. </p><p>In terms of usability, Affinity Publisher owes a great deal to InDesign in terms of functionality and interface. Superficially, the differences between the two are minor, and it really comes down to which program you feel most comfortable using. </p><p>I took Affinity Publisher for a test drive to see how it compares to InDesign and how it functions as a publishing program. Read on to discover my thoughts on Publisher and assess whether you should make the switch from InDesign.</p><ul class=\"roundup-block__contents posts--half-width roundup-block--card\">\n<li class=\"roundup-block__content posts__post\"><article><header><a class=\"posts__post-preview\" href=\"https://design.tutsplus.com/tutorials/how-to-make-a-tear-off-flyer-template-in-affinity-publisher-free-flyer-file-to-download--cms-35063\"><img class=\"posts__post-preview-image posts__post-preview-image--regular\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/114/posts/35063/preview_image/Preview.jpg\"></a><a class=\"roundup-block__content-link posts__post-title\" href=\"https://design.tutsplus.com/tutorials/how-to-make-a-tear-off-flyer-template-in-affinity-publisher-free-flyer-file-to-download--cms-35063\"><h1 class=\"nolinks\">How to Make a Tear-Off Flyer Template in Affinity Publisher (Free Flyer File to Download)</h1></a></header><div class=\"posts__post-teaser\">In this Affinity Publisher tutorial, you’ll learn how to create a tear-off flyer.
