class=\"posts__post-details__info\">\n<address class=\"posts__post-author\"><a class=\"posts__post-author-link\" href=\"https://tutsplus.com/authors/grace-fussell\">Grace Fussell</a></address>\n<time class=\"posts__post-publication-date\" datetime=\"2020-07-22 13:00:50 UTC\" title=\"22 Jul 2020\">22 Jul 2020</time>\n</div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"posts__post-primary-category topic-design\"><a class=\"posts__post-primary-category-link topic-design\" href=\"https://design.tutsplus.com/categories/affinity-publisher\">Affinity Publisher</a></div></footer></article></li>\n<li class=\"roundup-block__content posts__post\"><article><header><a class=\"posts__post-preview\" href=\"https://design.tutsplus.com/articles/affinity-designer-resources-roundup--cms-30750\"><img class=\"posts__post-preview-image posts__post-preview-image--regular\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/53/posts/30750/preview_image/thumb.png\"></a><a class=\"roundup-block__content-link posts__post-title\" href=\"https://design.tutsplus.com/articles/affinity-designer-resources-roundup--cms-30750\"><h1 class=\"nolinks\">22 Awesome Affinity Designer Textures, Assets &amp; Resources (Free &amp; Premium!)</h1></a></header><div class=\"posts__post-teaser\">Dig into these 22 fantastic, fully compatible Affinity Designer brushes, illustrations, icons, templates and more, as well as three courses and eight...</div>\n<footer class=\"posts__post-details\"><div class=\"posts__post-teaser-overlay\"></div>\n<div class=\"posts__post-publication-meta\">\n<img sizes=\"76px\" class=\"posts__post-author_photo\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/30/profiles/2532/profileImage/kezz.jpg\" alt=\"Kezz Bracey\"><div class=\"posts__post-details__info\">\n<address class=\"posts__post-author\"><a class=\"posts__post-author-link\" href=\"https://tutsplus.com/authors/kezz-bracey\">Kezz Bracey</a></address>\n<time class=\"posts__post-publication-date\" datetime=\"2018-03-30 10:00:00 UTC\" title=\"30 Mar 2018\">30 Mar 2018</time>\n</div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"posts__post-primary-category topic-design\"><a class=\"posts__post-primary-category-link topic-design\" href=\"https://design.tutsplus.com/categories/affinity-designer\">Affinity Designer</a></div></footer></article></li>\n<li class=\"roundup-block__content posts__post\"><article><header><a class=\"posts__post-preview\" href=\"https://design.tutsplus.com/tutorials/how-to-make-a-restaurant-menu-template-in-affinity-publisher--cms-35348\"><img class=\"posts__post-preview-image posts__post-preview-image--regular\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/114/posts/35348/preview_image/Preview.jpg\"></a><a class=\"roundup-block__content-link posts__post-title\" href=\"https://design.tutsplus.com/tutorials/how-to-make-a-restaurant-menu-template-in-affinity-publisher--cms-35348\"><h1 class=\"nolinks\">How to Make a Restaurant Menu Template in Affinity Publisher</h1></a></header><div class=\"posts__post-teaser\">In this tutorial, you’ll learn how to create a menu template for a restaurant menu using Affinity Publisher. Complete with a colorful design and on-trend...</div>\n<footer class=\"posts__post-details\"><div class=\"posts__post-teaser-overlay\"></div>\n<div class=\"posts__post-publication-meta\">\n<img sizes=\"76px\" class=\"posts__post-author_photo\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/114/profiles/18595/profileImage/Headshot-small.jpg\" alt=\"Grace Fussell\"><div class=\"posts__post-details__info\">\n<address class=\"posts__post-author\"><a class=\"posts__post-author-link\" href=\"https://tutsplus.com/authors/grace-fussell\">Grace Fussell</a></address>\n<time class=\"posts__post-publication-date\" datetime=\"2020-07-01 07:00:00 UTC\" title=\"01 Jul 2020\">01 Jul 2020</time>\n</div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"posts__post-primary-category topic-design\"><a class=\"posts__post-primary-category-link topic-design\" href=\"https://design.tutsplus.com/categories/affinity-publisher\">Affinity Publisher</a></div></footer></article></li>\n</ul><h2>What Are the Pros and Cons of Affinity Publisher, and How Do These Compare to InDesign?</h2><p>Affinity Publisher and Adobe InDesign are both <strong>2D publishing programs</strong>, and they're both modelled around a similar interface, with comparable functionality and tools. </p><p>The differences between the programs are minor, and most users with prior experience of InDesign will find a transition to Affinity Publisher to be relatively painless. However, there are a few differences between the programs to be aware of, which might affect your workflow and the sort of items you’d like to design. </p><h3>Affinity Publisher: The Pros</h3><figure class=\"post_image\"><img alt=\"publisher logo\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/114/posts/35564/image/Publisher-logo.jpg\"></figure><p>Affinity Publisher has a huge amount going for it, despite the fact that it’s not currently the market leader in publishing software (watch this space). Some of the main advantages of Affinity Publisher are that:</p><ul>\n<li>\n<strong>It’s excellent value</strong>, making it a great choice for students, aspiring designers, and professionals on a budget.</li>\n<li>\n<strong>It can be trialled for free</strong> for a 30-day period.</li>\n<li>\n<strong>It’s intuitive</strong>—all Affinity programs have been created with simple-to-use interfaces, in-built tips, and helpful tutorials accessible online, making it easy to get to grips with the software quickly.</li>\n<li><strong>It’s compatible with both Windows and Mac.</strong></li>\n<li>\n<strong>It uses technology called StudioLink</strong>, which lets users switch between the Affinity design suite of<strong> Affinity Publisher, Affinity Designer</strong>, and <strong>Affinity Photo,</strong> all within the same app.</li>\n<li>\n<strong>It allows users to create professional-standard documents for print</strong>, such as magazines, posters, and brochures, and has <strong>excellent export capabilities</strong> for creating PDFs and image files of your work. </li>\n</ul><figure class=\"post_image\"><img alt=\"exporting files\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/114/posts/35564/image/export%20options.jpg\"></figure><h3>Affinity Publisher: The Cons</h3><p>While Affinity Publisher has been hugely improved since its beta release, thanks in part to Serif’s choice to involve users heavily in enhancing the program, there are still a few things that could do with further development, including:</p><ul>\n<li>\n<strong>Affinity Publisher can still feel, at times, a little buggy.</strong> Navigating on a Mac can force font sizes to balloon or shrink at random when using the Character panel, for example, while layer navigation can sometimes feel frustrating (see below).</li>\n<li>\n<strong>Setting up a new document requires a little more thought.</strong> While InDesign automatically assigns facing pages, for example, Affinity Publisher requires the user to check and set this to begin on a left-hand page themselves. Not a problem for experienced users, but additional options like this can make the setting up process more fiddly.</li>\n<li>\n<strong>Layers are more difficult to use than InDesign.</strong> Creating layers on a Master page does not mean these layers are created on the main pages of your document, and vice versa, which can make using layers in Affinity Publisher feel a little clunky. </li>\n<li>\n<strong>Affinity Publisher doesn’t provide built-in templates for document types,</strong> unlike InDesign, and given that the software is young, there are fewer Publisher templates available for download online than for InDesign. Luckily for you, we’ve compiled a selection of the best Affinity Publisher templates on the web here:</li>\n</ul><ul class=\"roundup-block__contents posts--half-width roundup-block--card\"><li class=\"roundup-block__content posts__post\"><article><header><a class=\"posts__post-preview\" href=\"https://design.tutsplus.com/articles/45-best-affinity-publisher-templates-including-brochure-templates--cms-34425\"><img class=\"posts__post-preview-image posts__post-preview-image--regular\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/2092/posts/34425/preview_image/thumbnail_2.jpg\"></a><a class=\"roundup-block__content-link posts__post-title\" href=\"https://design.tutsplus.com/articles/45-best-affinity-publisher-templates-including-brochure-templates--cms-34425\"><h1 class=\"nolinks\">45 Best Affinity Publisher Templates (Including Brochure Templates)</h1></a></header><div class=\"posts__post-teaser\">Affinity Publisher templates can be a helpful addition to any print project, saving you both time and money. Let's take a look at some awesome, Affinity...</div>\n<footer class=\"posts__post-details\"><div class=\"posts__post-teaser-overlay\"></div>\n<div class=\"posts__post-publication-meta\">\n<img sizes=\"76px\" class=\"posts__post-author_photo\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/2092/profiles/20609/profileImage/daisyavatar_new9.png\" alt=\"Daisy Ein\"><div class=\"posts__post-details__info\">\n<address class=\"posts__post-author\"><a class=\"posts__post-author-link\" href=\"https://tutsplus.com/authors/daisy-ein\">Daisy Ein</a></address>\n<time class=\"posts__post-publication-date\" datetime=\"2020-07-29 15:26:50 UTC\" title=\"29 Jul 2020\">29 Jul 2020</time>\n</div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"posts__post-primary-category topic-design\"><a class=\"posts__post-primary-category-link topic-design\" href=\"https://design.tutsplus.com/categories/affinity-publisher\">Affinity Publisher</a></div></footer></article></li></ul><h3>Adobe InDesign: The Pros</h3><figure class=\"post_image\"><img alt=\"indesign logo\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/114/posts/35564/image/InDesign-logo.jpg\"></figure><p>InDesign has been around since 1999 and has dominated the publishing software market ever since. Because of its age and the heft of Adobe behind it, InDesign has benefitted from decades of development. As a result, it arguably offers more professionalism and added extras than Affinity Publisher, which makes it an attractive offering for pro designers and studios. </p><ul class=\"roundup-block__contents posts--half-width roundup-block--card\">\n<li class=\"roundup-block__content posts__post\"><article><header><a class=\"posts__post-preview\" href=\"https://design.tutsplus.com/articles/25-creative-free-indesign-templates--cms-33332\"><img class=\"posts__post-preview-image posts__post-preview-image--regular\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/346/posts/33332/preview_image/igtemppre.jpg\"></a><a class=\"roundup-block__content-link posts__post-title\" href=\"https://design.tutsplus.com/articles/25-creative-free-indesign-templates--cms-33332\"><h1 class=\"nolinks\">25 Creative Free InDesign Templates</h1></a></header><div class=\"posts__post-teaser\">Find the right Adobe InDesign template for your project. Check out this list of amazing free InDesign templates. </div>\n<footer class=\"posts__post-details\"><div class=\"posts__post-teaser-overlay\"></div>\n<div class=\"posts__post-publication-meta\">\n<img sizes=\"76px\" class=\"posts__post-author_photo\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/346/profiles/2218/profileImage/tutprotest.jpg\" alt=\"Melody Nieves\"><div class=\"posts__post-details__info\">\n<address class=\"posts__post-author\"><a class=\"posts__post-author-link\" href=\"https://tutsplus.com/authors/melody-nieves\">Melody Nieves</a></address>\n<time class=\"posts__post-publication-date\" datetime=\"2020-04-01 11:35:03 UTC\" title=\"01 Apr 2020\">01 Apr 2020</time>\n</div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"posts__post-primary-category topic-design\"><a class=\"posts__post-primary-category-link topic-design\" href=\"https://design.tutsplus.com/categories/adobe-indesign\">Adobe InDesign</a></div></footer></article></li>\n<li class=\"roundup-block__content posts__post\"><article><header><a class=\"posts__post-preview\" href=\"https://design.tutsplus.com/articles/29-best-indesign-book-templates-layout-cover-templates--cms-32543\"><img class=\"posts__post-preview-image posts__post-preview-image--regular\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/346/posts/32543/preview_image/indesign_booktemplatepre.jpg\"></a><a class=\"roundup-block__content-link posts__post-title\" href=\"https://design.tutsplus.com/articles/29-best-indesign-book-templates-layout-cover-templates--cms-32543\"><h1 class=\"nolinks\">28 Best InDesign Book Templates (Layout &amp; Cover Templates)</h1></a></header><div class=\"posts__post-teaser\">Want to be an author? Find your perfect book cover and layout! Check out this list of InDesign book templates from Envato Market and Envato Elements. </div>\n<footer class=\"posts__post-details\"><div class=\"posts__post-teaser-overlay\"></div>\n<div class=\"posts__post-publication-meta\">\n<img sizes=\"76px\" class=\"posts__post-author_photo\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/346/profiles/2218/profileImage/tutprotest.jpg\" alt=\"Melody Nieves\"><div class=\"posts__post-details__info\">\n<address class=\"posts__post-author\"><a class=\"posts__post-author-link\" href=\"https://tutsplus.com/authors/melody-nieves\">Melody Nieves</a></address>\n<time class=\"posts__post-publication-date\" datetime=\"2020-03-27 15:21:31 UTC\" title=\"27 Mar 2020\">27 Mar 2020</time>\n</div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"posts__post-primary-category topic-design\"><a class=\"posts__post-primary-category-link topic-design\" href=\"https://design.tutsplus.com/categories/indesign-templates\">InDesign Templates</a></div></footer></article></li>\n<li class=\"roundup-block__content posts__post\"><article><header><a class=\"posts__post-preview\" href=\"https://design.tutsplus.com/articles/22-best-indesign-calendar-templates-new-for-2019--cms-32798\"><img class=\"posts__post-preview-image posts__post-preview-image--regular\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/346/posts/32798/preview_image/indesign_calendarpre.jpg\"></a><a class=\"roundup-block__content-link posts__post-title\" href=\"https://design.tutsplus.com/articles/22-best-indesign-calendar-templates-new-for-2019--cms-32798\"><h1 class=\"nolinks\">26 Best InDesign Calendar Templates (New for 2020)</h1></a></header><div class=\"posts__post-teaser\">Create a productive year with these InDesign calendar templates. Check out this selection of premium calendar templates from Envato Market and Envato Elements. </div>\n<footer class=\"posts__post-details\"><div class=\"posts__post-teaser-overlay\"></div>\n<div class=\"posts__post-publication-meta\">\n<img sizes=\"76px\" class=\"posts__post-author_photo\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/346/profiles/2218/profileImage/tutprotest.jpg\" alt=\"Melody Nieves\"><div class=\"posts__post-details__info\">\n<address class=\"posts__post-author\"><a class=\"posts__post-author-link\" href=\"https://tutsplus.com/authors/melody-nieves\">Melody Nieves</a></address>\n<time class=\"posts__post-publication-date\" datetime=\"2020-03-05 15:41:52 UTC\" title=\"05 Mar 2020\">05 Mar 2020</time>\n</div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"posts__post-primary-category topic-design\"><a class=\"posts__post-primary-category-link topic-design\" href=\"https://design.tutsplus.com/categories/indesign-templates\">InDesign Templates</a></div></footer></article></li>\n</ul><p>The main advantages of using Adobe InDesign vs. Affinity Publisher are that:</p><ul>\n<li>\n<strong>InDesign is exceptionally professional,</strong> and allows users to create advanced design work for print and online.</li>\n<li>\n<strong>It has an intuitive, slick interface</strong> that anticipates the designer’s needs and requirements for creating documents and creative work.</li>\n<li>\n<strong>It integrates with other Creative Cloud apps</strong>, including <strong>Adobe Photoshop </strong>and <strong>Adobe Illustrator</strong>, hosting the apps on a cloud platform for ease of use. </li>\n<li><strong>It’s compatible with both Windows and Mac.</strong></li>\n<li>\n<strong>Adobe offers extra apps and features </strong>that can enhance the design experience as part of an Adobe subscription, including <strong>Adobe Fonts, Adobe Color</strong>, and <strong>Adobe Stock</strong>.</li>\n<li>\n<strong>It’s still the industry standard,</strong> with most professional designers, studios, and agencies still opting for Adobe over Affinity, making it a necessity for individuals who want to share files seamlessly with other businesses who use it. However, it is possible to use Affinity Publisher files in InDesign (see below). </li>\n</ul><figure class=\"post_image\"><img alt=\"indesign postcard\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/114/posts/35564/image/indesign%20postcard.jpg\"></figure><h3>Adobe InDesign: The Cons</h3><p>Nobody’s perfect, and even InDesign has its flaws, which might influence your decision on which program to opt for. Some of the potential drawbacks of Adobe InDesign include:</p><ul>\n<li>\n<strong>It’s expensive... really expensive.</strong> With a single app subscription costing an individual $20.99 each month, and the full design suite running at $59.99 per month, that’s adding up to a serious investment. There are deals available for businesses, students, and educational institutions, but the subscription model applies across the board. </li>\n<li>\n<strong>A free trial of InDesign only lasts for seven days</strong>, compared to the 30-day period offered by Serif, giving new users less time to get to know their way around the program.</li>\n<li>\n<strong>Since InDesign’s latest release (CC), users of older versions such as CS5 and CS6 will feel a little left behind.</strong> Aside from the newly introduced subscription model, opening files between different versions requires files to be properly packaged and saved as IDML files, before being resaved on opening in the older or newer version of the application. </li>\n</ul><h2>Can I Use InDesign Files in Affinity Publisher?</h2><p><strong>Yes!</strong></p><p>Until recently, users of Affinity Publisher and InDesign were firmly in two separate camps, but new updates by Serif now mean that it’s possible for Publisher users to convert and use designs created in InDesign, transforming the whole process of file sharing between the two programs.</p><ul class=\"roundup-block__contents posts--half-width roundup-block--card\"><li class=\"roundup-block__content posts__post\"><article><header><a class=\"posts__post-preview\" href=\"https://design.tutsplus.com/tutorials/how-to-import-indesign-templates-to-affinity-publisher--cms-35007\"><img class=\"posts__post-preview-image posts__post-preview-image--regular\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/2092/posts/35007/preview_image/thumbnail.jpg\"></a><a class=\"roundup-block__content-link posts__post-title\" href=\"https://design.tutsplus.com/tutorials/how-to-import-indesign-templates-to-affinity-publisher--cms-35007\"><h1 class=\"nolinks\">How to Import InDesign Templates to Affinity Publisher</h1></a></header><div class=\"posts__post-teaser\">Ready to jump into Affinity Publisher after a long time of Adobe InDesign use? Well, there's no need to hesitate, as Affinity Publisher can import InDesign...</div>\n<footer class=\"posts__post-details\"><div class=\"posts__post-teaser-overlay\"></div>\n<div class=\"posts__post-publication-meta\">\n<img sizes=\"76px\" class=\"posts__post-author_photo\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/2092/profiles/20609/profileImage/daisyavatar_new9.png\" alt=\"Daisy Ein\"><div class=\"posts__post-details__info\">\n<address class=\"posts__post-author\"><a class=\"posts__post-author-link\" href=\"https://tutsplus.com/authors/daisy-ein\">Daisy Ein</a></address>\n<time class=\"posts__post-publication-date\" datetime=\"2020-05-11 12:00:00 UTC\" title=\"11 May 2020\">11 May 2020</time>\n</div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"posts__post-primary-category topic-design\"><a class=\"posts__post-primary-category-link topic-design\" href=\"https://design.tutsplus.com/categories/affinity-publisher\">Affinity Publisher</a></div></footer></article></li></ul><p>As of the Affinity 1.8 update, it’s now possible to import InDesign <strong>IDML</strong> files into Affinity Publisher. The process is quick and easy, and it simply involves saving or packaging your InDesign document as an IDML (as opposed to INDD) file and opening the IDML file in Affinity Publisher.</p><p>Read <a href=\"https://design.tutsplus.com/tutorials/how-to-import-indesign-templates-to-affinity-publisher--cms-35007\" rel=\"external\" target=\"_blank\">this tutorial</a> or watch the video below for full details:</p><figure data-video-embed=\"true\" data-original-url=\"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=hWR9h0jl20g&amp;feature=youtu.be\" class=\"embedded-video\">\n  <iframe src=\"//www.youtube.com/embed/hWR9h0jl20g?rel=0\" webkitallowfullscreen=\"webkitallowfullscreen\" mozallowfullscreen=\"mozallowfullscreen\" allowfullscreen=\"allowfullscreen\" frameborder=\"0\"></iframe>\n</figure><h2>What Are Some of the Main Features of Affinity Publisher?</h2><h3>It’s Adaptable for Print <em>and</em> Web Design</h3><p>The latest release of InDesign CC has certainly improved the web and ePublishing design experience for users, with better capabilities for setting up web-friendly layouts and exporting to interactive formats. However, Affinity Publisher has put the modern web design process at the heart of its interface. </p><p>Discover how to create a cover for a digital magazine in Affinity Publisher:</p><figure data-video-embed=\"true\" data-original-url=\"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Ni9NYLTyW6A\" class=\"embedded-video\">\n  <iframe src=\"//www.youtube.com/embed/Ni9NYLTyW6A?rel=0\" webkitallowfullscreen=\"webkitallowfullscreen\" mozallowfullscreen=\"mozallowfullscreen\" allowfullscreen=\"allowfullscreen\" frameborder=\"0\"></iframe>\n</figure><p>You can choose from a wide range of screen size options, which include all mass-market up-to-date devices. You can also choose to design specifically for <strong>Web</strong> or <strong>Devices</strong>, each of which contains a wide range of pre-saved formats to choose from, including an updated catalogue of iPhone, Apple Watch, iPad, Nexus, and Kindle screen sizes. </p><figure class=\"post_image\"><img alt=\"publisher devices web\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/114/posts/35564/image/web%20design.jpg\"></figure><h3>It’s More Progressive Than InDesign... in Some Ways</h3><p>Because InDesign is built on foundations which preceded web design, stemming from the technology developed by Quark for the first layout publishing program, QuarkXPress, it is still a traditional print publishing program at heart. </p><p>Affinity Publisher, by contrast, though inspired by the InDesign interface, doesn't have the same historical legacy, and there are some features of the program which feel more relevant for how designers work now. </p><figure class=\"post_image\"><img alt=\"affinity publisher\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/114/posts/35564/image/affinity1.jpg\"></figure><p>One example is the ability to set a facing-page document to begin on a left-hand page. Sure, this isn’t what you’d want to choose for a traditional multi-page document like a print book or magazine, but there are occasions where you might want to start your document with a two-page spread, like eMagazines or interactive PDFs, for example.</p><h3>It's Speedier and Lighter Than InDesign</h3><p>One of the main complaints about InDesign is the processing power of the software. It’s a very heavy program, which can have an impact on usability, particularly if you’re working on a laptop rather than a desktop. Switching the <strong>Display Performance</strong> in InDesign to <strong>Fast Display</strong> can solve the problem, but it also means you have to do the bulk of your work while looking at heavily pixelated images. </p><p>Publisher is a heavy program too, but it certainly doesn’t feel that way. It’s whippet-quick, even when I was trying it out on my ancient laptop, which struggles to open InDesign in less than 15 minutes. </p><p>Images in Publisher remain crisp and clear, which helps you to assess the quality of images accurately while you work. </p><figure class=\"post_image\"><img alt=\"image quality affinity\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/114/posts/33481/image/Image.jpg\"></figure><p>An extra bonus—I had no issues with stalling or crashing, which was an almost daily occurrence when I was working with InDesign CS6 and a monthly occurrence with InDesign CC. </p><ul class=\"roundup-block__contents posts--half-width roundup-block--card\"><li class=\"roundup-block__content posts__post\"><article><header><a class=\"posts__post-preview\" href=\"https://webdesign.tutsplus.com/articles/new-course-branding-on-a-budget-with-elements-and-affinity--cms-30225\"><img class=\"posts__post-preview-image posts__post-preview-image--regular\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/48/posts/30225/preview_image/branding.png\"></a><a class=\"roundup-block__content-link posts__post-title\" href=\"https://webdesign.tutsplus.com/articles/new-course-branding-on-a-budget-with-elements-and-affinity--cms-30225\"><h1 class=\"nolinks\">New Course: Branding on a Budget With Elements and Affinity</h1></a></header><div class=\"posts__post-teaser\">Creating a print and web branding package for a new business can be an expensive and time-consuming process. But in our new course, Branding on a Budget With...</div>\n<footer class=\"posts__post-details\"><div class=\"posts__post-teaser-overlay\"></div>\n<div class=\"posts__post-publication-meta\">\n<img sizes=\"76px\" class=\"posts__post-author_photo\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/23/profiles/18578/profileImage/AndrewBlackman-400.jpg\" alt=\"Andrew Blackman\"><div class=\"posts__post-details__info\">\n<address class=\"posts__post-author\"><a class=\"posts__post-author-link\" href=\"https://tutsplus.com/authors/andrew-blackman\">Andrew Blackman</a></address>\n<time class=\"posts__post-publication-date\" datetime=\"2017-12-29 12:07:09 UTC\" title=\"29 Dec 2017\">29 Dec 2017</time>\n</div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"posts__post-primary-category topic-webdesign\"><a class=\"posts__post-primary-category-link topic-webdesign\" href=\"https://webdesign.tutsplus.com/categories/affinity-designer\">Affinity Designer</a></div></footer></article></li></ul><h3>If You’re an InDesign User, It Feels Intuitive</h3><p>Serif has mimicked the InDesign interface in Publisher for good reason, in the hope of converting committed InDesign users. </p><p>If you’re a seasoned InDesign user, the Publisher interface will feel very familiar, with the <strong>Tools</strong> panel docked to the left and the most-used panels, including <strong>Colour</strong>, <strong>Swatches</strong>, and <strong>Stroke</strong>, docked in their usual position to the right. </p><p>The <strong>Pages</strong> panel has been shifted to the left, but personally this feels like an improvement on InDesign's default docking of the same panel to the right of the screen.</p><figure class=\"post_image\"><img alt=\"interface overview\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/114/posts/33481/image/Overview%20interface.jpg\"></figure><h3>It Has a Useful Clipboard Feature, 'Assets'</h3><p>Clipboards are really useful for producing designs that use repeated visual content (such as company logos) or specific sets of icons (such as emojis or UI icons).</p><p>Affinity has a handy clipboard function called <strong>Assets</strong>, which is docked on the left side of the interface, alongside the <strong>Pages</strong> panel. </p><p>It's quick and easy to create your own library of asset categories, allowing you to access essential images in an instant. This is particularly handy for designers working with brand identities.</p><figure class=\"post_image\"><img alt=\"assets panel\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/114/posts/33481/image/Assets.jpg\"></figure><h2>Affinity Publisher: Our Verdict</h2><p>If you’re looking for a good-value alternative to Adobe InDesign, Affinity Publisher is a fantastic option for budget-conscious creatives.</p><p>For marketers needing to create print items in-house or designers looking to pick up new publishing design skills, Affinity Publisher is an intuitive way to hone your design skills and create a wide range of layout media, from magazines to books, brochures, and business cards. For budding web designers, there’s also plenty on offer for creating layouts for websites, apps, and EPUBs.</p><p>If you’re a committed InDesign user, you might find it initially difficult to make the switch to Affinity Publisher, as the latter lacks some of the sophistication and advanced features of the former. Publisher can feel a little clumsy in comparison, but this impression quickly diminishes the more time you spend using the application.</p><figure class=\"post_image\"><img alt=\"newsletter created using affinity\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/114/posts/35564/image/Mockup2.jpg\"></figure><p>All in all, Affinity Publisher is shaping up to be a serious rival for InDesign, competing on both value for money and functionality. With Affinity Publisher for iPad in the late-development stages, the potential for Affinity to transition publishing design into the tablet market is really exciting. Watch this space!</p><p>We'd love to know your thoughts on Affinity Publisher. Are you a Publisher convert or die-hard InDesign fan? Perhaps you think both InDesign and Affinity Publisher have room for improvement? Leave your thoughts and experiences with using both programs in the comments below. </p><p>Discover a range of professionally designed Affinity Publisher templates over at <a href=\"https://elements.envato.com/graphic-templates/affinity+publisher\" rel=\"external\" target=\"_blank\">Envato Elements</a>.</p><p>Check out more reviews of Affinity programs, Affinity Publisher tutorials, and suggestions for alternative design software:</p><ul class=\"roundup-block__contents posts--half-width roundup-block--card\">\n<li class=\"roundup-block__content posts__post\"><article><header><a class=\"posts__post-preview\" href=\"https://webdesign.tutsplus.com/articles/adobe-alternatives-broadening-our-horizons--cms-28912\"><img class=\"posts__post-preview-image posts__post-preview-image--regular\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/30/posts/28912/preview_image/ad.jpg\"></a><a class=\"roundup-block__content-link posts__post-title\" href=\"https://webdesign.tutsplus.com/articles/adobe-alternatives-broadening-our-horizons--cms-28912\"><h1 class=\"nolinks\">Adobe Alternatives: Broadening Our Horizons</h1></a></header><div class=\"posts__post-teaser\">It's always a good idea to know as much as possible about all the tools at your disposal. With a little exploration you might find there are tools out there,...</div>\n<footer class=\"posts__post-details\"><div class=\"posts__post-teaser-overlay\"></div>\n<div class=\"posts__post-publication-meta\">\n<img sizes=\"76px\" class=\"posts__post-author_photo\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/30/profiles/2532/profileImage/kezz.jpg\" alt=\"Kezz Bracey\"><div class=\"posts__post-details__info\">\n<address class=\"posts__post-author\"><a class=\"posts__post-author-link\" href=\"https://tutsplus.com/authors/kezz-bracey\">Kezz Bracey</a></address>\n<time class=\"posts__post-publication-date\" datetime=\"2017-06-20 13:10:55 UTC\" title=\"20 Jun 2017\">20 Jun 2017</time>\n</div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"posts__post-primary-category topic-webdesign\"><a class=\"posts__post-primary-category-link topic-webdesign\" href=\"https://webdesign.tutsplus.com/categories/software\">Software</a></div></footer></article></li>\n<li class=\"roundup-block__content posts__post\"><article><header><a class=\"posts__post-preview\" href=\"https://design.tutsplus.com/articles/45-best-affinity-publisher-templates-including-brochure-templates--cms-34425\"><img class=\"posts__post-preview-image posts__post-preview-image--regular\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/2092/posts/34425/preview_image/thumbnail_2.jpg\"></a><a class=\"roundup-block__content-link posts__post-title\" href=\"https://design.tutsplus.com/articles/45-best-affinity-publisher-templates-including-brochure-templates--cms-34425\"><h1 class=\"nolinks\">45 Best Affinity Publisher Templates (Including Brochure Templates)</h1></a></header><div class=\"posts__post-teaser\">Affinity Publisher templates can be a helpful addition to any print project, saving you both time and money. "https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/30/posts/28912/preview_image/ad.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn33@2020_4/2020/09/05/06-45-40-208_cd712120642f36c7.webp","https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/523/posts/30650/preview_image/article-preview-small.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx18/cdn52@2020_3/2020/09/05/06-45-33-370_82ffe3d03142412f.webp","https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/523/profiles/19105/profileImage/andrei-profile.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn62@2020_1/2020/09/05/06-45-37-643_ac2852cf1592c9b2.webp","http://audio.tutsplus.com.feedsportal.com/c/35227/f/668805/s/31787/sc/4/mf.gif":null,"http://da.feedsportal.com/r/186529796139/u/407/f/668805/c/35227/s/31787/a2.img":null,"http://pi.feedsportal.com/r/186529796139/u/407/f/668805/c/35227/s/31787/a2t.img":null},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1599288318856},{"createdTime":"2020-09-05 14:45:18","updatedTime":"2020-09-05 14:45:18","title":"Create a 60s Psychedelic Style Concert Poster","link":"https://design.tutsplus.com/tutorials/create-a-60s-psychedelic-style-concert-poster--psd-183","description":"<figure class=\"final-product final-product--image\"><img src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/48/posts/8142/final_image/final.jpg\" alt=\"Final product image\"><!--googleoff: index--><figcaption>What You'll Be Creating</figcaption><!--googleon: index--></figure><p>In this tutorial, we will go through the steps to create a <a href=\"https://graphicriver.net/item/retro-event-poster-a3-template/20176383\" rel=\"external\" target=\"_blank\">retro 1960s psychedelic concert poster</a> in Photoshop. This concert poster tutorial relies heavily on the use of the Warp Tool, but includes a few other techniques as well. Let's get started.</p><p>Want more inspiration for 60s posters? Check out our amazing selection of <a href=\"https://elements.envato.com/graphic-templates/psychedelic\" rel=\"external\" target=\"_blank\">60s poster templates</a> and <a href=\"https://elements.envato.com/graphic-templates/print-templates/retro+poster\" rel=\"external\" target=\"_blank\">retro posters</a> available on Envato Elements and GraphicRiver from Envato Market. <br></p><h2>What You'll Learn in This Psychedelic Graphic Design Tutorial</h2><p>While we work on our 60s posters today with this psychedelic poster tutorial, you'll learn:</p><ul>\n<li>How to create guides for your 60s psychedelic art</li>\n<li>How to draw psychedelic letters</li>\n<li>How to add texture to the psychedelic design</li>\n<li>How to add a model to the 1960s poster design</li>\n</ul>\n<h2>\n<span class=\"sectionnum\">1.</span> How to Create the Guides</h2><h3>Step 1<br>\n</h3>\n<p>To start this psychedelic poster tutorial, create a new document with a poster-like size ratio. Visualize how you want the document for your 1960s poster design to be laid out, and draw some rough guides with the <strong>Brush Tool (B)</strong> on a <strong>New Layer </strong>called \"guides\". I drew several different compartments that will each contain a different piece of text and one that will contain an image.</p><figure class=\"post_image\"><img alt=\"Psychedelic Poster Tutorial Create the Guides\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/2660/posts/35666/image/step01.jpg\"></figure>\n<h3>Step 2</h3>\n<p>Make a solid color adjustment layer and fill it with a deep purple. Select the<strong> Rounded Rectangle Tool (U)</strong>. Set the radius so that you get a nice rounded edge that you like. Make sure that you set <strong>Make Work Path As Checked</strong> on the property bar. Now click and drag to make your border. Grab the <strong>Pen Tool (P)</strong>, and while holding <strong>Command</strong>, click and drag to select the path. Then click in the<strong> Subtract Path</strong> button on the property bar. Then make a solid <strong>Color Adjustment Layer </strong>and<strong> Fill</strong> it with an orange color.</p><figure class=\"post_image\"><img alt=\"Psychedelic Poster Tutorial Create the Guides\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/2660/posts/35666/image/step02.jpg\"></figure>\n<h2>\n<span class=\"sectionnum\">2.</span> How to Draw Psychedelic Letters</h2><h3>Step 1<br>\n</h3>\n<p>Now let's set the first bit of text for your psychedelic design. I used a font called <strong>Hobo Std</strong> for mine. Grab the <strong>Text Tool (T)</strong> and click anywhere on the canvas. Then type your text for the psychedelic lettering. Hit <strong>Command-T</strong> and scale the text up so that it fits the first compartment. Hit<strong> Enter </strong>to set the transform. On the <strong>Layers </strong>palette, <strong>right-click </strong>on the text layer and select <strong>Convert to Shape</strong>. This turns the psychedelic lettering into paths.</p><figure class=\"post_image\"><img alt=\"Psychedelic Poster Tutorial Add Psychedelic Lettering\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/2660/posts/35666/image/step03.jpg\"></figure>\n<h3>Step 2<br>\n</h3>\n<p>Go<strong> Edit &gt; Transform &gt; Warp</strong> and warp the text to fit the compartment. I find it's easiest to start with the corner handles and then adjust the others afterwards. The <strong>Warp Tool </strong>can take some getting used to, though it's fairly intuitive. Play around with it until you get a good result. Repeat this step for all the psychedelic lettering sections.</p><figure class=\"post_image\"><img alt=\"Psychedelic Poster Tutorial Add Text\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/2660/posts/35666/image/step04.jpg\"></figure>\n<h3>Step 3<br>\n</h3>\n<p>Now let's go back in and change the color on some of this text. First, I want some of the text to have a stroke. Make the<strong> Fill </strong>color on the 'with special guests' layer white. Then set the layer's<strong> Blending Mode</strong> to <strong>Multiply.</strong> <strong><br></strong></p><p><strong>Double-click </strong>on the layer to the right of the layer's name to open the <strong>Layer Styles </strong>palette. Give the layer a <strong>Stroke</strong> with the settings below. Go ahead and change the colors on the other text to whatever you like. Also, apply a stroke to some of the other text.</p><figure class=\"post_image\"><img alt=\"Concert Poster Tutorial Add Text\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/2660/posts/35666/image/step05.jpg\"></figure>\n<h3>Step 4<br>\n</h3>\n<p>Many of these old posters were screen printed. Let's give ours a little of that effect. Load the selection of the 'Lumedia' layer by <strong>Command-Clicking</strong> on its vector thumbnail. Hit <strong>M </strong>for the <strong>Marquee Tool.</strong> Then hit the arrow keys to move the selection down and to the right. Now hit <strong>Alt-Command-Click </strong>on the same layer thumbnail to subtract from the selection. <br></p><p>Make a new solid color adjustment layer just above the original text and fill it with your secondary color. Set the <strong>Opacity</strong> to<strong> 75%</strong> and give it a nudge so it doesn't line up correctly. That way it will look more handmade.</p><figure class=\"post_image\"><img alt=\"How to Draw Psychedelic Letters Add Text\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/2660/posts/35666/image/step06.jpg\"></figure>\n<h2>\n<span class=\"sectionnum\">3.</span> How to Add Texture</h2>\n<p>The thing that's really going to make this look good and realistic is some texture. I have a <a href=\"https://www.bittbox.com/freebies/free-high-res-grungy-paper-textures/\">paper texture</a> that I got from <a href=\"http://www.bittbox.com/\">BittBox</a> that will do nicely. <strong>Copy</strong> the texture into the document. Then put it at the top in the<strong> Layers</strong> palette. Set the<strong> Blending Mode</strong> to<strong> Linear Light</strong> and set the<strong> Fill</strong> to <strong>25%.</strong></p><figure class=\"post_image\"><img alt=\"Concert Poster Tutorial Add Texture\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/2660/posts/35666/image/step07.jpg\"></figure>\n<h2>\n<span class=\"sectionnum\">4.</span> How to Add the Model</h2><h3>Step 1<br>\n</h3>\n<p>Now let's move on to our image that will fill the rest of the poster. I got an image of a <a href=\"http://www.istockphoto.com/file_closeup/object/5401446_girl_singing_in_retro_mic.php?id=5401446\">female singer</a> from <a href=\"http://istockphoto.com\">iStockphoto</a>. <strong>Duplicate</strong> the <strong>Blue Channel</strong> by dragging it to the <strong>New Channel</strong> button at the bottom of the <strong>Channels</strong> Palette. Apply a harsh curve to it that looks something like below. Do the same to the red channel. Now invert each of the two new channels you made by selecting them and hitting<strong> Command-I</strong>.</p><figure class=\"post_image\"><img alt=\"Concert Poster Tutorial Add the Model\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/2660/posts/35666/image/step08.jpg\"></figure>\n<h3>Step 2<br>\n</h3>\n<p>Make a new <strong>Solid Color Adjustment Layer</strong> and fill it with the lightest color that you used in the poster. Load the selection of one of the channels you made by holding <strong>Command-clicking</strong> on its thumbnail in the<strong> Channels </strong>palette. Make a new <strong>Solid Color Adjustment Layer</strong> above the previous one, and fill it with one of the other colors from the poster. Do the same with the remaining channel that you created, and fill it with the remaining color from the poster.</p>\n<p>Now, on each of the masks on the solid color adjustment layers, apply a threshold. Go to <strong>Image &gt; Adjustments &gt; Threshold</strong> and drag the slider until you get the detail that looks good to you. Do the same for the other mask on the other color.</p><figure class=\"post_image\"><img alt=\"Psychedelic Graphic Design Add the Model\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/2660/posts/35666/image/step9.jpg\"></figure>\n<h3>Step 3<br>\n</h3>\n<p>Now, let's get back to the poster. With the <strong>Pen Tool (P)</strong>, draw a path around the blank area of the poster. Make a new <strong>Group</strong> by clicking on the folder icon at the bottom of the<strong> Layers </strong>palette. With the path highlighted, hit the Add<strong> Layer Mask </strong>button twice to apply the path as a vector mask.</p><figure class=\"post_image\"><img alt=\"Psychedelic Graphic Design Add the Model\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/2660/posts/35666/image/step10.jpg\"></figure>\n<h2>Our Final 60s Psychedelic Art Poster</h2>\n<p>Now drag the three color fill layers from the singer image over to the poster document and put them into the group that you just created. Scale the image to fill the space as you see fit. I flipped mine horizontally to make it fit better.</p>\n<p>This concert poster tutorial is all done! Check out our final 1960s psychedelic-style concert poster below. Have fun with these techniques and this style of psychedelic design. Try playing around with the steps in this tutorial to make different types of 60s posters.</p><figure class=\"post_image\"><img alt=\"1960s Psychedlic Concert Poster Photoshop Tutorial\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/2660/posts/35666/image/final.jpg\"></figure><h2>Create Retro Posters Online With Placeit</h2><p>Need a <a href=\"https://placeit.net/poster-templates?sortby=newest\" rel=\"external\" target=\"_blank\">cool poster design</a> for your retro party? Subscribe to Placeit to access unlimited design options for all your needs. Check out some of our favorite examples of psychedelic graphic design below!<br></p><h3>1. <a href=\"https://placeit.net/c/design-templates/stages/cool-poster-design-maker-featuring-psychedelic-abstract-graphics-2576e\" rel=\"external\" target=\"_blank\">Cool Psychedelic Design with Poster Maker</a>\n</h3><figure class=\"post_image\"><a href=\"https://placeit.net/c/design-templates/stages/cool-poster-design-maker-featuring-psychedelic-abstract-graphics-2576e\" rel=\"external\" target=\"_blank\"><img alt=\"Psychedelic Graphic Design Poster Maker\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/2660/posts/35666/image/cool-poster-design-maker-featuring-psychedelic-abstract-graphics-2576e.jpg\"></a></figure><p>This modern interpretation of 60s psychedelic art is very unique. Edit the font style, text, and color scheme of this 1960s poster design. You can even change the abstract illustrations featured in the center. Create fun looks with this 60s poster template.</p><h3>2. <a href=\"https://placeit.net/c/design-templates/stages/illustrated-music-poster-design-maker-with-a-powerful-style-2757f\" rel=\"external\" target=\"_blank\">Illustrated Music Poster Design Maker With a Powerful Style</a>\n</h3><figure class=\"post_image\"><a href=\"https://placeit.net/c/design-templates/stages/illustrated-music-poster-design-maker-with-a-powerful-style-2757f\" rel=\"external\" target=\"_blank\"><img alt=\"60s Poster Design Maker\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/2660/posts/35666/image/illustrated-music-poster-design-maker-with-a-powerful-style-2757f.jpg\"></a></figure><p>60s posters with a punk look are great at catching the eye. This one features protest imagery, but everything is customizable here. Make a great concert poster with this 60s poster design.</p><h3>3. <a href=\"https://placeit.net/c/design-templates/stages/poster-design-maker-for-a-conference-featuring-wavy-monochromatic-lines-2576h\" rel=\"external\" target=\"_blank\">Poster Design Maker For a Conference Featuring Wavy Monochromatic Lines</a>\n</h3><figure class=\"post_image\"><a href=\"https://placeit.net/c/design-templates/stages/poster-design-maker-for-a-conference-featuring-wavy-monochromatic-lines-2576h\" rel=\"external\" target=\"_blank\"><img alt=\"Poster Design Maker For a Conference\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/2660/posts/35666/image/poster-design-maker-for-a-conference-featuring-wavy-monochromatic-lines-2576h.jpg\"></a></figure><p>This poster design maker from Placeit looks like an alternate universe 1960s poster design. Add a description of your event or offer, edit the dates, and customize the colors. With a few quick clicks, you'll have a great design from this alternate 60s poster template.</p><h3>4. <a href=\"https://placeit.net/c/design-templates/stages/poster-design-generator-for-a-band-s-world-tour-featuring-wavy-abstract-graphics-2576f\" rel=\"external\" target=\"_blank\">Poster Design Generator For a Band's World Tour Featuring Wavy Abstract Graphics</a>\n</h3><figure class=\"post_image\"><a href=\"https://placeit.net/c/design-templates/stages/poster-design-generator-for-a-band-s-world-tour-featuring-wavy-abstract-graphics-2576f\" rel=\"external\" target=\"_blank\"><img alt=\"Poster Design Generator\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/2660/posts/35666/image/poster-design-generator-for-a-band-s-world-tour-featuring-wavy-abstract-graphics-2576f.jpg\"></a></figure><p>While it's not quite 60s psychedelic art, this abstract poster template scratches that itch. Get as monochromatic or flashy as you'd like by changing the color scheme of the poster generator. It's a great look for bands or event posters.</p><h3>5. <a href=\"https://placeit.net/c/design-templates/stages/online-poster-design-maker-with-abstract-graphics-and-textures-2576\" rel=\"external\" target=\"_blank\">Online Poster Design Maker With Abstract Graphics and Textures</a>\n</h3><figure class=\"post_image\"><a href=\"https://placeit.net/c/design-templates/stages/online-poster-design-maker-with-abstract-graphics-and-textures-2576\" rel=\"external\" target=\"_blank\"><img alt=\"Online Abstract Poster Design Maker\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/2660/posts/35666/image/online-poster-design-maker-with-abstract-graphics-and-textures-2576.jpg\"></a></figure><p>We round out our list with this wonderful abstract poster design. The classic aesthetic is complemented by whatever abstract composition you choose to fit your look. It's definitely an eye-catching way to draw attention to your new project or event. </p><h2>Create Even More With Poster Tutorials From Envato Tuts+</h2><p>Creating a psychedelic design is easy with the right concert poster tutorial. If you'd like to sharpen your new design skills, we've got even more <a href=\"https://design.tutsplus.com/categories/poster-design\" rel=\"external\" target=\"_blank\">poster tutorials</a> for you from Envato Tuts+! e/cool-poster-design-maker-featuring-psychedelic-abstract-graphics-2576e.jpg":null,"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/2660/posts/35666/image/illustrated-music-poster-design-maker-with-a-powerful-style-2757f.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn38@2020_4/2020/09/05/06-45-37-773_6f97365b1ca32520.webp","https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/2660/posts/35666/image/poster-design-maker-for-a-conference-featuring-wavy-monochromatic-lines-2576h.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn100@2020_1/2020/09/05/06-45-37-556_89fa07a630390363.webp","https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/2660/posts/35666/image/poster-design-generator-for-a-band-s-world-tour-featuring-wavy-abstract-graphics-2576f.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn49@2020_3/2020/09/05/06-45-39-852_af0939c87d4a9e1a.webp","https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/2660/posts/35666/image/online-poster-design-maker-with-abstract-graphics-and-textures-2576.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn19@2020_5/2020/09/05/06-45-36-930_94bb11d9739c62dd.webp","https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/108/posts/33033/preview_image/create-star-wars-poster-preview.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn50@2020_2/2020/09/05/06-45-38-491_a0c1b6786602b775.webp","https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/2056/posts/31833/preview_image/10-02-EuforiaPoster-thumnbnail.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn15@2020_4/2020/09/05/06-45-41-849_c703550d8c21bb62.webp","https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/108/posts/32183/preview_image/how-to-create-poster-in-placeit-preview2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn99@2020_4/2020/09/05/06-45-41-728_f22773a455bbce80.webp","https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/2056/posts/31354/preview_image/006-2-Punk-Poster-thumbnail2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn83@2020_3/2020/09/05/06-45-35-314_baa9160fc24ddba6.webp","https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/2056/posts/30612/preview_image/Skateboard-Culture-thumbnail-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx33/cdn28@2020_6/2020/09/05/06-45-39-190_01c046b34c014ce4.webp","https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/2056/posts/31635/preview_image/Surreal-Poster-thumbnail3.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn96@2020_6/2020/09/05/06-45-41-713_2d76f591b0fe25e9.webp","https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/2056/posts/31647/preview_image/Snowboarding-Poster-thumbnail.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn73@2020_1/2020/09/05/06-45-37-834_da1955d4ba92c425.webp","https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/2056/posts/30741/preview_image/Woman-Up-Tutorial-thumbnail-1.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx18/cdn34@2020_1/2020/09/05/06-45-32-447_88a0d438d064aa0e.webp","https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/2056/posts/30834/preview_image/Girl-Power-thumbnail.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn67@2020_2/2020/09/05/06-45-35-797_2120b40e34f613ea.webp","https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/2056/posts/31359/preview_image/006-3-Abstract-Rave-Poster-thumbnail.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx18/cdn8@2020_4/2020/09/05/06-45-35-479_3778f998ea3e8002.webp","http://audio.tutsplus.com.feedsportal.com/c/35227/f/668805/s/8142/sc/4/mf.gif":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn95@2020_6/2020/09/05/06-45-44-773_1234291bcbaefffe.jpg","http://da.feedsportal.com/r/186529796139/u/407/f/668805/c/35227/s/8142/a2.img":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn10@2020_2/2020/09/05/06-45-44-350_00203f73ccfbf3b9.jpg","http://pi.feedsportal.com/r/186529796139/u/407/f/668805/c/35227/s/8142/a2t.img":null},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1599288318848},{"createdTime":"2020-09-05 14:45:18","updatedTime":"2020-09-05 14:45:18","title":"How to Create an Art Nouveau Text Effect in Illustrator","link":"https://design.tutsplus.com/tutorials/how-to-create-an-art-nouveau-text-effect-in-illustrator--cms-35374","description":"<figure class=\"final-product final-product--image\"><img src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/158/posts/35374/final_image/ArtNouveauTextEffect0.jpg\" alt=\"Final product image\"><!--googleoff: index--><figcaption>What You'll Be Creating</figcaption><!--googleon: index--></figure><p>In this Art Nouveau Illustrator tutorial, you will learn how to turn an Art Nouveau font into a mesmerizing Art Nouveau text effect. </p>\n\n\n<h2>What You'll Learn in This Art Nouveau Illustrator Tutorial</h2>\n<ul>\n  <li>How to create a new document in Illustrator</li>\n  <li>How to use patterns in Illustrator</li>\n  <li>How to use an Art Nouveau font</li>\n<li>How to use the Appearance panel in Illustrator</li>\n<li>How to use Art Nouveau Illustrator brushes</li>\n</ul>\n\n\n<p>For more inspiration on how to adjust or improve your <a href=\"https://graphicriver.net/graphics-with-art+nouveau-in-fonts#content\" target=\"_self\">Art Nouveau font styles</a>, you can find plenty of resources at <a href=\"https://graphicriver.net/\" target=\"_self\">GraphicRiver</a>.</p><p>Follow along with us over on our <a href=\"https://www.youtube.com/user/TutsPremium\" target=\"_self\">Envato Tuts+ YouTube channel</a>:</p><figure data-video-embed=\"true\" data-original-url=\"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=IaBs08xHvpE\" class=\"embedded-video\">\n  <iframe src=\"//www.youtube.com/embed/IaBs08xHvpE?rel=0\" webkitallowfullscreen=\"webkitallowfullscreen\" mozallowfullscreen=\"mozallowfullscreen\" allowfullscreen=\"allowfullscreen\" frameborder=\"0\"></iframe>\n</figure>\n\n\n\n<h2>What You Will Need </h2>\n<p>You'll need the following resource in order to complete this Art Nouveau Illustrator tutorial:</p>\n<ul>\n<li>\n<a href=\"https://elements.envato.com/carllosta-layered-font-extras-KJ5RZ8\">Carllosta</a> font</li>\n\n</ul>\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n<h2>\n<span class=\"sectionnum\">1.</span> How to Create a New Document </h2>\n\n<p>Hit <strong>Control-N</strong> to create a new document. Select <strong>Pixels</strong> from the <strong>Units</strong> drop-down menu, and enter <strong>850</strong> in the <strong>Width</strong> box and <strong>60</strong> in the <strong>Height</strong> box. Select <strong>RGB</strong> for the <strong>Color Mode</strong>, set the<strong> Raster Effects</strong> to <strong>Screen (72 ppi)</strong>, and then click the <strong>Create </strong>button to create your new document.</p>\n<figure class=\"post_image\"><img alt=\"Art Nouveau text new document\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/158/posts/35374/image/ArtNouveauTextEffect1.jpg\"></figure>\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n<h2>\n<span class=\"sectionnum\">2.</span> How to Create the Background</h2>\n\n<h3>Step 1</h3>\n\n<p>Pick the <strong>Rectangle Tool (M)</strong> and focus on your toolbar. Remove the color from the stroke, and then select the fill and set its color to <strong>R=255 G=233 B=183</strong>. </p>\n<p>Move to your artboard and simply click on it to open the <strong>Rectangle</strong> window, where you can set the size of the shape that you're about to create. Set the <strong>Width</strong> to <strong>870 px </strong>and the <strong>Height</strong> to <strong>620 px</strong>, and then click <strong>OK</strong> to create your rectangle. Press the <strong>Escape</strong> key to easily switch to the <strong>Move Tool</strong> and move your rectangle so it covers the entire artboard, as shown in the following image. </p>\n<figure class=\"post_image\"><img alt=\"rectangle tool\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/158/posts/35374/image/ArtNouveauTextEffect2.jpg\"></figure>\n\n<h3>Step 2</h3>\n\n<p>Open the fly-out menu from the <strong>Swatches</strong> panel (<strong>Window &gt; Swatches</strong>) and go to <strong>Open Swatch Library &gt; Patterns &gt; Nature &gt; Nature_Foliage</strong> to open the small set of built-in patterns. </p>\n<p>Make sure that your rectangle is still selected, focus on the <strong>Appearance</strong> panel (<strong>Window &gt; Appearance</strong>), and add a second fill using the <strong>Add New Fill</strong> button. Select the new fill, apply the <em>Floral Vines</em> pattern, and then change the blending mode to <strong>Soft Light</strong>.</p> \n<figure class=\"post_image\"><img alt=\"second fill pattern\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/158/posts/35374/image/ArtNouveauTextEffect3.jpg\"></figure>\n\n\n\n\n\n\n<h2>\n<span class=\"sectionnum\">3.</span> How to Create the Text Effect</h2>\n\n<h3>Step 1</h3>\n\n<p>Now let's add the Art Nouveau text using this <a href=\"https://elements.envato.com/carllosta-layered-font-extras-KJ5RZ8\">Art Nouveau font</a>. Once you've installed the font, pick the <strong>Type Tool (T) </strong>and focus on the <strong>Character</strong> panel (<strong>Window &gt; Type &gt; Character</strong>). Select the Carllosta font, and then set the font size to <strong>200</strong> px and the <strong>Leading</strong> to <strong>130 px</strong>. </p>\n<p>Click on the artboard and type in your text. You have plenty of <a href=\"https://elements.envato.com/fonts/art+nouveau\" target=\"_self\">Art Nouveau font styles</a> to choose from if you wish to use a different font. </p> \n<figure class=\"post_image\"><img alt=\"Art Nouveau font\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/158/posts/35374/image/ArtNouveauTextEffect4.jpg\"></figure>\n\n<h3>Step 2</h3>\n\n<p>Make sure that your Art Nouveau text stays selected, open the <strong>Swatches</strong> panel (<strong>Window &gt; Swatches</strong>), and click that <strong>[None] </strong>swatch to remove the existing text color. This should make your text invisible, but don't worry—we'll fix it immediately.</p>\n<p>Open the <strong>Appearance</strong> panel (<strong>Window &gt; Appearance</strong>) and add a new fill using that same <strong>Add New Fill</strong> button from the bottom of the panel. Select the new fill and set its color to <strong>R=243 G=153 B=39</strong>.</p>\n<figure class=\"post_image\"><img alt=\"Art Nouveau text\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/158/posts/35374/image/ArtNouveauTextEffect5.jpg\"></figure>\n\n<h3>Step 3</h3>\n\n<p>Make sure that your Art Nouveau text remains selected, and keep focusing on the <strong>Appearance</strong> panel. </p>\n<p>Add a second fill and move it below the existing one. Select it and change the color to <strong>R=105 G=37 B=16</strong>, and then go to <strong>Effect &gt; Path &gt; Offset Path</strong>. Set the <strong>Offset</strong> to <strong>4 px</strong>, select <strong>Round</strong> from the <strong>Joins</strong> drop-down menu, and then click <strong>OK</strong>. </p> \n<figure class=\"post_image\"><img alt=\"Art Nouveau text second fill\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/158/posts/35374/image/ArtNouveauTextEffect6.jpg\"></figure>\n\n<h3>Step 4</h3>\n\n<p>Make sure that your Art Nouveau text is still selected, and keep focusing on the <strong>Appearance</strong> panel. </p>\n<p>Add a third fill and move it below the existing fills. Select this new fill and change its color to <strong>R=206 G=97 B=28</strong>, and then go to <strong>Effect &gt; Path &gt; Offset Path</strong>. Set the <strong>Offset</strong> to <strong>9 px</strong>, select <strong>Round</strong> from the <strong>Joins</strong> drop-down menu, and then click <strong>OK</strong>. </p>\n<figure class=\"post_image\"><img alt=\"Art Nouveau text offset\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/158/posts/35374/image/ArtNouveauTextEffect7.jpg\"></figure>\n\n<h3>Step 5</h3>\n\n<p>Make sure that your Art Nouveau text is still selected, and keep focusing on the <strong>Appearance</strong> panel. </p>\n<p>Add a fourth fill and move it below the existing fills. Select this new fill and change its color to <strong>R=105 G=37 B=16</strong>, and then go to <strong>Effect &gt; Path &gt; Offset Path</strong>. Set the <strong>Offset</strong> to <strong>13 px</strong> and  select <strong>Round</strong> from the <strong>Joins</strong> drop-down menu, and then click <strong>OK</strong>. </p>\n<p>Reselect the fill added in this step, and go to <strong>Effect &gt; Stylize &gt; Drop Shadow</strong>. Enter the attributes shown in the following image, and then click <strong>OK</strong>.</p>\n<figure class=\"post_image\"><img alt=\"Art Nouveau text shadow\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/158/posts/35374/image/ArtNouveauTextEffect8.jpg\"></figure>\n\n<h3>Step 6</h3>\n\n<p>Make sure that your Art Nouveau text is still selected, and keep focusing on the <strong>Appearance</strong> panel. </p>\n<p>Add a fifth fill and move it below the existing fills. Select this new fill and change its color to <strong>R=163 G=71 B=22</strong>, and then go to <strong>Effect &gt; Path &gt; Offset Path</strong>. Set the <strong>Offset</strong> to <strong>8 px</strong> and select <strong>Round</strong> from the <strong>Joins</strong> drop-down menu, and then click <strong>OK</strong>. </p>\n<p>Reselect the fill added in this step, lower its <strong>Opacity</strong> to <strong>10%</strong>, and then go to <strong>Effect &gt; Distort &amp; Transform &gt; Transform</strong>. Drag both <strong>Move</strong> sliders to <strong>15 px</strong> and click <strong>OK</strong>. This effect will move your fill <strong>15 px</strong> up and <strong>15 px</strong> to the right. </p>\n<figure class=\"post_image\"><img alt=\"Art Nouveau text transform\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/158/posts/35374/image/ArtNouveauTextEffect9.jpg\"></figure>\n\n<h3>Step 7</h3>\n\n<p>Make sure that your Art Nouveau text is still selected and keep focusing on the <strong>Appearance</strong> panel. </p>\n<p>Add a sixth fill and move it below the existing fills. Select this new fill, make sure that the color is set to <strong>R=163 G=71 B=22</strong>, and then go to <strong>Effect &gt; Path &gt; Offset Path</strong>. Set the <strong>Offset</strong> to <strong>6 px</strong> and select <strong>Round</strong> from the <strong>Joins</strong> drop-down menu, and then click <strong>OK</strong>. </p>\n<p>Reselect the fill added in this step, and go to <strong>Effect &gt; Distort &amp; Transform &gt; Transform</strong>. Make sure that both <strong>Move</strong> sliders are set to <strong>15 px</strong>, click <strong>OK</strong>, and go to <strong>Effect &gt; Blur &gt; Gaussian Blur</strong>. Set the <strong>Radius</strong> to <strong>25 px</strong> and click <strong>OK</strong>. </p>\n<figure class=\"post_image\"><img alt=\"Art Nouveau text blur\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/158/posts/35374/image/ArtNouveauTextEffect10.jpg\"></figure>\n\n<h3>Step 8</h3>\n\n<p>Make sure that your Art Nouveau text is still selected, and keep focusing on the <strong>Appearance</strong> panel. </p>\n<p>Select the top fill and add a new one on top of it. Change the color of this new fill to <strong>R=206 G=97 B=28</strong>, and then go to <strong>Effect &gt; Path &gt; Offset Path</strong>. Set the <strong>Offset</strong> to <strong>-6 px</strong> and select <strong>Round</strong> from the <strong>Joins</strong> drop-down menu, and then click <strong>OK</strong>. </p>\n<figure class=\"post_image\"><img alt=\"Art Nouveau text offset\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/158/posts/35374/image/ArtNouveauTextEffect11.jpg\"></figure>\n\n<h3>Step 9</h3>\n\n<p>Make sure that your Art Nouveau text is still selected, and keep focusing on the <strong>Appearance</strong> panel. </p>\n<p>Click that <strong>Stroke</strong> button to open the <strong>Stroke</strong> fly-out panel, set the <strong>Weight</strong> to <strong>2 px</strong>, and select <strong>Width Profile 2</strong> from that <strong>Profile</strong> drop-down menu. Change the color of this stroke to <strong>R=105 G=37 B=16</strong>, and then go to <strong>Effect &gt; Path &gt; Offset Path</strong>. Set the <strong>Offset</strong> to <strong>-6 px</strong> and select <strong>Round</strong> from the <strong>Joins</strong> drop-down menu, and then click <strong>OK</strong>. </p>\n<p>Make sure that the stroke is still selected, and go to <strong>Effect &gt; Pathfinder &gt; Add</strong>. </p>\n<figure class=\"post_image\"><img alt=\"Art Nouveau text stroke\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/158/posts/35374/image/ArtNouveauTextEffect12.jpg\"></figure>\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n<h2>\n<span class=\"sectionnum\">4.</span> How to Add Art Nouveau Illustrator Brushes</h2>\n\n<h3>Step 1</h3>\n\n<p>Now, let's add some Art Nouveau Illustrator brushes. Open the fly-out menu from the <strong>Brushes</strong> panel (<strong>Window &gt; Brushes</strong>) and go to <strong>Open Brush Library &gt; Decorative &gt; Elegant Curl &amp; Floral Brush Set</strong> to open a small set of built-in brushes. </p>\n<p>Select <em>Floral Brush 12</em> from this list, and simply drag it onto your artboard. Change its color to <strong>R=105 G=37 B=16</strong>. Make two extra copies (<strong>Control-C &gt; Control-V</strong>) and then place these shapes around your text, as shown in the first image. </p>\n<p>Select <em>Waves 2</em> from the same list and add it to your design. Fill it with the same color and place it as shown in the second image. </p> \n<figure class=\"post_image\"><img alt=\"Art Nouveau illustrator brushes\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/158/posts/35374/image/ArtNouveauTextEffect13.jpg\"></figure>\n\n<h3>Step 2</h3>\n\n<p>Select the rectangle that makes up your background, add a copy in front (<strong>Control-C &gt; Control-F</strong>), and bring it to the front (<strong>Shift-Control-]</strong>). </p>\n<p>Make sure that this new shape stays selected, and press the <strong>D</strong> key to replace the current <strong>Appearance</strong> attributes with the default ones (white fill and black stroke). Remove the stroke color and select the fill from the <strong>Appearance</strong> panel. Change its blending mode to <strong>Overlay</strong> and then apply the radial gradient shown below. Use the <strong>Gradient Tool (G)</strong> to stretch and squeeze your gradient as shown in the second image. Remember that the left gradient slider should have the <strong>Opacity</strong> set to <strong>0%</strong>. </p> \n<figure class=\"post_image\"><img alt=\"Art Nouveau text gradient\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/158/posts/35374/image/ArtNouveauTextEffect14.jpg\"></figure>\n\n<h3>Step 3</h3>\n\n<p>Make sure that your gradient filled shape is still selected, and keep focusing on the <strong>Appearance</strong> panel. </p>\n<p>Add a second fill, select it and change the color to <strong>R=92 G=43 B=2</strong>. Lower its <strong>Opacity</strong> to <strong>10% </strong>and change the blending mode to <strong>Overlay</strong>, and then go to <strong>Effect &gt; Artistic &gt; Film Grain</strong>. Enter the attributes shown below and click <strong>OK</strong>.</p> \n<figure class=\"post_image\"><img alt=\"Art Nouveau text texture\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/158/posts/35374/image/ArtNouveauTextEffect15.jpg\"></figure>\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n<h2>Congratulations! Your Art Nouveau Text Effect Is Complete!</h2>\n\n<p> Here is how it should look. I hope you've enjoyed this Art Nouveau Illustrator tutorial and can apply these techniques in your future projects. Don't hesitate to share your final result in the comments section. </p>\n\n<p>Feel free to adjust the final design and to try different <a href=\"https://elements.envato.com/fonts/art+nouveau\" target=\"_self\">Art Nouveau font styles</a>. You can find some great sources of inspiration at <a href=\"https://graphicriver.net/category/add-ons/illustrator/styles\">GraphicRiver</a>, with interesting solutions to improve your Art Nouveau text effect.</p>\n\n<figure class=\"post_image\"><img alt=\"Art Nouveau illustrator tutorial\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/158/posts/35374/image/ArtNouveauTextEffect0.jpg\"></figure>\n\n\n\n\n\n<h2>Popular Art Nouveau Assets From Envato Elements</h2>\n\n<p><a href=\"https://elements.envato.com\" target=\"_self\">Envato Elements</a> is an excellent resource for Art Nouveau graphics and fonts. Here's a short list with some of the most popular Art Nouveau assets that you can find. </p>\n\n\n\n<h3>\n<a href=\"https://elements.envato.com/art-nouveau-poster-templates-U7NEFPM\">Art Nouveau Poster Templates </a>(AI, JPG, PNG, PSD)</h3>\n\n<p>Download eight fully customizable poster templates inspired by the Art Nouveau style. You get plenty of designs to choose from and complement your Art Nouveau text effect. </p>\n\n<figure class=\"post_image\"><a href=\"https://elements.envato.com/art-nouveau-poster-templates-U7NEFPM\"><img alt=\"Art Nouveau Poster Templates\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/158/posts/35374/image/ArtNouveauTextEffect16.jpg\"></a></figure>\n\n\n\n<h3>\n<a href=\"https://elements.envato.com/20-art-nouveau-ornament-FMLFK2\">20 Art Nouveau Ornaments </a>(AI, EPS, JPG, PNG)</h3>\n\n<p>Choose from 20 Art Nouveau ornaments to frame your Art Nouveau text. All ornaments are 100% vector, so you can resize any of these objects  to any size without losing quality.</p>\n\n<figure class=\"post_image\"><a href=\"https://elements.envato.com/20-art-nouveau-ornament-FMLFK2\"><img alt=\"20 Art Nouveau Ornament\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/158/posts/35374/image/ArtNouveauTextEffect17.jpg\"></a></figure>\n\n\n\n<h3><a href=\"https://elements.envato.com/de-arloy-typeface-new-art-nouveau-style-XBUTR8\">New Art Nouveau Font Style</a></h3>\n\n<p>This Art Nouveau font style combines classic typography with awesome features, bringing a classic touch to your design. A perfect alternative for your Art Nouveau text effect. </p>\n\n<figure class=\"post_image\"><a href=\"https://elements.envato.com/de-arloy-typeface-new-art-nouveau-style-XBUTR8\"><img alt=\"Art Nouveau Font Styles\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/158/posts/35374/image/ArtNouveauTextEffect18.jpg\"></a></figure>\n\n\n\n<h3>\n<a href=\"https://elements.envato.com/40-vector-vintage-style-corners-set-995NKBH\">40 Art Nouveau Vintage Style Corners Set </a>(AI, EPS, PNG, JPG)</h3>\n\n<p> Here's a massive collection of 40 Art Nouveau vintage style corners to accompany your text effect. These are great for making your own frames and borders, decorate your pages, invitations, certificates etc. All shapes and details are smooth and clean.</p>\n\n<figure class=\"post_image\"><a href=\"https://elements.envato.com/40-vector-vintage-style-corners-set-995NKBH\"><img alt=\"40 Art Nouveau Vintage Style Corners Set\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/158/posts/35374/image/ArtNouveauTextEffect19.jpg\"></a></figure>\n\n\n\n<h3>\n<a href=\"https://elements.envato.com/10-frames-vol-1-vintage-ornament-S7CAR8\">10 Frames - Art Nouveau Vintage Ornaments </a>(AI, PSD)</h3>\n\n<p>Check out this small collection of ten layered and editable Art Nouveau vintage ornaments. These intricate designs will take your design to the next level in a matter of seconds. </p>\n\n<figure class=\"post_image\"><a href=\"https://elements.envato.com/10-frames-vol-1-vintage-ornament-S7CAR8\"><img alt=\"Art Nouveau Vintage Ornament\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/158/posts/35374/image/ArtNouveauTextEffect20.jpg\"></a></figure>\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n<h2>Want to Learn More?</h2>\n<p>We have loads of tutorials on Envato Tuts+, from beginner to intermediate level.
