14:45:18","updatedTime":"2020-09-05 14:45:18","title":"30 Beautiful Modern Script Fonts (Typefaces for 2020) ","link":"https://design.tutsplus.com/articles/20-beautiful-modern-script-fonts-typefaces-for-2018--cms-31447","description":"<p>Your designs aren't complete without the perfect font! Find amazing script styles in this  collection for 2020.</p><h2>30 Beautiful Modern Script Fonts <br>\n</h2><p>There's nothing more satisfying than pairing the right script font with a design. It's a simple yet effective trick to take your work to the next level.</p><p>And script typefaces are a perfect mix of elegance and style. So are you feeling a bouncy baseline with flirty characters? Or a fun experimentation in grunge and textured letters?<br></p><p>Designers are always on the hunt for the best script fonts inspired by the latest trends. So today, we bring you 30 incredible modern script styles with enough flair and uniqueness to choose from.</p><p>Check out this collection of the best modern script fonts curated by <a href=\"https://graphicriver.net/fonts/script\" target=\"_self\">Envato Market</a> and <a href=\"https://elements.envato.com/fonts/script-and-handwritten/cool\" target=\"_self\">Envato Elements</a>.</p><h3><a href=\"https://elements.envato.com/sophia-script-MTEMAB\" rel=\"external\" target=\"_blank\">Sophia Script Font</a></h3><p>Pretty and sophisticated, this lovely, handmade font could be a great fit for a variety of projects! From packaging to posters, from tea to T-shirts, this script even has 115 alternate characters to work with!</p><figure class=\"post_image\"><a href=\"https://elements.envato.com/sophia-script-MTEMAB\" rel=\"external\" target=\"_blank\"><img alt=\"Sophia Script Font\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/2092/posts/31447/image/fontart_2020_1.jpg\"></a></figure><h3><a href=\"https://elements.envato.com/qunanty-paztapeface-script-font-9HZKVRX\" rel=\"external\" target=\"_blank\">Qunanty | Paztapeface Script Font</a></h3><p>Check out this fun and quirky script font! It has such unique shapes to it and such a playful aesthetic. Aside from the pasta association, its plump twists and curves make for a merry aesthetic, perfect for your next sunny project. </p><figure class=\"post_image\"><a href=\"https://elements.envato.com/qunanty-paztapeface-script-font-9HZKVRX\" rel=\"external\" target=\"_blank\"><img alt=\"Quananty Script Font\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/2092/posts/31447/image/fontart_2020_2b.jpg\"></a></figure><h3><a href=\"https://elements.envato.com/beloved-teacher-V5ZKST7\" rel=\"external\" target=\"_blank\">Beloved Teacher Script Font</a></h3><p>Looking for a cheerful, welcoming script font for your next project? Well, look no further—Beloved Teacher is a sweet and versatile font! This font would be great for projects that would benefit from the welcoming vibe of a hand-drawn look and feel.</p><figure class=\"post_image\"><a href=\"https://elements.envato.com/beloved-teacher-V5ZKST7\" rel=\"external\" target=\"_blank\"><img alt=\"Beloved Teacher Script Font\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/2092/posts/31447/image/fontart_2020_3.jpg\"></a></figure><h3><a href=\"https://elements.envato.com/honeycomb-font-NDDVRB\" rel=\"external\" target=\"_blank\">Honeycomb Font</a></h3><p>Isn't this a beautiful font? Honeycomb has international language support and also includes 24 gold foil patterns—awesome! This font has so much potential for classy and organic projects. It would make a great addition to anyone's font collection. </p><figure class=\"post_image\"><a href=\"https://elements.envato.com/honeycomb-font-NDDVRB\" rel=\"external\" target=\"_blank\"><img alt=\"Honeycomb Font\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/2092/posts/31447/image/fontart_2020_4.jpg\"></a></figure><h3><a href=\"https://elements.envato.com/britney-modern-script-font-BLKP889\" rel=\"external\" target=\"_blank\">Britney Modern Script Font</a></h3><p>With multi-language support, Britney Modern is a fun and energetic font. It's got alternate characters and ligatures, all ready to go. Use it in your branding, packaging, print work, and much more! </p><figure class=\"post_image\"><a href=\"https://elements.envato.com/britney-modern-script-font-BLKP889\" rel=\"external\" target=\"_blank\"><img alt=\"Britney Modern Script Font\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/2092/posts/31447/image/fontart_2020_5.jpg\"></a></figure><h3>\n<a href=\"https://elements.envato.com/madelis-script-CJ4F3FU\" rel=\"external\" target=\"_blank\">Madelis Script</a><br>\n</h3><p>What a sophisticated font! With beautiful swoops and loops, Madelis would be right at home on packaging, branding, invitations, or even as a headline on your next publication! This one has so many possibilities.</p><figure class=\"post_image\"><a href=\"https://elements.envato.com/madelis-script-CJ4F3FU\" rel=\"external\" target=\"_blank\"><img alt=\"Madelis Script Font\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/2092/posts/31447/image/fontart_2020_6.jpg\"></a></figure><h3>\n<a href=\"https://elements.envato.com/rossmore-script-font-E8WZV8W\" rel=\"external\" target=\"_blank\">Rossmore Script Font</a><br>\n</h3><p>Check out this beautiful font! It has such an elegant, hand-drawn feel, perfect for projects that would benefit from that kind of organic, personal touch. Definitely best suited to display and points of emphasis, this could be a great addition to your font library. </p><figure class=\"post_image\"><a href=\"https://elements.envato.com/rossmore-script-font-E8WZV8W\" rel=\"external\" target=\"_blank\"><img alt=\"Rossmore Script Font\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/2092/posts/31447/image/fontart_2020_7.jpg\"></a></figure><h3><a href=\"https://elements.envato.com/rising-star-DNR47M\" rel=\"external\" target=\"_blank\">Rising Star Font</a></h3><p>This is such a fun typeface with so many possibilities. It's got a little bit of retro flair, but is versatile enough to work in many situations. Try it out on your next packaging project, or use it to create emphasis in your next layout design!</p><figure class=\"post_image\"><a href=\"https://elements.envato.com/rising-star-DNR47M\" rel=\"external\" target=\"_blank\"><img alt=\"Rising Star Font\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/2092/posts/31447/image/fontart_2020_8.jpg\"></a></figure><h3>\n<a href=\"https://elements.envato.com/petter-and-sons-romantic-beauty-script-GD4WE8D\" rel=\"external\" target=\"_blank\">Petter And Sons - Romantic Beauty Script</a><br>\n</h3><p>This font is so romantic; from its beautiful strokes to its elegant lines, Petter and Sons would look amazing on your invitations, in branding, on a T-shirt, or even on a very special love letter! </p><figure class=\"post_image\"><a href=\"https://elements.envato.com/petter-and-sons-romantic-beauty-script-GD4WE8D\" rel=\"external\" target=\"_blank\"><img alt=\"Romantic Beauty Script Font\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/2092/posts/31447/image/fontart_2020_9.jpg\"></a></figure><h3><a href=\"https://elements.envato.com/amora-script-D8MKQY\" rel=\"external\" target=\"_blank\">Amora Script</a></h3><p>This lovely script has 12 different styles to experiment with, so there's plenty to see and try! Check out the pretty swirls and elegant strokes. It's so easy to see this one on packaging, posters, T-shirts, and more!</p><figure class=\"post_image\"><a href=\"https://elements.envato.com/amora-script-D8MKQY\" rel=\"external\" target=\"_blank\"><img alt=\"Amora Font Collection\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/2092/posts/31447/image/fontart_2020_10.jpg\"></a></figure><h3><a href=\"https://graphicriver.net/item/thirthy/21683650\" target=\"_self\">Thirthy Font</a></h3><p>Be bold with a chunky script font! This font works great on T-shirts and more. Update any poster with handwritten letters for that authentic look! Whether you love modern or vintage design, this versatile font is suitable for various occasions. Get a full set of letters, numbers, and punctuation in this download.</p><figure class=\"post_image\"><a href=\"https://graphicriver.net/item/thirthy/21683650\" rel=\"external\" target=\"_blank\"><img alt=\"Thirthy Font\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/2092/posts/31447/image/fontart10_c.jpg\"></a></figure><h3><a href=\"https://elements.envato.com/sottafles-typeface-FSKTCP\" target=\"_self\">Sottafles Typeface</a></h3><p>The opportunities are limitless with the Sottafles typeface. A handwritten font with angled script characters, this typeface is quirky and unique. Enjoy a full set of standard letters and numbers, as well as multilingual support. Great for logos and headlines!</p><figure class=\"post_image\"><a href=\"https://elements.envato.com/sottafles-typeface-FSKTCP\" rel=\"external\" target=\"_blank\"><img alt=\"Sottafles Typeface\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/2092/posts/31447/image/fontart17_c.jpg\"></a></figure><h3><a href=\"https://graphicriver.net/item/wild-ones/21332984\" target=\"_self\">Wild Ones Script</a></h3><p>Take an incredible journey to new heights with this script font. A handwritten typeface with modern, cursive letters, this font is cool and multipurpose. Customize your invites, packages, and logos with this modern calligraphy style that is easy to use. </p><figure class=\"post_image\"><a href=\"https://graphicriver.net/item/wild-ones/21332984\" rel=\"external\" target=\"_blank\"><img alt=\"Wild Ones Script\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/2092/posts/31447/image/fontart11_c.jpg\"></a></figure><h3><a href=\"https://graphicriver.net/item/zattoya-signature-typeface/22001414\" target=\"_self\">Zattoya Signature Typeface</a></h3><p>What if your signature became a popular typeface? The Zattoya font does just the trick for improving any contemporary design. It features tall capital letters balanced out by a mixture of short and long lowercase characters. Use it for your website or logo!</p><figure class=\"post_image\"><a href=\"https://graphicriver.net/item/zattoya-signature-typeface/22001414\" rel=\"external\" target=\"_blank\"><img alt=\"Zattoya Signature Typeface\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/2092/posts/31447/image/fontart8_c.jpg\"></a></figure><h3><a href=\"https://graphicriver.net/item/geraldyne-script/22125229\" target=\"_self\">Geraldyne Script\n          </a></h3><p>Made by combining various alternatives together, the Geraldyne script features fluid, curvy letters that are each so unique. Try it out with fashion, design, or wedding themes to complete your latest projects. It also includes multilingual support and alternate glyphs for more variations.</p><figure class=\"post_image\"><a href=\"https://graphicriver.net/item/geraldyne-script/22125229\" rel=\"external\" target=\"_blank\"><img alt=\"Geraldyne Script \" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/2092/posts/31447/image/fontart4_c.jpg\"></a></figure><h3><a href=\"https://graphicriver.net/item/john-davidson-script/22078186\" target=\"_self\">John Davidson Script</a></h3><p>Sign your letters and documents with an impressive script font. The John Davidson script is classy and effortless. Enjoy the wide loops and subtle dips created to look like real handwriting. Test it out for your email signatures, postcards, or personal stationery. </p><figure class=\"post_image\"><a href=\"https://graphicriver.net/item/john-davidson-script/22078186\" rel=\"external\" target=\"_blank\"><img alt=\"John Davidson Script \" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/2092/posts/31447/image/fontart7_c.jpg\"></a></figure><h3><a href=\"https://elements.envato.com/kania-script-typeface-ZXEDYH\" target=\"_self\">Kania Script Typeface</a></h3><p>Most scripts are dainty and thin, but Kania stands out from the rest. Create bold headlines and titles with the Kania script typeface. Featuring script letters in a wide cursive script, this font packs a punch with its wide letters. Try it out on websites and stationery!</p><figure class=\"post_image\"><a href=\"https://elements.envato.com/kania-script-typeface-ZXEDYH\" rel=\"external\" target=\"_blank\"><img alt=\"Kania Script Typeface\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/2092/posts/31447/image/fontart13_c.jpg\"></a></figure><h3><a href=\"https://graphicriver.net/item/daisies-of-our-lives/21952137\" target=\"_self\">Daisies of Our Lives\n          </a></h3><p>Write out the story of your life with a dramatic typeface. Add it to your collection!</p><figure class=\"post_image\"><a href=\"https://graphicriver.net/item/daisies-of-our-lives/21952137\" rel=\"external\" target=\"_blank\"><img alt=\"Daisies of Our Lives\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/2092/posts/31447/image/fontart9_c.jpg\"></a></figure><h3><a href=\"https://elements.envato.com/zenith-script-GL4NPZ\" target=\"_self\">Zenith Script</a></h3><p>The Zenith script is a handmade typeface which combines regular and alternate characters for a unique result. Create the ideal logo with bold, brush letters that appear as crisp as the real thing. Enjoy access to a full set of letters, numbers, and punctuation. </p><figure class=\"post_image\"><a href=\"https://elements.envato.com/zenith-script-GL4NPZ\" rel=\"external\" target=\"_blank\"><img alt=\"Zenith Script\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/2092/posts/31447/image/fontart15_c.jpg\"></a></figure><h3><a href=\"https://graphicriver.net/item/naycila-script-font/22212199\" target=\"_self\">Naycila Script Font</a></h3><p>Created\n with a bouncy baseline and a natural, handwritten feel, the Naycila \nscript font is a stunner! Pair it with elegant metal textures or subtle \ngradients for an amazing result. This download includes a full set of \nupper and lowercase letters as well as fun swash alternates.</p><figure class=\"post_image\"><a href=\"https://graphicriver.net/item/naycila-script-font/22212199\" rel=\"external\" target=\"_blank\"><img alt=\"Naycila Script Font\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/2092/posts/31447/image/fontart1_c.jpg\"></a></figure><h3>\n<a href=\"https://graphicriver.net/item/seirra-script-and-serif-font/22107853\" target=\"_self\">Seirra Script and Serif Font</a>\n          </h3><p>Make your next logo with the gorgeous Seirra font. \nThis script and serif font pack features two handcrafted typefaces to \nsatisfy your minimalist needs. Nieves","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/2092/posts/31447/image/fontart_2020_1.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn13@2020_3/2020/09/05/06-45-19-062_543d98e68c08ddde.webp","https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/2092/posts/31447/image/fontart_2020_2b.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn31@2020_6/2020/09/05/06-45-37-036_90e8d9d0b98b1af4.webp","https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/2092/posts/31447/image/fontart_2020_3.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn81@2020_1/2020/09/05/06-45-42-863_cc73096199dfbd2a.webp","https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/2092/posts/31447/image/fontart_2020_4.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn85@2020_3/2020/09/05/06-45-32-048_d6350937a2a25257.webp","https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/2092/posts/31447/image/fontart_2020_5.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn56@2020_3/2020/09/05/06-45-33-371_8bd09f17ca46c2f7.webp","https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/2092/posts/31447/image/fontart_2020_6.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn16@2020_2/2020/09/05/06-45-33-916_57088d0bead0bb26.webp","https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/2092/posts/31447/image/fontart_2020_7.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn13@2020_2/2020/09/05/06-45-34-414_9728aee646c06245.webp","https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/2092/posts/31447/image/fontart_2020_8.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn64@2020_3/2020/09/05/06-45-35-821_f9a512a0a987273e.webp","https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/2092/posts/31447/image/fontart_2020_9.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn76@2020_6/2020/09/05/06-45-36-646_4efc6844bbb1fa3c.webp","https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/2092/posts/31447/image/fontart_2020_10.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn87@2020_4/2020/09/05/06-45-43-825_a6a67c3a2686ba04.webp","https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/2092/posts/31447/image/fontart10_c.jpg":null,"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/2092/posts/31447/image/fontart17_c.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn65@2020_4/2020/09/05/06-45-40-418_9be53130e2baa48f.webp","https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/2092/posts/31447/image/fontart11_c.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn39@2020_5/2020/09/05/06-45-33-143_c3d8fe9114054d91.webp","https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/2092/posts/31447/image/fontart8_c.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn87@2020_1/2020/09/05/06-45-41-676_b66f082c42d2f783.webp","https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/2092/posts/31447/image/fontart4_c.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn92@2020_4/2020/09/05/06-45-44-441_0cffb3e7cf8aa969.webp","https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/2092/posts/31447/image/fontart7_c.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn42@2020_2/2020/09/05/06-45-43-356_fe5287386abfa7b0.webp","https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/2092/posts/31447/image/fontart13_c.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn69@2020_3/2020/09/05/06-45-40-834_9cb9396c3b5784b6.webp","https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/2092/posts/31447/image/fontart9_c.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn89@2020_3/2020/09/05/06-45-38-774_638c2eec398b3d66.webp","https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/2092/posts/31447/image/fontart15_c.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn29@2020_2/2020/09/05/06-45-32-658_2ee4e8733d889cfa.webp","https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/2092/posts/31447/image/fontart1_c.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn55@2020_6/2020/09/05/06-45-43-506_e15638509f480d13.webp","https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/2092/posts/31447/image/fontart5_c.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn57@2020_3/2020/09/05/06-45-44-262_d00ea5a4c5dbe971.webp","https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/2092/posts/31447/image/fontart2_c.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn99@2020_2/2020/09/05/06-45-43-913_3391edf4bf6e3221.webp","https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/2092/posts/31447/image/fontart6_c.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn85@2020_3/2020/09/05/06-45-43-373_e8ae33eb951fad4b.webp","https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/2092/posts/31447/image/fontart16_c.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn81@2020_2/2020/09/05/06-45-33-645_bd2618d536ad79b4.webp","https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/2092/posts/31447/image/fontart19_c.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn95@2020_4/2020/09/05/06-45-42-344_c2ee0a4c63bc856b.webp","https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/2092/posts/31447/image/fontart3_c.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn41@2020_5/2020/09/05/06-45-41-331_cec569f7996923d1.webp","https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/2092/posts/31447/image/fontart14_c.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn76@2020_6/2020/09/05/06-45-41-646_a68b3680a58d2014.webp","https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/2092/posts/31447/image/fontart20_c.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx33/cdn66@2020_3/2020/09/05/06-45-40-780_6b5dc5550d7eb002.webp","https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/2092/posts/31447/image/fontart21_c.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx22/cdn6@2020_3/2020/09/05/06-45-39-259_3dd919f81a5e4ad2.webp","https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/2092/posts/31447/image/fontart22_c.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn47@2020_5/2020/09/05/06-45-35-478_3b2a9908966a7ac1.webp","https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/2092/posts/31447/image/fontart18_c.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn60@2020_2/2020/09/05/06-45-39-593_4f6d039802b5376d.webp","https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/2092/posts/31447/image/fontart12_c.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn88@2020_1/2020/09/05/06-45-41-008_f7859a36d6c17241.webp","https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/346/posts/28067/preview_image/sf_preview.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn7@2020_5/2020/09/05/06-45-33-856_986b139fb2942f0e.webp","https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/346/posts/29140/preview_image/fontpre.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx18/cdn98@2020_1/2020/09/05/06-45-38-797_742e1360f7a3d592.webp","https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/107/posts/29019/preview_image/6-bananito400.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn69@2020_4/2020/09/05/06-45-32-008_86fd1fa6d20c97dc.webp","https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/48/posts/33978/preview_image/advanced-typography-design-in-figma-400x277.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn58@2020_6/2020/09/05/06-45-32-006_2e051b06b9864def.webp","https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/48/posts/33806/preview_image/designing-web-typography-using-figma-400x277.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn69@2020_4/2020/09/05/06-45-37-792_fe29b24d528b28ae.webp","https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/2056/posts/33460/preview_image/Basic%20Typography%20article%20-24.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn38@2020_5/2020/09/05/06-45-39-721_899e1e4c814add67.webp","https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/1617/posts/33200/preview_image/small.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn58@2020_5/2020/09/05/06-45-36-532_797caa854829e2b6.webp","http://audio.tutsplus.com.feedsportal.com/c/35227/f/668805/s/31447/sc/4/mf.gif":null,"http://da.feedsportal.com/r/186529796139/u/407/f/668805/c/35227/s/31447/a2.img":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn84@2020_2/2020/09/05/06-45-44-267_527204578726f1d7.jpg","http://pi.feedsportal.com/r/186529796139/u/407/f/668805/c/35227/s/31447/a2t.img":null},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1599288318840},{"createdTime":"2020-09-05 14:45:18","updatedTime":"2020-09-05 14:45:18","title":"How to Create a Set of Flat Animal Icons in Adobe Illustrator","link":"https://design.tutsplus.com/tutorials/how-to-create-a-set-of-flat-animal-icons-in-adobe-illustrator--cms-24710","description":"<figure class=\"final-product final-product--image\"><img src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/2092/posts/24710/final_image/animal_new_40.jpg\" alt=\"Final product image\"><!--googleoff: index--><figcaption>What You'll Be Creating</figcaption><!--googleon: index--></figure><p>In this tutorial, we’ll create six different\nanimal portraits from one and the same circle! Let’s have fun making a set of\ntrendy flat elements using basic shapes, the Shape Builder Tool, the Pathfinder panel, and some other useful functions of Adobe Illustrator!</p><h2>What You'll Learn in This Adobe Illustrator  Tutorial</h2><ul>\n<li>How to move and alter points to manipulate shapes</li>\n<li>How to use the Shape Builder Tool in Adobe Illustrator</li>\n<li>How to combine and layer shapes </li>\n<li>How to copy and reflect shapes</li>\n</ul><p>This tutorial was inspired by the many <a href=\"https://graphicriver.net/search?utf8=%E2%9C%93&amp;term=animal+icons&amp;as=0&amp;referrer=homepage\" target=\"_self\">animal icons</a> on <a href=\"https://graphicriver.net/\" target=\"_self\">Envato Market</a> and <a href=\"https://elements.envato.com/all-items/animal+icons\" target=\"_self\">Envato Elements</a>.<br></p><p>If you're looking for a set in no time at all, head on over to <a href=\"https://elements.envato.com/flat-animals-icons-set-E9KEGB\" target=\"_self\">Envato Elements</a> where you can purchase my whole <a href=\"https://elements.envato.com/flat-animals-icons-set-E9KEGB\" target=\"_self\">Flat Animal Icons Set</a>.</p><figure class=\"post_image\"><a href=\"https://elements.envato.com/flat-animals-icons-set-E9KEGB\" target=\"_self\"><img alt=\"Flat Animal Icons Set\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/33/posts/24710/image/animalpreviewelements.jpg\" title=\"Image: https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/33/posts/24710/image/animalpreviewelements.jpg\"></a></figure><h2>\n<span class=\"sectionnum\">1.</span> How to Create an Elegant Siamese Cat</h2><h3>Step 1</h3><p>Start forming the cat’s face from an even\ncircle of <b>60 x 60 px</b> size, made with\nthe <b>Ellipse Tool (L). </b>Fill the\ncircle with a sandy beige color.</p><figure class=\"post_image\"><img alt=\"forming the cats face from an even circle \" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/2092/posts/24710/image/animal_new_1.jpg\" title=\"Image: https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/2092/posts/24710/image/animal_new_1.jpg\"></figure><h3>Step 2</h3><p>Select both side anchor points with the <b>Direct Selection Tool (A)</b> and drag them\ndown, changing the shape of the face.</p><figure class=\"post_image\"><img alt=\"change the shape of the face\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/2092/posts/24710/image/animal_new_2.jpg\" title=\"Image: https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/2092/posts/24710/image/animal_new_2.jpg\"></figure><h3>Step 3</h3><p>Now let’s form the cat’s ear. Take the <b>Polygon Tool</b> and make a three-sided shape\nof about <b>17 x 15 px</b> size. Go to <b>Effect &gt; Warp &gt; Bulge</b> and set the\n<b>Vertical Bend</b> value to <b>40%. </b></p><p><b>Object &gt; Expand Appearance </b>of\nthe shape to apply the effect. Select the upper anchor point with the <b>Direct Select Tool (A)</b> and make the\ncorner smooth by clicking the <b>Convert\ncorners to smooth</b> button in the upper context panel. Shorten the anchor\nhandles of this anchor point and drag the anchor point up, making the ear more\npointed.</p><figure class=\"post_image\"><img alt=\"\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/2092/posts/24710/image/animal_new_3.jpg\"></figure><h3>Step 4</h3><p><b>Copy</b> the shape and <b>Paste</b> it <b>in Front (Control-C &gt; Control-F)</b>.\nMake the copy smaller and fill it with chocolate-brown color. Rotate the ear\nand place it on the left side of the head, <b>Sending\n</b>it <b>to Back (Control-Shift-[),</b>\nbeneath the head shape. Use the <b>Reflect\nTool (O)</b> by double-clicking its icon\nin the <b>Tools</b> panel to flip the ear\nover the <b>Vertical</b> <strong>Axis</strong> and to create\na copy, placing it on the opposite side of the head.</p><figure class=\"post_image\"><img alt=\"attach the ears to the head\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/2092/posts/24710/image/animal_new_4.jpg\"></figure><h3>Step 5</h3><p>Let’s make the top part of the head flat.\nSelect the head shape, take the <b>Eraser\nTool (Shift-E)</b> and draw a narrow stripe across the head by holding down\nthe <b>Alt</b> key. Now we’ve sliced the\nshape into two parts. Select the unneeded piece and delete it.</p><figure class=\"post_image\"><img alt=\"make the top part of the head flat\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/2092/posts/24710/image/animal_new_5.jpg\" title=\"Image: https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/2092/posts/24710/image/animal_new_5.jpg\"></figure><h3>Step 6</h3><p>Make a small pink triangle nose with the <b>Polygon Tool</b>. Select the nose and pull\nthe circle indicators of the <strong>Live Corners</strong> to make the shape rounded. If this\nfunction is unavailable in your version of Adobe Illustrator, use <b>Effect &gt; Stylize &gt; Round Corners</b>\nwhich does exactly the same.</p><figure class=\"post_image\"><img alt=\"Make a small pink triangle nose with the Polygon Tool\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/2092/posts/24710/image/animal_new_6.jpg\"></figure><h3>Step 7</h3><p>Make another ellipse and place it inside\nthe face, so that it touches the lower point of the nose. Align the ellipse to\nthe nose, using the nose as a <b>Key Object</b>.\nTo do so, select both shapes and click the nose while holding down <b>Alt</b>. You will see a thick stroke around\nthe nose, indicating the <b>Key Object</b>.\nHead to the <b>Align</b> panel and click <b>Horizontal Align Center. </b></p><p>Then take the<b> Anchor Point Tool (Shift-C)</b> and move the anchor handles of the bottom anchor point down to\nabout <b>45 degrees</b>. Use the <b>Guides</b> to move the handles to the equal distance (you can add the <b>Guide</b> line\nby dragging it down to your Artboard from the <b>Rulers (Control-R)</b>).</p><p>Fill the face “mask” with the same brown\ncolor as we have on the ears, picking the color with the <b>Eyedropper Tool (I).</b> Add a smaller, lighter-brown ellipse\nbeneath the mask, depicting the lower jaw.</p><figure class=\"post_image\"><img alt=\"\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/2092/posts/24710/image/animal_new_7.jpg\"></figure><h3>Step 8</h3><p>Now let’s add the eyes! Make an ellipse,\nselect its right anchor point and convert it to a sharp corner from the <b>Convert</b> menu in the control panel\nabove. <strong>Fill </strong>the ellipse with a bright blue color and add another ellipse above\nfor the iris. </p><p>Here we need to delete the piece of the iris that overlaps the\nedge of the eye. Select both ellipses, and use the <b>Shape Builder Tool (Shift-M)</b> to erase the upper part of the iris by\nholding down the <b>Alt </b>key and\nclicking the unwanted piece.  </p><p>Rotate the eye a bit and create a mirrored\ncopy using the <b>Reflect Tool (O).</b></p><figure class=\"post_image\"><img alt=\"add the eyes\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/2092/posts/24710/image/animal_new_8.jpg\"></figure><h3>Step 9</h3><p>Make two light-brown ellipses for the brows\nof our cat, and add two tiny white circles in the eyes for the highlights.</p><p>Create a lighter-pink ellipse, placing it\nabove the upper part of the nose, and use the <b>Shape Builder Tool (Shift-M)</b> holding down <b>Alt </b>to delete the unneeded part, thus making the nose more\ndetailed.</p><figure class=\"post_image\"><img alt=\"adding to the cat \" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/2092/posts/24710/image/animal_new_10.jpg\"></figure><h3>Step 10</h3><p>And let’s create a trendy flat shadow,\ncovering one half of the cat’s head. <b>Group\n(Control-G)</b> all parts of the cat together, <b>Copy</b> the group and <b>Paste</b>\nit <b>in Front (Control-C &gt; Control-F).</b>\nKeeping the copy selected, <b>Unite</b> its\nparts in the <b>Pathfinder</b> panel, merging\nthem into a single shape. Switch the <b>Blending\nMode</b> of the silhouette to <b>Multiply</b>,\nmaking it semi-transparent. </p><p>Finally, select the silhouette, take the <b>Eraser Tool (Shift-E)</b> and, holding down\n<b>Alt,</b> drag your mouse over the left\nhalf of the cat’s head, covering it with a white rectangular selection. Release\nthe mouse button to delete the covered piece.</p><p>And here we have it! Our flat cat is ready.\nLet’s move on to the next element.</p><figure class=\"post_image\"><img alt=\"Final cat illustration\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/2092/posts/24710/image/animal_new_11.jpg\" title=\"Image: https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/2092/posts/24710/image/animal_new_11.jpg\"></figure><h2>\n<span class=\"sectionnum\">2.</span> How to Draw a Cheerful Puppy</h2><h3>Step 1</h3><p>As previously, we start forming a portrait\nfrom a <b>60 x 60 px</b> circle. Move the\nside anchor points down a bit, making the shape bulgy, and erase its top part\nwith the <b>Eraser Tool (Shift-E). </b></p><p>Select\nthe left anchor point with the <b>Direct\nSelection Tool (A)</b> and press <b>Enter</b>\nto open the <b>Move </b>options window. Set\nthe <b>Horizontal Position</b> value to <b>-5 px </b>and the <b>Vertical</b> value to <b>0 px</b>\nand click <b>OK,</b> thus moving the\nanchor point 5 pixels to the left. </p><p>Do the same for the right anchor point,\nsetting the <b>Horizontal</b> move value to\n<b>5 px</b> and moving it <b>5 px</b> to the right.</p><figure class=\"post_image\"><img alt=\"start forming a portrait from a 60x60 px circle\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/2092/posts/24710/image/animal_new_12.jpg\"></figure><h3>Step 2</h3><p>Select both side anchor points and <b>Convert</b> them to sharp corners. Adjust\nthe position of the anchor handles using the <b>Anchor Point Tool (Shift-C)</b> and move them up, making a smooth curve\nof the face line.</p><figure class=\"post_image\"><img alt=\"Select both side anchor points and Convert them to sharp corners\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/2092/posts/24710/image/animal_new_13.jpg\"></figure><h3>Step 3</h3><p>Let’s form the ear from a <b>40 x 35 px</b> triangle, using the <b>Polygon Tool</b>. Take the <b>Curvature Tool (Control-`)</b> and make the\nsides of the triangle more rounded and bulging. If you’re using earlier versions\nof Adobe Illustrator, which don’t contain this tool, feel free to use <b>Effect &gt; Warp &gt; Bulge</b>, as we did\npreviously. </p><p>Select the upper anchor point, make it smoother and drag it\nto the left, making the shape skewed. Go to <b>Object &gt; Path &gt; Offset Path</b> and set the <b>Offset</b> value to <b>-3 px</b>,\nforming the inner part of the ear. Fill it with a light-grey color.</p><figure class=\"post_image\"><img alt=\"form the ear from a 40x35 px triangle\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/2092/posts/24710/image/animal_new_14.jpg\"></figure><h3>Step 4</h3><p>Rotate the ear and place it at the left\nside of the head. Use the <b>Reflect Tool\n(O)</b> to create a mirrored copy on the opposite side.</p><figure class=\"post_image\"><img alt=\"attach the ears to the head\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/2092/posts/24710/image/animal_new_15.jpg\" title=\"Image: https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/2092/posts/24710/image/animal_new_15.jpg\"></figure><h3>Step 5</h3><p>Form a dark-grey nose from a squashed\nellipse, dragging its lower anchor point down a bit. Make two overlapping\nlight-grey ellipses beneath the nose, group them and <b>Align</b> with the face horizontally, using the face shape as the <b>Key Object</b>.</p><figure class=\"post_image\"><img alt=\"Form a dark-grey nose from a squashed ellipse\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/2092/posts/24710/image/animal_new_16.jpg\"></figure><h3>Step 6</h3><p>Now let’s make a funny tongue sticking out!\nCreate a light-pink rectangle using the <b>Rectangle\nTool (M)</b>, and place it under the light-grey ellipses. Select both lower\nanchor points and pull the Live Corners markers up to their maximum, making the\nbottom of the shape rounded. Take the <b>Line\nSegment Tool (\\)</b> and draw a vertical stroke, while holding down <b>Shift.</b> You can make the tips of the\nline rounded in the <b>Stroke</b> panel.</p><figure class=\"post_image\"><img alt=\"make a tongue from rectangle\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/2092/posts/24710/image/animal_new_17.jpg\"></figure><h3>Step 7</h3><p>Let’s move to the eyes. Make a dark-blue\nellipse and cover its lower part with another ellipse or any color. Select both\nshapes and use the <b>Shape Builder Tool\n(Shift-M)</b> to delete the lower ellipse together with the bottom part of the\neye, which was covered. This way we’re making a playful look. Add a\ndarker iris and a tiny white highlight to the eye. </p><p>Rotate the eye a bit and create a second\none, placing it on the other side of the face.</p><figure class=\"post_image\"><img alt=\"create the eyes from ellipses\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/2092/posts/24710/image/animal_new_18.jpg\"></figure><h3>Step 8</h3><p>Create two even light-grey circles,\ncovering the eyes. Then add two bigger circles, overlapping and covering\nthe lower part of the face, as shown in the screenshot below. Select the lower\ncircles and use the <b>Shape Builder Tool\n(Shift-M)</b> to delete those parts outside the face. </p><p>Select all four new pieces and <b>Unite</b> them in <b>Pathfinder</b>, making a face “mask”. You\ncan delete the gap in the center of the mask by clicking its edge with the <b>Direct Selection Tool (A)</b> and deleting\nit.</p><figure class=\"post_image\"><img alt=\"make a face mask from ellipses\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/2092/posts/24710/image/animal_new_19.jpg\"></figure><h3>Step 9</h3><p>Make two tiny rectangles with rounded\ncorners for the brows, making the dog look kind and cheerful, and finish up by\ncreating a subtle shadow on the right half of the face.</p><figure class=\"post_image\"><img alt=\"add details and shadow\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/2092/posts/24710/image/animal_new_20.jpg\"></figure><h2>\n<span class=\"sectionnum\">3.</span> How to Make a Fancy Raccoon</h2><h3>Step 1</h3><p>We start shaping out the face from a <b>60 x 60 px</b> pastel-blue circle. Squash it\na bit and make the shape wider. Drag both side anchor points a few pixels down, and <b>Convert</b> them to sharp corners\nfrom the <b>Convert</b> menu in the upper\ntoolbar.</p><p>Copy the ears from our cat, recolor them\naccording to the color of the raccoon’s head, and place them on both sides of the\nhead.</p><figure class=\"post_image\"><img alt=\"make the face from a 60x60 px pastel-blue circle\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/2092/posts/24710/image/animal_new_21.jpg\" title=\"Image: https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/2092/posts/24710/image/animal_new_21.jpg\"></figure><h3>Step 2</h3><p>Make a nose from an <b>18 x 10 px</b> dark-grey ellipse, dragging its top anchor point up a bit.\nCreate another ellipse with a dark-grey <b>Stroke</b>\ncolor, setting the <b>Fill</b> color to <b>None</b> in the <b>Color</b> panel. Take the <b>Scissors\nTool (C)</b> and click the left and right anchor points, splitting the\nshape horizontally into two equal halves. <strong>Delete</strong> the lower half, making our\nraccoon smile.</p><figure class=\"post_image\"><img alt=\"make a nose and a smile\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/2092/posts/24710/image/animal_new_22.jpg\" title=\"Image: https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/2092/posts/24710/image/animal_new_22.jpg\"></figure><h3>Step 3</h3><p>Copy the face shape and make the copy much\nsmaller, filling it with white color and placing it beneath the nose area. Add two\ntiny black eyes with white highlights, group them and align to the face\nhorizontally in the <b>Align</b> panel,\nmaking the face a <b>Key Object.</b> </p><p>Copy the face shape once again, making the\ncopy a bit smaller, fill it with dark-blue color and place it in the bottom part of the face, forming a mask.</p><figure class=\"post_image\"><img alt=\"add facial details\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/2092/posts/24710/image/animal_new_23.jpg\"></figure><h3>Step 4</h3><p>Let’s split the mask into two halves,\ncreating two separate spots around the eyes. Take the <b>Rectangle Tool (M)</b> and draw a vertical stripe across the middle of\nthe face. Select both the mask and the stripe, and use the <b>Divide</b> function of <b>Pathfinder</b>\nto slice all the shapes. Delete the unneeded pieces, if there are any. Place\nthe halves you've created beneath the eyes, and make the corners slightly rounded.</p><p>Finally, add a flat shadow to the right\npart of the face. Now we can move on!</p><figure class=\"post_image\"><img alt=\"split the mask into two halves and add a shadow\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/2092/posts/24710/image/animal_new_24.jpg\"></figure><h2>\n<span class=\"sectionnum\">4.</span> How to Make a Kind Panda</h2><h3>Step 1</h3><p>Make a fluffy face shape from a <b>60 x 60 px</b> light-beige circle, moving its\nside anchor points down.</p><figure class=\"post_image\"><img alt=\"Make a face shape from a 60x60 px light-beige circle\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/2092/posts/24710/image/animal_new_25.jpg\" title=\"Image: https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/2092/posts/24710/image/animal_new_25.jpg\"></figure><h3>Step 2</h3><p>Copy the nose area from our dog and set the\n<b>Stroke</b> color of the “lips” to\ndark-grey, so that the outline is visible. Select two outlined ellipses\n(without the nose) and <b>Unite</b>\nthem in <b>Pathfinder.</b></p><p>Choose the <b>Scissors Tool (C)</b> and click the side anchor points of the outlined\nshape, splitting it apart. Delete the upper half, forming a kind smile for our\npanda.</p><figure class=\"post_image\"><img alt=\"form the mouth from two ellipses\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/2092/posts/24710/image/animal_new_26b.jpg\" title=\"Image: https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/2092/posts/24710/image/animal_new_26b.jpg\"></figure><h3>Step 3</h3><p>Copy the eyes from our raccoon, and let’s\nform big, dark-grey spots around the eyes. Make a squashed ellipse and\nrotate it a bit to the left. Use the <b>Reflect\nTool (O)</b> to make a copy and flip it horizontally to the other side of the\nface. Fill the eyeballs with white color, so that they are visible above the\ndark spots. </p><p>Keeping the eyeballs selected, go to <b>Object &gt; Path &gt; Offset Path</b> and\ncreate tiny pupils inside the eyes.</p><figure class=\"post_image\"><img alt=\"create the eyes and the eye spots\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/2092/posts/24710/image/animal_new_27.jpg\"></figure><h3>Step 4</h3><p>Add round, dark-grey ears to the panda’s head, and finish up by forming a semi-transparent shadow over the right side of its\nface.</p><p>Great work! Let’s move on!</p><figure class=\"post_image\"><img alt=\"add ears and shadow\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/2092/posts/24710/image/animal_new_28.jpg\"></figure><h2>\n<span class=\"sectionnum\">5.</span> How to Create a Wise Bear</h2><h3>Step 1</h3><p>Start making a bear’s face from a <b>60 x 60 px</b> circle. Move both side\nanchor points down and drag the top anchor point up, making the head look like\nan egg. </p><p>Make the top of the head flat with the <b>Eraser Tool (Shift-E). </b>And make the corners\nof the shape slightly rounded.</p><figure class=\"post_image\"><img alt=\"make a bears face from a 60x60 px circle\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/2092/posts/24710/image/animal_new_29.jpg\"></figure><h3>Step 2</h3><p>Add two circle ears to the top of the head,\ngroup them and <b>Align</b> them\nhorizontally, using the head as a <b>Key\nObject. </b>Use the <b>Offset Path</b>\nfunction with <b>-3 px Offset</b> value to\nform the dark inner part of the ears.</p><figure class=\"post_image\"><img alt=\"Add two circle ears to the top of the head\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/2092/posts/24710/image/animal_new_30.jpg\"></figure><h3>Step 3</h3><p>Make a wide, dark-brown nose from a squashed\nellipse. And let’s form the nose-bridge. Take the <b>Rectangle Tool (M)</b> and make a light-beige shape, placing it behind\nthe nose. Move its upper left anchor point <b>5\npx</b> to the right, using the <b>Move</b>\noptions panel. Do the same for the upper right anchor point, moving it in the\nopposite direction and thus making the top of the nose-bridge narrower. </p><p>Make the corners of the rectangle rounded.\nUsing the <strong>Live Corners</strong> function, you can vary the level of the roundness of\neach separate corner of the shape. For example, you can select only the upper\nanchor points and thus make the upper corners 100% rounded by pulling the\nmarkers down to their maximum.</p><figure class=\"post_image\"><img alt=\"form the nose bridge from rectangle\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/2092/posts/24710/image/animal_new_31.jpg\"></figure><h3>Step 4</h3><p>Add a small ellipse beneath the bottom of\nthe nose-bridge, forming the lower jaw. Add the eyes to the bear’s face and, if\nyou feel that the bear's face is too dark, make the brown parts a\nbit lighter. </p><p>Finally, add the shadow to the bear’s face.</p><p>Awesome! We have the last character left!</p><figure class=\"post_image\"><img alt=\"add minor details and shadow\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/2092/posts/24710/image/animal_new_32.jpg\"></figure><h2>\n<span class=\"sectionnum\">6.</span> How to Make a Cunning Fox</h2><h3>Step 1</h3><p>And again, we start forming the face of the\nfox from our familiar <b>60 x 60 px</b>\ncircle of an orange color. Pull the side anchor points down a bit and <b>Convert</b> them to sharp corners, making\nthe sides of the face pointed. <b>Convert</b>\nthe lower anchor point to a corner as well, forming a sharp nose.</p><figure class=\"post_image\"><img alt=\"form the face from a circle\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/2092/posts/24710/image/animal_new_33.jpg\"></figure><h3>Step 2</h3><p>Take the ears from our raccoon and position\nthem at both sides of the fox’s head, adjusting the colors. Put a black\nellipse over the bottom part of the face, covering the nose area. Use the <b>Shape Builder Tool (Shift-M)</b> to get rid\nof the piece outside the face, forming a pointed black nose.</p><figure class=\"post_image\"><img alt=\"add the ears and nose\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/2092/posts/24710/image/animal_new_34.jpg\"></figure><h3>Step 3</h3><p>Create an ellipse, overlapping the left\nside of the fox’s face, as shown in the screenshot below. Use the <b>Reflect Tool (O)</b> to make a flipped copy on the opposite side. Select both ellipses and delete those parts outside the\nface with the <b>Shape Builder Tool\n(Shift-M). </b>Fill the shapes with light-beige color, forming the cheeks. Add two tiny, shiny eyes to our fox.</p><figure class=\"post_image\"><img alt=\"add the cheeks and the eyes with ellipses\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/2092/posts/24710/image/animal_new_35.jpg\" title=\"Image: https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/2092/posts/24710/image/animal_new_35.jpg\"></figure><h3>Step 4</h3><p>Make the tip of the nose a bit rounded with\nthe help of the Live Corners function. And let’s add some more details to our\nfox! </p><p>Make a small squashed ellipse of a\nlighter-orange color, and place it at the left side of the nose-bridge. Select\nthe shape, hold <b>Alt-Shift</b> and drag\nthe ellipse to the right, making a copy. Press <b>Control-D</b> twice to form two more copies. Make two more rows of\nellipses, placing them in a crisscrossed position. This way we depict a\nstylized fur on the fox’s nose.</p><p>Don’t forget to add a gentle highlight to\nthe nose by forming a smaller and lighter shape on top of the nose.</p><figure class=\"post_image\"><img alt=\"add more details to the face\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/2092/posts/24710/image/animal_new_36.jpg\"></figure><h3>Step 5</h3><p>Add a gentle shadow to the right side of\nour cunning foxie.</p><figure class=\"post_image\"><img alt=\"add a shadow\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/2092/posts/24710/image/animal_new_37.jpg\"></figure><h2>\n<span class=\"sectionnum\">7.</span> How to Create Icons With Long Shadows</h2><h3>Step 1</h3><p>Now that we have six flat-style animal portraits,\nlet’s place them on a set of colorful circles, creating icons.</p><p>Make a turquoise circle of <b>106 x 106 px</b> size for the icon's base, and put the raccoon’s\nhead in the center. </p><p>Create an <b>80 x 80 px</b> square for the shadow base and rotate it to <b>45 degrees</b> by holding down <b>Shift.</b></p><figure class=\"post_image\"><img alt=\"create icon base\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/2092/posts/24710/image/animal_new_38.jpg\"></figure><h3>Step 2</h3><p>Switch the <b>Blending Mode</b> of the square to <b>Multiply</b>,\nmaking it semi-transparent, and place the shape above the raccoon. Make the\nshape a bit narrower, if needed, and move it around, finding the two spots where the shape overlaps the head. In our case, it is the tip of the right ear\nand the left side of the face. Add two anchor points at these spots\nusing the <b>Add Anchor Point Tool (+)</b>, and then switch to the <b>Delete Anchor\nPoint Tool (-)</b> and delete those unneeded anchor points at the top of the\nrectangle, hiding the top of the shape\nbeneath the raccoon’s head.</p><p>Place the shadow under the head, delete the unneeded piece outside the icon with the <strong>Shape Builder Tool (Shift-M)</strong> and—voila!—our fancy icon with a trendy flat shadow is finished! Create the circle\nicons for all the rest of the animals using the same simple techniques.</p><figure class=\"post_image\"><img alt=\"create long shadow icon\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/2092/posts/24710/image/animal_new_39.jpg\"></figure><h2>Great Job! Our Set of Flat Animal Icons Is\nCompleted!</h2><p>This was fun, wasn’t it? I hope you’ve\nenjoyed creating these cute flat animals from one and the same shape and\nlearned some new tips and tricks, playing around with ellipses, the <b>Pathfinder</b> panel and the <b>Shape Builder Tool</b>! Stay tuned for new\ntutorials, and don’t forget to show your result in the comment below!</p><figure class=\"post_image\"><img alt=\"Flat Animal Icons Adobe Illustrator Tutorial\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/2092/posts/24710/image/animal_new_40.jpg\"></figure><p>If you want to learn more about <a href=\"https://design.tutsplus.com/courses/from-the-top-adobe-illustrator-for-beginners\" target=\"_self\">how to use Adobe Illustrator</a>, take our free three-hour beginner's course. Start by mastering the Illustrator basics, and then learn to create effects, patterns, and more—all with clear video instruction from an Adobe-certified Illustrator expert.</p><figure><div class=\"wistia_responsive_padding\"><div class=\"wistia_responsive_wrapper\"><div class=\"wistia_embed wistia_async_no9r4e1wp3 videoFoam=true\"> </div></div></div></figure><p>If you're looking for a set in no time at all, head on over to <a href=\"https://elements.envato.com/flat-animals-icons-set-E9KEGB\" target=\"_self\">Envato Elements</a> where you can purchase my whole <a href=\"https://elements.envato.com/flat-animals-icons-set-E9KEGB\" target=\"_self\">Flat Animal Icons Set</a>.</p><figure class=\"post_image\"><a href=\"https://elements.envato.com/flat-animals-icons-set-E9KEGB\" rel=\"external\" target=\"_blank\"><img alt=\"Flat Animal Icons Set\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/2092/posts/24710/image/iconset.jpg\"></a></figure><h2>Animal Icons From Envato Elements<br>\n</h2><p>Want more choices? Check out some of our favorites below!<br></p><h3>1. <a href=\"https://elements.envato.com/15-animal-vector-icons-PZ89QY\" target=\"_self\">15 Animal Vector Icons</a>\n</h3><figure class=\"post_image\"><a href=\"https://elements.envato.com/15-animal-vector-icons-PZ89QY\" target=\"_self\" title=\"Link: https://elements.envato.com/15-animal-vector-icons-PZ89QY\"><img alt=\"15 Animal Vector Icons\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/346/posts/24710/image/env11.jpg\" title=\"Image: https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/346/posts/24710/image/env11.jpg\"></a></figure>\n<p>These adorable animal icons might just be the perfect addition to your website or app! Check out this collection of vector animal illustrations. They not only come with AI and EPS files, for use in Adobe Illustrator, but with PNG and JPG files, too, for your convenience.</p><h3>4. <a href=\"https://elements.envato.com/animals-vector-isometric-icons-94JY4B\" rel=\"external\" target=\"_blank\">Animals Isometric Illustration Icons</a>\n</h3><figure class=\"post_image\"><a href=\"https://elements.envato.com/animals-vector-isometric-icons-94JY4B\" rel=\"external\" target=\"_blank\"><img alt=\"Animals Isometric Illustration Icons\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/2092/posts/24710/image/elements_3b.jpg\" title=\"Image: https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/2092/posts/24710/image/elements_3b.jpg\"></a></figure><p>Love a blocky, isometric aesthetic? Then check out this collection of fun, cute isometric animals. There are 20 cute animals to choose from, and you can customize them all in Adobe Illustrator. <br></p><h3>5. <a href=\"https://elements.envato.com/40-rounded-animals-UAHTCLS\" rel=\"external\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"Link: https://elements.envato.com/40-rounded-animals-UAHTCLS\">Cute Rounded Animal Icons</a>\n</h3><figure class=\"post_image\"><a href=\"https://elements.envato.com/40-rounded-animals-UAHTCLS\" rel=\"external\" target=\"_blank\"><img alt=\"Cute Rounded Animal Icons\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/2092/posts/24710/image/elements_4b.jpg\" title=\"Image: https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/2092/posts/24710/image/elements_4b.jpg\"></a></figure><p>Aren't these rounded animal illustrations cute? This is just a sample of the 40 cute animal illustrations included in this vector icon set. Download them today and use them in your next cute, animal-themed project.</p><h2>Create More Cute Vector Art Today!<br>\n</h2><p>Love Illustrator? Check them out for more illustration walkthroughs and inspiration:</p><ul class=\"roundup-block__contents posts--half-width roundup-block--list\">\n<li class=\"roundup-block__content\"><a It's got a dark and modern finish that's perfect for luxury products.</p><h3>10. <a href=\"https://elements.envato.com/product-brochure-P2ZD22\" rel=\"external\" target=\"_blank\">Product Brochure</a> (INDD)</h3><figure class=\"post_image\"><a href=\"https://elements.envato.com/product-brochure-P2ZD22\" rel=\"external\" target=\"_blank\"><img alt=\"Product Brochure\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/65/posts/33931/image/Product-Brochure-envanto-elements.jpg\"></a></figure><p>Available in 20 layout pages, this marketing brochure offers a variety of designs to choose from. This is highly recommended for companies with diverse and extensive products.</p><h2>Envato Elements (Design Without Limits)</h2><figure class=\"post_image\"><a href=\"https://elements.envato.com/\" rel=\"external\" target=\"_blank\"><img alt=\"Envato Elements Design Without Limits\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/23/posts/27742/image/envato-elements-design-without-limits-unlimited.jpg\" class=\"loaded\"></a><figcaption>Envato Elements: unlimited template downloads for one low price.</figcaption></figure><p><a href=\"https://elements.envato.com/\">Envato Elements</a> has a single compelling (all-inclusive) offer:</p><p><strong>Sign up for Envato Elements and you get access to tons of unlimited-use graphics and templates</strong><b>. Get great</b><strong> web themes, the best <a href=\"https://elements.envato.com/graphic-templates/print-templates/company+brochure\" rel=\"external\" target=\"_blank\">company marketing brochure templates</a>, and more—all for <a href=\"https://elements.envato.com/pricing\" target=\"_self\">one low price</a>. </strong></p><figure class=\"post_image\"><a href=\"https://elements.envato.com/\" rel=\"external\" target=\"_blank\"><img alt=\"Get unlimited downloads from a massive digital warehouse of creative assets\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/23/posts/27742/image/envato-elements-unlimited-creative-files.jpg\" class=\"loaded\"></a><figcaption>Get unlimited downloads from a massive digital warehouse of creative assets.</figcaption></figure><p>That’s right! Download as many professional templates and graphics as you want, and customize them to fit any of your project needs.</p><p><em>While Envato Elements is a powerful option, if you prefer to buy unique company marketing brochure templates one at a time (instead of getting unlimited access </em><i>to hundreds of professional designs)</i><em>, check out the selection from our GraphicRiver marketplace below.</em></p><h2>15 Best Company Brochure Examples in 2020 From GraphicRiver</h2><p>If you're looking for one-time use, then a great affordable alternative is the <a href=\"https://graphicriver.net/graphics-with-company+brochure-in-print-templates/brochures\" rel=\"external\" target=\"_blank\">marketing brochure templates</a> from GraphicRiver. These marketing brochure templates have modern graphics, stunning typography, and customizable photography.</p><figure class=\"post_image\"><a href=\"https://graphicriver.net/graphics-with-company+brochure-in-print-templates/brochures\" rel=\"external\" target=\"_blank\"><img alt=\"GraphicRiver templates\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/65/posts/33931/image/GraphicRiver.jpg\"></a><figcaption>Buy individual company brochure templates on <a href=\"https://graphicriver.net/graphics-with-company+brochure-in-print-templates/brochures\" rel=\"external\" target=\"_blank\">GraphicRiver</a>.</figcaption></figure><p>From a huge collection of company brochures, just purchase the right template from the following <a href=\"https://graphicriver.net/popular_item/by_category?category=print-templates/brochures\" rel=\"external\" target=\"_blank\">business brochure examples on GraphicRiver</a>:</p><h3>1. <a href=\"https://graphicriver.net/item/company-brochure/23297784\" rel=\"external\" target=\"_blank\">Company Brochure</a> (INDD)</h3><figure class=\"post_image\"><a href=\"https://graphicriver.net/item/company-brochure/23297784\" rel=\"external\" target=\"_blank\"><img alt=\"Company Brochure\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/65/posts/33931/image/Company%20Brochure%20graphicriver.jpg\"></a></figure><p>Get this stylish template from one of the most sought-after company brochure examples for marketing, sales, photography, real estate, and travel companies. This template is also highly customizable⁠—just add your own logo and photos, and you're ready to go.</p><h3>6. <a href=\"https://graphicriver.net/item/luxury-brochure-for-property-hotel-interior/7973509\" rel=\"external\" target=\"_blank\">Luxury Brochure for Property - Hotel - Interior</a> (PSD, INDD)</h3><figure class=\"post_image\"><a href=\"https://graphicriver.net/item/luxury-brochure-for-property-hotel-interior/7973509\" rel=\"external\" target=\"_blank\"><img alt=\"Luxury Brochure for Property - Hotel - Interior\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/65/posts/33931/image/Luxury%20Brochure%20for%20Property%20-%20Hotel%20-%20Interior%20Luxury%20Brochure%20for%20Property%20-%20Hotel%20-%20Interior.jpg\"></a></figure><p>Crafted for hotels, interior designers, and luxury brands, this marketing brochure template exemplifies elegance at its finest. It can be used for a variety of purposes too.</p><h3>9. <a href=\"https://graphicriver.net/item/product-brochure-template/24292490\" rel=\"external\" target=\"_blank\">Product Brochure Template</a> (PSD)</h3><figure class=\"post_image\"><a href=\"https://graphicriver.net/item/product-brochure-template/24292490\" rel=\"external\" target=\"_blank\"><img alt=\"Product Brochure Template\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/65/posts/33931/image/Product%20Brochure%20Template%20graphicriver.jpg\"></a></figure><p>With a fun and colorful touch, this product brochure is at the top of creative marketing brochure ideas for 2020. It's also highly recommended for electronic products like laptops, cameras, and mobile phones. </p><h3>11. <a href=\"https://graphicriver.net/item/content-marketing-trifold-brochure/13950268\" rel=\"external\" target=\"_blank\">Content Marketing Trifold Brochure</a> (PSD)</h3><figure class=\"post_image\"><a href=\"https://graphicriver.net/item/content-marketing-trifold-brochure/13950268\" rel=\"external\" target=\"_blank\"><img alt=\"Content Marketing Trifold Brochure\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/65/posts/33931/image/Content%20Marketing%20Trifold%20Brochure%20graphicriver.jpg\"></a></figure><p>Perfect for marketing companies, ad agencies, and digital industries, this tri-fold company brochure has a sharp and modern cut. It's also perfect for content marketing services and other online projects.</p><h3>12. <a href=\"https://graphicriver.net/item/kreatype-company-brochure/17328697\" rel=\"external\" target=\"_blank\">Kreatype Company Brochure</a> (INDD)</h3><figure class=\"post_image\"><a href=\"https://graphicriver.net/item/kreatype-company-brochure/17328697\" rel=\"external\" target=\"_blank\"><img alt=\"Kreatype Company Brochure\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/65/posts/33931/image/Kreatype%20Company%20Brochure%20graphicriver.jpg\"></a></figure><p>Geared towards a more traditional look, this template is one of the best informational brochure examples. You can use this to design a more refined and sophisticated company brochure.</p><h3>13. <a href=\"https://graphicriver.net/item/square-company-brochure/20869386\" rel=\"external\" target=\"_blank\">Square Company Brochure</a> (INDD)</h3><figure class=\"post_image\"><a href=\"https://graphicriver.net/item/square-company-brochure/20869386\" rel=\"external\" target=\"_blank\"><img alt=\"Square Company Brochure\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/65/posts/33931/image/Square%20Company%20Brochure%20graphicriver.jpg\"></a></figure><p>This template is one of the best marketing brochures examples out there, evoking both simplicity and creativity. It doesn't have heavy graphics but is still visually striking.</p><h3>14. <a href=\"https://graphicriver.net/item/state-company-brochure/5942921\" rel=\"external\" target=\"_blank\">State Company Brochure</a> (EPS, INDD, AI)</h3><figure class=\"post_image\"><a href=\"https://graphicriver.net/item/state-company-brochure/5942921\" rel=\"external\" target=\"_blank\"><img alt=\"State Company Brochure\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/65/posts/33931/image/State%20Company%20Brochure%20graphicriver.jpg\"></a></figure><p>A fully editable and customizable template, this company brochure can be used for any type of company, project, or advertising promotion. It's perfect for government agencies and state departments as well.</p><h3>15. <a href=\"https://graphicriver.net/item/business-company-brochure/19266623\" rel=\"external\" target=\"_blank\">Business Company Brochure</a> (INDD)</h3><figure class=\"post_image\"><a href=\"https://graphicriver.net/item/business-company-brochure/19266623\" rel=\"external\" target=\"_blank\"><img alt=\"Business Company Brochure\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/65/posts/33931/image/Business%20Company%20Brochure%20graphicriver.jpg\"></a></figure><p>If you've got more content and photos to showcase, this template is one of the highly recommended informational brochure examples that you can conveniently use.</p><h2>7 Proven Tips for Making Great Company Marketing &amp; Sales Brochures</h2><p>Now that we’ve covered a variety of diverse marketing brochure templates, we’ll show you some creative and practical tips. Learn how to customize marketing brochures according to your branding needs. </p><p>The following section outlines how you can use your company brochure to make a lasting impression on your potential customers.</p><h3>1. Get Straight to the Point</h3><p>You may be tempted to list too many details on your marketing brochure because you don't want to miss any relevant information. However, this will do you more harm than good.</p><figure class=\"post_image\"><a href=\"https://elements.envato.com/company-trifold-brochure-vol-03-JKC72RT\" rel=\"external\" target=\"_blank\"><img alt=\"Company Trifold Brochure Vol 03\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/65/posts/33931/image/Company-Trifold-Brochure-Vol-03-Envato-Elements.jpg\"></a><figcaption>A good layout can help you stay on track when writing your content. This <a href=\"https://elements.envato.com/company-trifold-brochure-vol-03-JKC72RT\" rel=\"external\" target=\"_blank\">Company Trifold Brochure Vol. 03</a> is one of the great examples of marketing pamphlets that'll simplify your content structure.</figcaption></figure><p>Too many details can cause information overload. This can also confuse your readers and steer them away from your main points. As much as possible, focus on one main objective for your marketing brochure and then build your content from there.</p><h3>2. Know Your Customers</h3><p>To deliver a powerful message that catches attention from your target audience, you must really know who your customers are and what they're looking for. Insights about customers will help you determine the purpose of your campaign’s brochure and guide you through the content and design.</p><p>For example, if your company sells high-end smart toys for children, you'd likely want to target educated, young to middle-aged parents who can afford the products and advocate the idea of helping children learn while they play with toys. The better you know your audience’s personas, the better you can design graphics and messages that resonate with their problems and desired solutions. </p><h3>3. Write an Impressive Headline</h3><p>No one will continue reading the contents of your company brochure if the headline on the front page doesn't stir the readers' interest. Why bother creating a brochure if your readers will just read the front and then discard it? This is why it's crucial that you captivate your audience right away with an impressive headline.</p><figure class=\"post_image\"><a href=\"https://elements.envato.com/brochure-company-bi-fold-ND7LEU\" rel=\"external\" target=\"_blank\"><img alt=\"Brochure  Company Bi-Fold\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/65/posts/33931/image/Brochure-Company-Bi-Fold-Envato-Elements.jpg\"></a><figcaption>The headline from this <a href=\"https://elements.envato.com/brochure-company-bi-fold-ND7LEU\" rel=\"external\" target=\"_blank\">Brochure – Company Bi-Fold</a> template is a perfect example of a captivating headline that'll hook your audience from the very beginning.</figcaption></figure><p>An effective headline must capture the interest of your target audience and address their key problems. Many company brochures make the mistake of just putting the company's basic information on the front page.</p><h3>4. Use Simple Words</h3><p>Avoid using big words when crafting your company brochure. You don't have to impress your readers with words that are hard to understand.</p><p>Simple words are highly recommended because they're easier to digest. The faster your readers can grasp your ideas, the faster you can convert them as well. If your readers don't comprehend your content, you're wasting not just their time but also your money.</p><h3>5. Don't Forget the Basics</h3><p>Because your main focus is to stand out, you might omit the basics when creating a company brochure. Make sure that pertinent information like company name, business address, logo, and at least two modes of contact information, preferably email address and phone number, are included.</p><figure class=\"post_image\"><a href=\"https://elements.envato.com/company-profile-business-brochure-Y9YP5E\" rel=\"external\" target=\"_blank\"><img alt=\"Business Brochure Examples\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/988/posts/33931/image/business%20brochure%20examplesa.jpg\"></a><figcaption>Here's one of the <a href=\"https://elements.envato.com/company-profile-business-brochure-Y9YP5E\" rel=\"external\" target=\"_blank\">best business brochure examples</a> from Envato Elements, with contact information on the back cover.</figcaption></figure><p>Aside from the basic company information, it's crucial that you add at least two or three brief sections about the benefits or solutions that your products or services can offer.<br></p><p>People are interested to know how your company can solve their problems or how can you make their lives a lot easier with your offerings. You should outline your benefits in easy-to-read blocks so your readers can digest them faster.</p><h3>6. Impress With Big Numbers</h3><p>Numbers don’t lie. Numbers strike people with unrealized truths and do a good job of convincing people to take action. Your marketing brochure is a direct weapon in your go-to-market strategy, so why not add some striking numbers that address the need for your products?</p><p>Find a big number that'll surprise your audience. Present it crystal clear on your brochure. Then, put it alongside your products or services as a catalyst for the urgent need for a solution.<br></p><h3>7. Add Stunning Photography</h3><p>It's also recommended to add photos of your products if you've got physical products to offer. Using hero images is also a great way to showcase your services.</p><p>For example, if you're a restaurant, at least include photos of your most popular dishes in your company brochure. Using the <a href=\"https://elements.envato.com/brochure-restaurant-tri-fold-2ZT8CD\">Brochure – Restaurant Tri-Fold</a> template, you can add your own photos to capture your audience easily.</p><figure class=\"post_image\"><a href=\"https://elements.envato.com/brochure-restaurant-tri-fold-2ZT8CD\" rel=\"external\" target=\"_blank\"><img alt=\"Brochure  Restaurant Tri-Fold\" src=\"https://cms-assets.tutsplus.com/uploads/users/65/posts/33931/image/Brochure-Restaurant-Tri-Fold-Envato-Elements.jpg\"></a><figcaption>This small company marketing brochure features stunning food images.</figcaption></figure><h2>Learn More About Brochure Design<br>\n</h2><p>If you're new to brochures and design software, creating the best company brochure can seem like a complicated task. But don't stress—I'll share with you some useful resources for your next brochure design project.</p><p>Even though there are plenty of design packages you can use, Adobe InDesign is usually a great choice, since it was built especially for print design. If you choose to use this one, we've got these awesome courses you can view:</p><ul>\n<li>\n<strong>Complete guide: <a href=\"https://design.tutsplus.com/series/brochure-design-templates--cms-1312\" More Brochure Templates<br>\n</h2><p>Now, you've seen our best company brochure templates and great tips and resources on brochure design.
